Reviews.Title: “Not a luxury resort”
Reviews.Author: BC-Westcoaster
Reviews.Content: We were so disappointed with this place. Perhaps we had set our expectations too high based on all the great reviews both here and in guidebooks, and on the exhorbitant cost, but this is simply not a place we would go back to or recommend. We drove up to the hotel and were directed to leave our car and go to a desk, where the first thing we were asked to do was sign a waiver saying that if anything happened to us on the property we wouldn't sue them. Not very welcoming, to say the least. We were then escorted to our room. While huge, with a view of the ocean and a tray of snacks and drinks awaiting us, it was also extremely basic. The bedding was worn and stained, and the mattresses were in need of replacement. The couch and chairs were dirty - we didn't want to sit on them, and in fact placed towels on them before we did. There was very little lighting in the room, and after dark the only place light enough to read was at the dining table. The baseboards were peeling away from the walls. The rooms are just so tired and in need of serious refurbishment. The place is filthy and falling apart. The grounds of the hotel are lovely, though the "infinity" pool is just a regular pool filled to the very edge. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Hana is a beautiful place and I would recommend that anyone driving "the road to Hana" stay in Hana for at least a night or two, but I would recommend they save their money and stay in one of the local B&Bs instead of the Travaasa Hana.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but missed opportunities”
Reviews.Author: hillcntrytraveler
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Travaasa Hana and while overall it was a good stay, the whole place just misses the mark in terms of luxury. We had wanted to stay in Hana because on other trips to Maui, we did the usual hurtle down the Road to Hana in a day and never got to see the local sights. After staying at Travaasa, our feeling was that they are wasting an opportunity to provide a truly spectacular hotel/spa experience. The hotel was apparently allowed to fall into some disrepair by its previous owners and is in need of some basic TLC and room updating. I'm referring to things like the need to repair and paint some rotted wood siding (not just apply a layer of fresh paint over the rotted wood), some small plumbing fixes in the rooms, fixing cracked and probably rotted plaster in the room, the pools were a little dumpy and the tennis courts were a joke. Our room could have used a better mattress. When you pay this much for a room the mattress should be at least as comfortable as one at a Holiday Inn Express, but ours was a bit saggy. The place just needs some freshening up not a complete remodel. While they're at it, it wouldn't hurt to have a TV in each room. I know they are trying to create a spa-like experience where you supposedly shouldn't care about TV watching, but in the evenings in Hana, there isn't a whole lot to do. Besides that, I felt very cut off from the outside world and this doesn't make me feel relaxed, it makes me anxious because I want to know what is going on. It would have been nice just to be able to watch the local weather and find out if it was going to rain the next day (answer--yes). Now the pluses for Travaasa. The everyday upkeep of the place is meticulous. The huge staff does a great job of keeping everything clean, even to the point of picking up the leaves that have fallen off the trees from the last rain, so guests won't slip on them. The rooms are very clean and it is a nice touch to have the welcome basket of fruit and free drinks in the frig--no mini-bar charges! The entire staff was friendly and efficient. We had a junior suite and our package included breakfast, and after reading some other posts on this site, I was apprehensive about the meal. I needn't have been concerned--the breakfast was excellent and the service very fast. The food was quite good (pancakes with strawberries were very tasty and had a huge helping of berries, not just one or two) and the view from their restaturant in the morning was outstanding. We didn't eat there for lunch or dinner so we can't speak for those meals. The grounds are just beautiful and wonderfully maintained, like a big tropical sanctuary. They have an activities center where you can borrow boogie boards, snorkel gear and more, then they have a shuttle bus that takes you to Hamoa Beach 5 minutes away. Your room key also gets you into some private bathrooms/showers at Hamoa and while we were waiting for the shuttle bus to pick us up, the attendant at Hamoa brought us some bottled water. They really do pamper you at Travaasa. We did not do any of the spa activities, as we were staying there just as a local spot to explore Hana, not to go to a spa. So if we had availed ourselves of those services I'm sure I would be raving about it, as all their other things were first rate. But as I said, some capital investment in refurbishing the rooms would have made this a 5 star plus experience. If you choose not to eat at Travaasa your dinning options in Hana are extremely limited. Even the grocery stores there are very inadequate. We ate lunch one day at a spot on the road to Hana, at least 5 miles before you get to Hana--Island Chef, a small one man operation in a trailer. There are a couple of other restaurants in the same area. Look for it on the left side of the road as you are approaching Hana. Island Chef was very good--mostly Asian entrees with a good variety and large portions. Don't know if they were open for dinner or not. There was also a plate lunch place a couple hundred feet down the road from Travaasa near the little market but we didn't eat there although it smelled great. On our way to Hana the first day, we stopped in Paia and went to Mana Foods, a small but nice grocery, and purchased some really good sandwiches and cookies. That was dinner for the evening. A travel tip--if you have room in your suitcase bring along one of those collapsable insulated bags that we all seem to have. It is great for bringing along a sandwich or just a cold drink as you're driving around or at the beach. Hana is a beautiful place and worthy of an overnight stay but may be a bit too slow paced for many. Prepare to take it slow and easy, which might not be relaxing for some. And I sure wish they would take care of the deferred maintenance and make this place into a true paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven at the Travaasa Hana Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IUJHU
Reviews.Content: We visited Maui in early February for 10 days. After spending several days in the very busy Kaanapali resort area, the Travaasa Hana hotel and Hana itself were really the perfect antidotes to an unexpected frustration with traffic and congestion in Maui as well as the impersonal feel of our first hotel. The setting for the Hana hotel is magnificently beautiful, quiet, peaceful, and restored our memories of Hawaii from 25 years ago, when we last visited for our honeymoon. Every staff member was considerate and friendly, in a genuine and welcoming manner. We only wished we had booked more than one night there. The room was lovely and we had the garden view cottage, but we still had a partial view of the ocean. in our room, we were greeted with banana bread, fruit, sparkling wine, in honor of our 25th anniversary. Though we stayed in both the Kaanapali and Wailea areas during this trip, I only felt truly relaxed here in Hana. I will never forget the stroll there on the grounds of the Hana hotel near the Sea View cottages overlooking the bay. If there were other people staying at the hotel, we hardly saw them. It was so tranquil. We, like others, were surprised by the no tipping policy but it helped with the ability to unwind since we weren't always fishing for dollars in our pockets. That said, the staff was terrific. We were told by a staff member that Hana and its residents have been able to preserve the magnificent beauty of Hana because there is a strong town council which has been able to prevent development. Long may their town council reign!

Reviews.Title: “Worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: Audreyisadorable
Reviews.Content: Beautiful large property, wonderful accommodations, good food. The staff was outstanding. Every person on the property was friendly, informative, and seemed happy to be working there. Very ubusual, in my experience. Beautiful grounds.So glad we drove the Road to Hana and stayed here! So many people go back and forth in one day. What a missed opportunity to visit this resort and spa.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with Travaasa Hana!”
Reviews.Author: AZCO51
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hana-Maui Hotel many years ago and we recalled the beauty and peacefulness of the Hana area and the resort hotel. For this reason we were really looking forward to another visit in February 2012. When we made our reservations, we learned about the new ownership and management by Travaasa. We were somewhat apprehensive about the changes that the new management company might have made. We are not against change, but with a special place like Hana it is extremely important to make changes very carefully and maintain the really good things about the resort. It was such a relief when we arrived and felt the same warm Hawaiin reception. This lasted throughout our stay (four nights). The beauty of Hana combined with a first class hotel and staff...what a great combination! As for our accomodations, we stayed in a Sea Ranch Cottage. It was very private and quiet with an excellent view of the ocean. The cottage was spacious and clean. The ocean breezes kept everything cool and comfortable day & night. We had a hot tub on the deck. The hot tub was clean (maintained daily) and was nice and toasty/hot when we used it each evening. We were also pleasantly surprised at the "no-tipping" policy, however, it was sometimes difficult to hold-back since the staff were so helpful and friendly. We hope the staff have not seen a negative income impact and that they are truly being compensated through the room rates. Congratulations to Travaasa on making a great transition! We wish you tremendous success---and fun with your new endeavor!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getaway!”
Reviews.Author: cmsymonds
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights here to celebrate our 13th anniversary (and much-needed R&R). The welcome was truly one of aloha, and the staff throughout our stay showed true "aloha spirit." We stayed in the Sea Ranch Cottage with Spa/Hot tub. The spa was obviously not cleaned prior to our arrival (worker came the next morning to clean it), but the cottage was otherwise clean, neat, spacious, and comfortable. On the kitchen table were fresh fruits, chocolate chips cookies, and a small loaf of banana bread (the banana bread was moist and delicious!). There was complimentary water, canned juices and sodas. The bathroom was wonderful! I thoroughly enjoyed the soaking tub. There's not many eateries to choose from close by - there were some places I would have liked to try, but they kept odd hours. So we mostly ate at Hana Ranch Restaurant (short walk/drive from the hotel) and the hotel's Kauiiki restaurant. Both places were pricey, but we were pleased with the fare. At the Spa, we enjoyed the steam room and cold-plunge pool, and the Couple's Massage. The facilities were clean and well-decorated. There was no t.v. (something my husband got used to) and it rained off and on during our stay there, but with the privacy and being away from the busy-ness of daily life, we got to truly rest and relax, and enjoy each other's company.

Reviews.Title: “A unique Hawaiian experience”
Reviews.Author: Alo99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our honeymoon on Maui and prearranged our entire stay at the Four Seasons in Wailea. After driving to Hana and seeing the Travaasa Hotel Hana, we wish that we would have arranged part of our stay for the eastern part of the island too. We drove the Road to Hana and stopped at the Travaasa Hana for lunch. We were very impressed by the resort and found that it blended in very well with its natural setting. The feel of the resort is much different than that of the large resorts like the Four Seasons and reminded us a lot of the understated elegance of the Post Ranch Inn in Big Sur. Lunch was excellent and afterwards, we participated in one of the activity programs where they teach guests traditional Hawaiian throw net fishing. Our guide, Andrew, was full of colorful stories about the local flora and fauna and trained us in the lost art of throw net fishing. After some practice on the hotel grounds, we took a short walk down to the beach and tried our luck in the ocean. Although we were unsuccessful in catching anything, the experience was very unique and memorable. The resort is very different from our experience at the Four Seasons and we definitely plan to spend a few nights at the Travaasa Hana when we return to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, but public ball park makes it very loud”
Reviews.Author: Meechan2
Reviews.Content: First the positive: Beautiful property and lovely views from the gated area. Nice yoga to start the day and the pool is awesome also... Right next to the beach and very relaxing. Very nice greeting staff and well manicured grounds. The bad: the rooms not next to the ocean are right next to a Public baseball park... No kidding! Teenage buys were playing baseball till 10.30 at night the day we reached and started again at 7.30 the next day. After the game was over they were blowing loud horns to celebrate. Is that really what you want when you pay almost $400 a night? Not a relaxing experience. We called to complain about the noise and they didn't even offer / were willing to move us, even though we knew there were empty rooms elsewhere. Overall service at restaurants ranged from very average to good sometimes. If you are planning to visit... Call ahead to find out about game schedule. If there are no games i would highly recommend for a couple of days I wouldn't plan a long trip here given the food options.

Reviews.Title: “A view of paradise”
Reviews.Author: travelerpdx38
Reviews.Content: Here is the infinity pool with real aloha. The pool looks out to the Pacific Ocean channel between Maui and the Big Island, Hawaii. Often in the channel whales and their calves frolic during the winter months. Plovers from Alaska stop at poolside as they fatten up before their long flight back to Alaska in the spring. Swaying palm tree surround the pool. What more could a stress out mainlander want?

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Hana!”
Reviews.Author: Joey A
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from an amazing six day stay at Travaasa Hana. The lush scentic winding road of the Hana highway was a perfect introduction to the beauty of Travaasa. When we entered we were struck with the natural beauty of the setting and the careful placement of the facilities. But this was only the begininning of the delights to come. After being at Travaasa for just a few hours it became obvious to us that the staff represented a unique community of workers who not only loved their jobs and derived great pleasure serving their guests, but many are descendants of former emplyees.They generously shared their knowledge of the history and the culture of the island with all of us who came to this magical place. Haunani, Hoku and Leilani at the front desk kindly explained some local customs and recounted numerous fascinating Hana stories. Gabriel warmly showed us around the grounds and Hubert regaled us with Hana legends and the intriguing history of the property. Netfishing with Andrew was not only a physical experience, it was an historical experience and with my lack of throwing skills, it soon became a hysterical experience. My daughter had a spa treatment called The Journey with Liza and she said,"it was beyond incredible!" Travaasa Hana is a taste of how life once was, but that taste is offered in rich modern comfort. True, there are no TV's or AC's but I found that to be a delightful change from the hustle and bustle of life on the mainland. We found that a week at Travaasa with all of the numerous amenities was an opportunity to refresh and renew ourselves. It was truly painful to leave; we spent most of our trip back plotting a way to return!

Reviews.Title: “The Most Authentic of All”
Reviews.Author: MarSonoma
Reviews.Content: We have returned to Hana for 45 years consecutively, always staying at the Hotel Hana Maui, now called Travaasa Hotel Hana. Besides being a place of old Hawaii, the music, dance is the finest--offered with beauty, warmth, kindness of spirit--along with each member of the staff. Management is fine, food is finally wonderful with fresh local produce and local fish (mahi, opakapaka, ono), cooked with lovely sauces. We would return over and over and over again to the beautiful people of Hana, with the hotel at its hub.

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant Pricey and Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: chchp
Reviews.Content: We were staying elsewhere but stopped for a late evening dine after our casual and delightful drive on the Hana Highway. The reputation for decor and ambience of the Travaasa is well earned, but our dining experience fell well short: The ceiling fans were set at a high enough setting that we were all chilled and it took three requests to get them turned down, as we waited too long until our food was served. Though the waiter apologized for the delay saying "I was not happy with the size of the portions," our dishes arrived no longer hot. The dishes were sufficiently imaginative or well prepared to justify the very high price. I have enjoyed to all levels of travel, from backpacking to 5-star luxury; Maybe this was an "off night" for the dining hall and our waiter, bu this experience was disappointing and a poor value.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for Hubert!”
Reviews.Author: AmandaOD
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Travaasa. Our favorite staff person was Hubert. A truly delightful gentleman who tried to help us with anything and everything! Thank you Hubert. Overall it was a good could have been Great visit. We were a little surprised to see a young toddler in the gorgeous pool and hot tub with only a cloth type swim suit. Why wasn't the family advised to use something which would be more absorbent? We were even more surprised to see the same toddler breastfeeding in the hot tub on multiple occasions. This is certainly not what we expected at such an exclusive resort, even in liberal Hana. After excellent spa services, we showed up for breakfast at 10:15 and were given serious attitude (breakfast ends at 1030). The young staff sighed and asked if we were in fact guests at the resort before we could be seated. The coffee service was slow and slow to refill. Although we were members of i Prefer we were sadly not upgraded and we know they were not at capacity. Nor were we informed of a early check in/late check out. All three would have been nice for our stay. Benefits- free valet (but at check out time they were too short staffed to help with our bags or the car), lovely bath soaps and products, in room coffee and treats, free classes, very nice spa. Negatives- toddler in swimsuit in the pool and hot tub, toddler being breastfed in the hot tub, no i Prefer benefits acknowledged, we did not stay long enough to enjoy the classes. Do yourself a favor and stay for more than 1 night. We did enjoy our stay and hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Not Really a First Class Experience -”
Reviews.Author: cr8it
Reviews.Content: Really? This hotel gets the top Conde Nast readers award for hotels in Hawaii? Either the hotel stacked the dec, or the readers were hypnotized by the beauty of Hana. Let me start by saying this hotel is probably at one of the most idyllic spots in the country. Hana is a gorgeous location, and the Hotel Hana Maui's Sea Cottages have to be one of the most beautiful places to situate a hotel. However, a great location does not a great hotel make, and on many other elements the hotel falls far short of expectations. We live on the island of Maui and travel extensively, so our perspective is both steeled by understanding the island culture and shaded by experiencing many of the great hotels around the world. If we start with the rooms (this is just a perspective on the Sea Cottage rooms), their location is picturesque, however, the rooms are a bit threadbare. The fabric on the sofa and the chairs is stained and extremely well worn (not at all what one would expect at a four or five star resort). The room is nicely appointed, but definitely dated and in need of renovation. We understand the hotel is under new ownership, and the new owner has been refurbishing some of the cottages. The ocean is hard on wood and metal, and indeed there were rotting floor boards on our Lanai (making standing out on the Lanai somewhat perilous), windows with rotted frames and shutters, and a refrigerator with shelves that the salt sir had rusted to scrap status (again, living on the island we understand this, but it can be combatted). These are only a handful of observations regarding the fatigued condition of these cottages, and comes with the side bar that our bellman told us our cottage had been in the group that had been refurbished-he can't be serious. The only noted improvement (and believe me, we were looking) was the partial replacement of the steps leading up to our cottage, with a more durable wood replacement product. Not exactly our idea of a facelift or refurbishment-this seems more like a repair. The pool is pretty, and the policy change to the ranch cottages being an adult's only area (except for limited times of the year) is great (despite the fact that we saw people at the adults only pool with babies). The pool area however is populated by aged teak lounge chairs (several broken) with filthy cushions (again not what you would expect at a five, four or even three star resort). The small private hot tub located on the lanai of some cottage units is wonderful, and emptied and cleaned between guests; thank you . . . Since there is little to do in Hana except enjoy the location and local sight-seeing, the hotel has an activity center staffed with knowledgable long-time Hana residents. They are a delight to talk with, and can teach island crafts such as Lei making or Ukelele playing, and offer other activities such as a nature walk. There is also a "library" stocked with games, but alas, many of these reside in broken down boxes and having missing pieces, used up score cards etc. It is not such a long journey to the island Walmart or Kmart, that would prevent these from being replaced from time to time, and at a minimal monetary investment. Now let's talk about the restaurant - horrible, horrible, horrible! When the hotel was taken over by the current owner they decided they did not want to run the food side of the business, and contracted all of the food service at the hotel with Longhi's - a long term island restaurant firm. Unfortunately, Longhi's is known by most on the island for overpriced, poor quality, unimaginative food and lack-luster service - basically a tourist trap (look up the reviews for either their Lahaina or Wailea restaurants). In Hana, they have taken it to a new low. Their are basically two "real restaurants" in Hana, one at the hotel, and one at the ranch across the street. Both are run by Longhi's and are equally sub-par and overpriced. They also have a bar/lounge at the hotel called Paniolo Lounge (that serves exactly the same sub-par uninspired menu). Don't expect many choices - every day they offer the same five or six entree's (and only one fish item - on an island in the Pacific where fish is plentiful). Let me start with our breakfast on the first day. We paid extra for their breakfast package, and if you are going - pass. The first thing the waiter told us was what was not included with our package. One of these items was French Press coffee, but we ordered a pot anyway ($15). The first French Press was delivered to our table cool-and this is where the lack luster service piece comes in-the manager took the pot away and we thought she was going to have the coffee remade. Ten minutes later the waiter appeared and said "the manager told me there was an issue with the coffee." We explained it was cold and would like another (something we wrongly assumed the manager was handling). Ten minutes later our waiter arrived with another pot. This time the plunger had not worked, and the strong Hawaiian coffee we were hoping for was basically brown water. One would think if French Press was offered on the menu, someone on the staff would understand how it is prepared-not so. My wife ordered soft-boiled eggs, and two eggs were delivered in their shell, in a bowl (they claim on the menu they were "Maui-Fresh eggs" - they were not, they were mainland eggs stamped by a mainland producer...don't lie on the menu). However, the eggs were hard-boiled, and when we told the waiter he responded "All I do is put in the order, I don't make them." We asked that they be remade offering the suggestion that five minutes should be all that is required to prepare them properly. Our waiter returned with two more eggs - hard boiled eggs. We gave up on soft-boiled eggs from that point forward (but this gave new meaning in our mind to a chef that cannot boil an egg). On the second day I ordered the island pancakes (sans banana's - as they told my wife - "we are out of bananas"). We could not understand how a hotel in Hana could be out of bananas. Literally there are probably 25 banana trees on the property, and another dozen at every turn of the twisty road to the hotel. They also had two lugs hanging in the lobby for anyone (including the chef) to enjoy. Apparently no one on the staff, chef and manager included, thought there might be banana nearby in Hana, including their own lobby! My pancakes were delivered with batter still on the inside and the french toast my wife ordered arrived cool and only partially cooked; raw egg still evident,m as well as bacon that was cold (not cool). At this point I sought out the manager and complained to him. He had our food remade, but it came without a hint of an apology and he never checked on us - just bad service. On the third (and final) day when we ordered our breakfast we explained to our waitress exactly what we wanted (we made it simple; eggs over easy and toast), and that we wanted her to ensure that everything was hot - she did, and our final breakfast was good. What became clear to us was they had no food runners or method of informing the staff that an order was ready to be delivered. While this explains why all of our meals (and we do mean ALL, as our dinners were delivered cool or cold as well) it does not explain all of the other lapses from ill-prepared food, to poor service, especially from management. One of our evening meals was spent in the Paniolo Lounge where the bartender provided drink service to both restaurants (the lounge and the main restaurant) but also handled food service within the lounge. While it was quite obvious she was working her tail off, what she could not be was attentive. How could she be with having to handle so much on her own. We very much understood her predicament and made no complaints or demands of her other than placing and delivering our drinks and food. What was really unfortunate though was when she brought our check she said "I could have provided you better service had I not been so busy!". Too bad she felt she needed to say this and more to the point, where was her help? Oh, we know, it was the manager (different than we had seen before) who popped up to ask "how's everything?" but was literally turing away from us as we responded "fine"-clearly just going through the motions. W have been at many busy or understaffed restaurants where the manager is doing ANYTHING to ensure good service is carried out, from cleaning and setting up tables to taking orders, making drinks and running food. Apparently this manager did not think any of those things were important. Our experience at the ranch restaurant across the street was similar. We had one good lunch there, but returned on another day for drinks. We ordered their homemade lemon and limeade (delicious) with two shots of vodka. We received two badly watered drinks, and when I went to talk to the bartender, he menacingly said "are you questioning my pours?." When I said I was, he said, I don't know where you drink, but said he would add another shot if we paid for it. If you are counting, this would seem like we each had three shots of Vodka, which we did not. Fifty dollars later we left, each having one drink and feeling abused for the privilege of having a drink at the ranch restaurant. We would return to the hotel again, only because it is definitely one of the most beautiful places on earth and the ability to relax and do nothing is hard to top. However, we will not return until we hear that Longhi's has been replaced with a chef that at the very least knows how to boil an egg and service at these restaurants is vastly improved. A side note that the hotel staff is employed by the Hotel Travaasa itself (unlike the food and beverage staff who are employed by Longhi"s) and were very friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Travaasa Hotel Hana EXCELS in all. Truly a first class experience.”
Reviews.Author: luvturquoisesea
Reviews.Content: Well we were not going to stay here at first, due to the expense and remote location, but our friends talked us into it and I can honestly say, it was the best hotel experience we have ever had. From the moment we checked in with the beautiful lei reception and starfruit treats, to the friendly goodbyes we received from all the staff who knew us by name, the experience was five stars. We were in a garden cottage suite and it was beautiful. At first the lack of AC concerned me, but the ceiling fans were romantic and we was never uncomfortable. In fact the room temp was just perfect. Our living area was relaxing, the king size bed so comfortable with lots of soft pillows, and the daily Kona coffee for the in-room coffeepot was delicious! I loved all the little extras, free water in the fridge and sodas, the nightly bed turn down and notes for the next days activities, the fresh Hawaiian flowers on the table, and our patio overlooking all the graceful beauty of the grounds from our comfy lounge-chairs. We took the bikes out (free) for a spin, we took two yoga classes (free) overlooking the pacific from the yoga hut, we played golf (free) on the chip and putt, and, the best of all, the steam-sauna-plunge-jacuzzi experience (also free), and so private! We swam in both pools, so clean and at a perfect temperature, and we took a trip to the hotel's beach a mile away for some bodysurfing too (though you don't go to Hana for the beaches). We literally enjoyed every moment of our stay here. The staff are friendly and welcoming and eager to please and will go out of their way to help in any way they can. We ate at the restaurant on site twice, and although expensive by our normal standards, the food was better than any other you can find in Hana. We enjoyed our talks with Valerie and Darwin and although we didn't take advantage of the other offered activities, (ukelele lessons, lei-making, etc) they were there for the taking. This is a great couples getaway place where time seems to stand still. Go for it and treat yourselves!

Reviews.Title: “New name same fantstic place”
Reviews.Author: DaveKapolei_Hawaii
Reviews.Content: My only issue is they slightly changed the name by adding Travaasa to the original Hotel Hana Maui which it will always be for many of us. However the new owners have kept the best of the place and put new money into it and it is one of the best getaways on earth. I go there whenever I have guests and an always amazed. It is also one of the most romantic places you can fine. Bungalows overlooking the pacific with large lani and hot tub. Great food and fantastic spa. And the people are so genuine one knows there is something special about Hawaii

Reviews.Title: “perfect calm”
Reviews.Author: bcam79
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spent the first few nights of our honeymoon here, and it was quite a treat. We spent the first two nights in one of their Garden View suites; and the last two of our stay in one of their Sea Ranch cottages (didn't want to *completely* break the bank!). If you are looking to totally unplug, this is the place. It is definitely low-tech; and it seemed a little empty when we were there (though one of the staff members shared that they were at ~90% capacity - pretty crazy if so, because it felt like we pretty much had the place to ourselves - a good thing!)....but once you settle into the groove...it is incredible. Our rooms were airy and comfortable....almost felt like our own little tropical cottage :) We didn't mind the lack of AC - we had ample ventilation and the breezes were perfect. Again, we started in a Garden Suite, which was great. Peaceful room, tasteful tropical touches....hardwood floors...comfortable bed.....the onnnnly thing I could possibly note was that the bathroom *maybe* felt a bit "dated" - but really, it was spotless. This is not a complaint...I'm reaching for any sort of constructive criticism here :P From there, we moved on to our Sea Cottage, which aside from being larger & more stand-apart, came as part of an all-inclusive package - 3 meals (alcohol not included in that....) & one spa treatment per guest per day. I could also tell that the Cottage felt newer than the Garden View room - definitely a VERY nice interior. Again, same calm, tropical touches....but just felt a bit more up-to-date. And our view was right out to the sea :) We ate almost all meals of our stay at the restaurant, and it was quite delicious. It was kind of fun to get to return & try other items on the menu / return to things we had really liked before. I was ready to move on after our stay, but while we were there, everything was fresh & very well-prepared. Oh and - we also enjoyed the delicious banana bread left in our room (I make a mean banana bread, and this definitely impressed me!). Our one small issue - we did have a tiny ant situation on our hands at one point, but a quick call to the front desk took care of it right away. Definitely understandable when everything is so open....we didn't really mind at all. Spa treatments were top-notch. I can only speak of the lomi-lomi massage, which I got two days in a row (talk about spoiled :P). But the facilities are beautiful - each treatment takes place in its own little bungalow with a sliding glass door that opens to tropical foliage in the back. I had two different technicians; both were incredibly skilled & left me feeling refreshed. It was fun to be able to hang out after....not have to pay (well - at that moment :P), and be able to wander out & relax in their dipping pools....or on one of their chaise lounges immediately after the massage. That's how to emerge after a massage! Beyond that, we just really enjoyed the grounds - spread out across several acres, with lush, quiet landscaping.....tucked just a short bike ride from the Hasegawa General Store, among other landmarks....a short car ride (or - nice long walk) to the AMAZING Hamoa Beach (ack, we loved it so much, we never even tried the other beaches that you pass along the way! :P). Oh! And our last day there we checked out a couple bikes from the hotel (so fun!), biked around town & down to the bay, and picked up some *delicious* Thai food from the 'tent' by the school, just down the road from the hotel - I believe it must be this one: http://www.tripadvisor.com/Restaurant_Review-g60630-d1989754-Reviews-Thai_Food_By_Pranee-Hana_Maui_Hawaii.html A must-try. Seriously, if you are looking to unplug.....if you want to feel like you live in a piece of paradise....this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: alexandra a
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights during the Christmas season. The breakfast for two which was eggs benedict was $60. There were no clocks or radios in the room, some might consider that good. The workout room was a disaster. It had two bicycles, one not working, one severly impaired, 2 elypticals, 2 tread mills and that was it. There was a water cooler, no cups, 4 rows of ceiling fans, one row not working and unable to find the light switch. The hotel is nice but no comparison to the Ritz or the 4 Seasons, both of which we have stayed at. We would not return. AA

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting”
Reviews.Author: bez71
Reviews.Content: First, join the iPrefer program. It's free and will entitle you to early checkin/late checkout and upgraded room, all if they're available. I'm not sure why it's so easy to get a free upgrade, but you'll get a sea cottage for the price of the garden room. Plan to use the community tennis courts, just outside the hotel property (just over a fence from the hotel's courts). The hotels courts are not maintained and have moss growing in the corners. They're in rough shape. The community courts were in very good shape considering the amount of rainfall Hana gets. The resort is spread across a city street, so if you're in the cottages/adults part of the resort you'll have to exit a gate, cross the street, and reenter the property. Most resort amenities are in the garden part of the resort, not the ocean facing part. Call the front desk and they'll send a golf cart to pick you up. We stayed in cottage 209, beautiful view and the sound of the waves crashing into the rocky shoreline lulled us to sleep at night. The sound compares to wind gusting through leafy trees, only amplified. Our bed was not the most comfortable...but then what hotel bed is? The drain in the bathoom sink was stopped up with something. Other than that it was a great place to spend a night. We didn't like the selection of food on the dining room's menu so we went to the bar. Selection was light and not very good but we did all right. We played a board game at our bar table while a rainstorm soaked the outdoors and since the hotel was obviously far from capacity. Staff was friendly...Kelani and Shannon were very helfpful and friendly. Eddie was working the Hamoa Beach facility and was friendly and helpful to us. We were the only ones on the beach for a few hours...seriously, the only ones. Two local boys came to body surf but left after about 15 min and one local girl went out to snorkel for a few minutes but otherwise it was just us. Eddie was busy getting things cleaned up since the Travel Channel was checking in that day to film something for a few days. I don't know what it was or when it will air, maybe hotel management can respond to this so I'll know when to watch. We'd stay here again. Do Not buy the room rate that includes breakfast...we were struggling to even cover the cost and ordered things we just weren't interested in eating. Buy the cheapest room rate and then buy breakfast seperately. Sunrise from our deck was stunning. The infinity pool, heated, was tranquil and empty. The hot tub was hot and relaxing. We didn't check out the spa and didn't use the yoga/hula class space. Hotel really needs a AAA discount too. It got dark so early that some sort of in room entertainment would have been nice. I understand they're trying to keep the seclusion alive but if people want seclusion they can turn off their TV. And it was cool enough that a plunge in the pool after dark would have been a pretty cold venture.

Reviews.Title: “A heavenly spot”
Reviews.Author: SoniaTodorova
Reviews.Content: The five days we spent at Travaasa Hana were among the most memorable in our lives. From the moment we arrived, we fell in love with the place and the people there. The gardens and our cottage were beautiful. The staff were friendly, hardworking, attentive, and made our stay very special. We were pleasantly surprised to find ourself spending a good chunk of every day engaging in the exciting activities the resort offers such as daily yoga classes, archery lessons, tour of the gardens, and horseback riding trips to name a few off a long list of recreational and educational activities lead by experts. We learned a ton about the plants and the culture of the island from the local staff in an informal and fun setting. The staff of the Activities Office are amazing. They helped us out with anything from providing us with snorkeling equipment to giving us valuable advice about the area. We felt we could pop into the office anytime with any request. We had a spectacular time with Andrew, who knows everything about the plants on the island. On another occasion he took us net fishing. We had a fantastic time and we cannot wait to try our luck again. The resort's spa staff and facilities are also noteworthy. The massages we got there were not only enjoyable and relaxing, they were masterfully performed. Travaasa Hana is blessed by heavenly surroundings. The devoted local staff and the spectacular facilities outshine all expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic Hawaiian Experience!”
Reviews.Author: annieKnoxville
Reviews.Content: Travaasa Hotel Hana is the place to stay if you want a truly authentic Hawaiian experience. My husband and I stayed in one of the Sea Ranch cottages in December 2011. We both agree that our four night stay at this magnificent resort was the highlight of our 2.5 weeks spent in Maui. Because Hana is very isolated from the rest of Maui, it is the place to come if you want to experience relaxation, serenity, and natural beauty. The resort setting is beautiful, and the grounds are gorgeous and immaculately maintained. The infinity pool is in a lovely setting looking out to the ocean. One of the things we liked best about the resort was the staffâ€™s sincere aloha spirit. They remembered our names, always greeted us in a warm and friendly way, and went out of their way to make sure we were having an enjoyable and relaxing vacation. By the time we left, we felt like they were family. Our cottage was large, very clean, and had a lanai looking out to a spectacular view of Hana Bay. We thoroughly enjoyed drinking our cup of coffee each morning while watching the sun rise. There was also a great hot tub on the lanai. The bathroom was spacious and had plenty of towels, soap, bath salts, lotion, and body wash. The food at the resortâ€™s restaurant was very tasty, and the wine selection was good. The service was excellent, and the quality and presentation of the food was very good. We really enjoyed the live Hawaiian music played nightly during dinner. Some of the resorts many features include hammocks, fire pits at night, croquet, health classes, yoga classes, and tennis courts. My husband & I had an awesome lava rock massage at the spa. Hula, lei making, ukulele lessons, and horseback riding are also offered. There are many beautiful beaches and hiking trails close by to enjoy. I would highly recommend Travaasa Hotel Hana to anyone. After 4 nights at this resort, we felt a tranquility and relaxation that was a welcome respite from our hectic lives.

Reviews.Title: “New Ownership is Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Christopher M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2011. Let me start by saying that this is an absolutely beautiful property. We stayed in an oceanfront sea ranch cottage, and it was amazing. The food was good, and the staff were just so warm and friendly. And, now with the bad part. We'll never be welcome there again. We travel with a 3-year old, and March was one of the last times that families will be welcome in the Sea Ranch Cottage section of the property. In fact, they were in the process of walling off that section of the property from the rest while we were there. So, if you happen to be travelling with a child, you will not be welcome to swim in the infinity pool, and will be forced into the old decrepit "other" pool. You won't be welcome to enjoy the beautiful expansive lawn that fronts the Pacific. Nope, that part is behind the wall. You'll be sequestered to the sub-par rooms away from the ocean, and you won't be able to look upon the ocean unless you go to the restaurant. It's all very disappointing. We stayed there for 12 nights and we spent some serious money, but we won't be welcome back, unless we leave our child at home. Stupid, wrong-headed policy by management of a corporation who doesn't know Hana, and clearly has never bothered to visit. I wrote them a nice long email with my concerns. I got a prompt reply from the person in Hana who said they were forwarding it to the corporate office. Never got a reply after that. I only hope that Hotel Hana Maui will change ownership again soon or that it's current owners will change their anti-family policies.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic lunch”
Reviews.Author: Dustymiller44
Reviews.Content: We stopped in Hana and had lunch at the Travaasa hotel Whilst it is a little more expensive than the local restaurants the food and the service are first class. The restaurant overlooks the hotel grounds and is nice and peaceful- or at least it was until the gardeners decided to cut the grass right below the veranda! Nevertheless I would happily go back there next time we are in Ma

Reviews.Title: “Magical”
Reviews.Author: theodonisPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: Please stay here...if just for a night...it truly is Gods world up there. The food was wonderful..the staff like family. The pool the property...perfect. A great Getaway. peaceful! A must if you already doing the road to hana!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay but a couple of minor issues”
Reviews.Author: angcici
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Hana at the end of our honeymoon trip in Nov 2011. We actually arrived to the hotel on Thanksgiving afternoon. We initially passed the hotel on the road because we were looking for the Hotel Hana and nobody had informed us it changed names. Once there, we were able to check-in. We had the all inclusive package which included all meals and two activities per person per day. We got to our room and it was beautiful! Upon showering and getting ready for dinner, we walked to the restaurant to eat. Once there we were asked if we had reservations. Mind you it was 615 and we wer starving! We did not have reservations nor were we informed we needed reservations when we checked in about an hour and a half before. The restaurant had maybe 15 people there, so not sure why we even needed reservations, but whatever. We were told there would not be an open table until 8pm. I was more than annoyed because we had all inclusive so we have to eat there and we were not told about needing reservations. I complained and they did get us seated by 7pm, but still this was unecessary! All of our other meals were reserved and were quite tasty. I just don't understand why a resort that wasn't full would require this? Another snafu was our room being invaded by hornets, but we called maintenance and they took care of the problem. The last issue we had was our activities credits. They could only be used at spa or horse back riding. We got one credit each per day. My hubby wasn't much of a spa person so he wanted to go horseback riding. Now since we arrived Thursday evening we had to wait until Friday to book anything. Horseback riding was only Mon-Thurs! The other longer horseback riding trip was that morning and we wouldn't have enough time to get to the meeting spot. So all in all our credits didn't all get used which was a shame since we paid for them! The hotel is lovely, but some issues need to be ironed out because it is quite costly!

Reviews.Title: “Let's keep this in perspective.”
Reviews.Author: fidelrobert
Reviews.Content: I can tell by reading many of these reviews that they are aspirational. That is, they WANT the place to be good and are being positive about it. They've dropped a lot of money on the place (it is very expensive) and don't want to think they've spent all this money on a place that wasn't up to the cost. Or they did a honeymoon there and want to have positive memories. Travaasa is a good place. Unlike my own rating, though, it is not "very good." If I could give it a TripAdvisor 3.5 stars, that would be about right. I am giving it the benefit of the doubt with the "Very Good rating, but feel this is too generous. The best things about the place are that it is well located, the staff is friendly, they try hard to have good activities, the musician who sings in the restaurant and bar is a phenomenal local Hawaiian who sings his heart out, and you feel safe there. The "misses" are really in the details. For five days, we've had two light bulbs burned out and not replaced. And they are in obviously places (like one of two lights by the bathroom sink). The shower nozzle fitting is rusted beyond belief and you can see where the pipe goes into the wall with a huge hole in it (is this where the gekkos keep coming in?). Oh, and gekkos. There are little gekko droppings that don't get cleaned up. The countertops of the table and bar area have not been cleaned at all. Door handles have been grimy. The inside of the refrigerator has never been cleaned and was dirty when we arrived. You get the picture. Just lack of detail. If I were the manager, I would schedule once a week detail inspections with the head of housekeeping and maintenance. Maybe five units each time. And give no exceptions to these kinds of things not getting addressed. The reason is simply: if Travaasa is going to charge as much as they do for rooms, they ought to be up to the test. Honestly, there are hotels and resorts that charge half as much and are twice as neat and clean. Someday, this is going to catch up with them. This is, as I said, a good place. I will stay here again. But these reviews posted recently about Travaasa--the ones that state the place is flawless as well as the ones giving it a "Terrible" rating--are just plain unreasonable. Go there and you'll be okay. You'll be warmly greeted, you'll be safe, you're in a great location, you can chill out pool side or at its beach nearby, the help desk will be generous with their time and smiles, there are a couple of good stores and restaurants nearby but off-property, and you will have a good experience most likely. BTW, the best place to eat in the area is Cafe Romantica. Open for dinner only, limited seating outdoors, but a short walk from Travaasa and spectacular food.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas dinner rip-off”
Reviews.Author: Reni C
Reviews.Content: US$350 for 2 people, for a dinner which was barely edible.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful peaceful location!”
Reviews.Author: BeachdaddyTucson
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel as a couple for a quiet few days. It was wonderful... We walked paths and grounds, ate wonderful meals ... My partner had some food restrictions, the head chef was very helpful in making sure these were met yet the food remained wonderfully tasty and well prepared. Staff were pleasant, kind, generous with their time and thoughtfulness. While there is a dedicated bus to take you to beach further down the coast, we had our own car and enjoyed the wonderful rural drives. Took me back to my much younger days growing up on an island! We were at an off time when the wonderful musicians were playing shorter shows ... could have enjoyed the music from dawn to dusk. This is a wonderful getaway location and recommend it for anyone looking for total relaxation. The "cabins" were wonderful and we enjoyed sitting on the lanai looking at the fields and surf ... hugely spacious, well maintained, well stocked. I think writing this has made me want to go back right now!!!

Reviews.Title: “True Realaxation”
Reviews.Author: chefmkon
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ©e and I stayed in one of the Sea Ranch cottages this past August. Our four night stay at this magnificent hotel was by far the best part of our two weeks spent in Maui. The room was exceptionally clean and perfectly positioned for the best sunrises the island has to offer. The bathroom was spacious and had everything you may need: spare towels, soap, bath salts, lotion and body wash. There was a great hot tub on the deck. That was a huge plus, especially after the daily hikes around beautiful Hana. During our stay we chose the Rack Rate package, which included all meals and complimentary 60 -minute spa services. The restaurant service was of course excellent and we always requested the same waiter (he is a native of Oahu, but spoke with a mid-western like accent-he is extremely attentive and you will thoroughly enjoy his services). The quality and presentation of the food was excellent -plus we could get as many courses as we liked! (I will review this separately.) The special amenities at Hamoa Beach are great. No need to bring much because the hotel supplies chairs, umbrellas, cold water, snacks and beach towels. The beach is usually very quiet and offers great sun all day. There is a great snack shop down the road a bit that sells a killer breakfast sandwich. Keep yours peeled for my Hana lunch spot reviews and pictures. The warm staff all around the hotel just made everything so easy and effortless- like a true vacation. We were always addressed by name, unlike other hotels which rarely happens unless you are â€˜specialâ€™. Well no matter whom you are Travaasa will indeed make you feel as if you are special, because they genuinely believe so. If you are lucky enough to find yourself in Hana, Maui, please put some money aside to spend a few days at the Travaasa. It is well worth it and will be a stay most memorable of your Hawaiian getaway.

Reviews.Title: “You will need to use your acceptance and open mindedness skills to enjoy yourself in poorer weather, here.”
Reviews.Author: ceftravels
Reviews.Content: This is a place that is special and it is different from most experiences you will have as a traveler and you may need to see that as a positive before you come here with expectations that it may be like an experience you may have had with other properties on the Conde Nast lists. Your money goes to your special opportunity to visit this exquisite property which is maintained to an extremely high standard. The organization and coordination of visitor services is in a learning curve at this time due to managerial choices which resulted in staff turnover. I believe that, in good weather, you really won't need to interface much with room service or activities coordination. Also, while there may have been staff weakness in those areas, these folks work with what they have, and, though disorganized, the staff here were always kind, sweet, and wanting to please. It is beautiful here like no other place.

Reviews.Title: “Crazy runaround with rates”
Reviews.Author: Astrotrotter
Reviews.Content: I've wanted to stay at this place since its heydey. So when we found a reasonable rate on their website, we totally jumped on it. My husband called and booked the room and then told me the totalâ€¦ which was 65% higher with taxes and fees. $131 in fees alone. (To be clear, this was for the garden studios, NOT the all-inclusive ranch rooms.) We assumed there had been a mistake. Maybe the rollaway was more than we thought? Maybe my husband had the wrong impression about the cost of the breakfast package they had talked to him about? What happened when we tried to sort the matter out with them was purely astonishing. The base rate kept changing, the math kept changing. When I showed the woman that our room rate plus the fees and taxes for the same room (as currently listed on the website) came out to $70 less than what they were saying, she said that in order to get those fees, I would have to pay a higher room rate! If we chose to forgo the breakfast package, we would have to pay a higher room rate. And then they started justifying raising the room rate by saying that our room rate was a "courtesy" normally only available by booking directly with AAA. (Totally untrue. Our room rate had been visibly available on the website, available to anyone.) We found the whole situation completely uncomfortable and ended up not staying there after all. So sad. I understand this resort was once quite something, and I genuinely hope this management (or the next) pulls it back together.

Reviews.Title: “Travel back in time and savor the experience!”
Reviews.Author: HonoluluHistorian
Reviews.Content: A business trip to Hana? I immediately booked a garden suite online at the Travaasa Hana Hotel and threw my gear in the car. What a turnaround this property has made over the past few years! Patrick at the bell desk, Kawika at the front desk, AND EVERYONE on this property made me feel like one of the family. A greeting basket of starfruit, avocado, banana bread and cookies was sent from the manager, and plumerias were placed on my pillow in the early evening. My room was quiet (no air conditioning units needed), breezy and clean. Dinner at the signature Kauiki Restaurant was wonderful! Of those in our party who chose fish, the seared ahi tuna main course was voted the best, the the New York strip second: all prepared with great attention to flavor and freshness. The white filet of anchovy Caesar salad, grilled scallops and ahi tuna served sashimi-style were spectacular starters. We had such a great time, I extended my stay a second evening, and we did it all over again!

Reviews.Title: “Serenity at the end of the Rainbow”
Reviews.Author: Kevin M
Reviews.Content: Beautiful tropical setting, direct view onto Hana Bay. Huge rooms. Beautifully, very comfortably furnished. Its decor, floors and fittings are very appropriate for this rustic, informal village. If you ask, you'll learn everyone in the hotel is connected everyone in the village. It's a long drive to anywhere, or anything. It takes only a few conversations to realize you are far from the "real" world. Hana is so unpretentious and fundamental that your "real" is where you are, not where you came from. We stayed there while visiting old friends from our "real" world. Our stay was about a week too short. It rains in Hana, usually at night, then clears during the day. Colors of water, rocks and vegetation are impossible to describe. The hotel's restaurant is apparently the only place for Dinner in Hana. Everything good, including their wine collection. You could say pricey, but really in the same range as comparable restaurants in Lahaina and Wailea. But an extra $25 for breakfast is too much atop the room rate. Sincere, congenial staff everywhere. Very fine Hana and Hawaiian selections in the Hotel's art gallery/shop. We have some of their artists' works in our home. Visit Hana Tropicals, an orchid farm nearby that can ship direct. Climb to Fagan's Cross, up hill on the hotel property for an excellent perspective on intimacy of Hana village and its spectacular setting.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation!”
Reviews.Author: javajlh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is so tranquil and the staff is friendly. This was a celebration for our 30th wedding anniversary. We received a cool towel and juice upon arrival and then we were swept away for a golf cart tour of the grounds. We stayed in the Garden suites and it was perfect. The room was spacious and stocked with juices, water and soda. There was also a bottle of champagne for our own celebration of our anniversary. Every room has its own lanai and small kitchenette with coffee and a coffee grinder for your morning coffee which you should definitely sip on your lanai in the morning (with the banana bread that is stocked in the room!). The pool and hot tub were wonderful. My husband and I had both of them to ourselves nearly every day. I assume people were just off exploring the island. We did explore in the morning, but the afternoon we relaxed by the pool. We didn't use the exercise facilities while at the hotel, but they were adequate for working out in. There is no beach at the hotel, but we knew that going into this trip. It did not take away anything from this experience. You can still stroll along the ocean front. The red sand beach is something to climb down to see. We were treated to a nightly turn down service. A lovely note and flower were left by our bed and our towels were freshened and bathroom cleaned up. This was in addition to the daily maid service to clean the room. My only complaint about the hotel is the food. The choices at the restaurant were limited and pricey. Breakfast was way overpriced with everything being ala carte. I would have liked to see a varying daily menu or some other options such as a daily special that was more reasonably priced. Lunch was okay. Dinner is limited to a few options, but like all of the other restaurants we ate at, salads were not included with the meal. The portions that were served were large and I had a hard time finishing my meal. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The tranquility and relaxation that my husband and I achieved while staying here was a welcome respite from our daily lives.

Reviews.Title: “Was very disappointed in the garden room.”
Reviews.Author: Brianhdallas
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a complete disappointment the room was tired and could have been clean but was not. Hair in the shower,stained floors (wood), rust on the half wall of Lani. This is not what dreams are made of but nitemares.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: seaturtledove
Reviews.Content: If you want authentic Hawaiin experience, this is the hotel for you! People say this hotel is expensive but it is really not when you look at what they include with your stay. As a family of 5 we stayed in a Garden Suite room with a beautiful veiw for $325 a night. Included with our room was a lot of services and amenities: Free hula and lei making lessons, free yoga classes, free use of the Spa for adults. They stocked our refrigerator every day with juices and sodas. The room included Kona coffee beans and a grinder for an amazing cup of fresh coffee. We had a lei greeting upon arrival. The hotel also has a "no tipping policy." They want you to feel relaxed and not nickel and dimed. - and parking is free too and no resort fees. The room and bathroom was large and comfortable for our family. Because it can get expensive for a family of 5 to eat out every meal we bought breakfast and sandwich stuff and stocked our fridge. The large counter area made it easy to prepare a meal. There are local fruit and banana bread stands In the area for in room breakfast options. There are about 5 places to eat in the area and Hana Store across the street has gourmet hotdogs and fresh chili. Don't let the road to Hana be a barrier to coming here. It is well paved and has metal guard rails on the cliff side and feels very safe. I have been on much more dangerous mountain roads in my home state of California. My kids loved the classes and the 2 pools, My husband and I loved the gorgeous, peaceful, relaxing environment. The hotel staff was warm, welcoming and accommodating. -They have the Aloha spirit! This very special hotel and the surrounding area is one of the last still truly Hawaiin places left. Be sure to take the 30 minute drive to the Natioinal Park, hike through the bamboo forest and to the 450 foot drop waterfall. The black sand beach is gorgeous too. We stayed 3 nights in October and did not see everything Hana had to offer. The book Maui Revealed will tell you all about the the wonderful natural places to discover. Hana and the Hana Hotel Travaasa will always hold special memories for our family!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but worth it”
Reviews.Author: hexene
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, a valet and bell person met us immediately. Our luggage and car were taken care of while we registered. We were given a cool washcloth to "freshen up" and some juice while we filled out the form. We were then escorted to our cottage (duplex). The whole property resembles one large garden. The bathroom was large and modern. The patio area was quiet and overlooked part of the garden. We had dinner in the hotel restaurant. The food was incredible. They have a room where you can check out books, games, etc. You can also check out bicycles to ride around the small town. The cost includes some gratuities, which made things easier. The only negative we found was that we did not have an ocean view. And, if you absolutely have to have a TV, then this is not the place for you. If you want romance, pampering or total relaxation, then it is well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Dream come true! Mahalo Hubert and Alana!”
Reviews.Author: EMJ10611
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I wanted to get married in Hawaii, but defiantely not at a big over rated resort with crowds of on lookers, and not on a typical beach setting. So my search continued...Until I came across "The Hana Wedding Company". All of my dreams came true. Alana helped with every detail, including suggesting the the most amazing hotel... Travassa Hana as an accomdation. Well it turns out it was also the most perfect place to have our private, romantic wedding ceremony on the black lava rocks over looking the waves crashing, with breathtaking mountain views and a horse pasture as our back drop...Where do I begin....First came Hubert , he is the hotels event coordinator...and honestly, i cannot put into words how wonderful he was. I wanted a private dinner after the ceremony and he created the most perfect intimate setting on our private lanai with hanging lanterns and candles paying attention to detail with perfect pink flowers leading from the entrance to the dining table. He wanted it to be a surprise for us...and boy was it..it brought tears to my eyes!We stayed at the Sea ranch cottages, and even though the price was higher, it was well worth it. There was breakfast included and it was so delicous. More food than my husband could finish... and lets just say he is a healthy eater! My wedding day was perfect thanks to the wonderfull Alana and her fabulous photographer Kaua! She created what we had only dreamed our wedding might be. From the beautiful wedding bouquet, to the musician and his ukele, and the fabulous Dots salon where i was placed into two lovely ladies hands and made beautiful for my wedding day! My hair and make up was done more professionally and elequently then even salons in the big cities back home...To top it off I was dying to have the beautiful horses in the background in the pasture...and of course Hubert pulled through again. I wish you folks could see the pictures. My words do this place and the staff that care for you no justice. You have to see for yourself. So get in your care and drive down the Hana highway and make sure you give yourself a whole day to see each inch of it beauty...and rent a convertable! We satyed for only a few days...This is the only place i would stay on Maui. And when we return it will be for at least a week! You could not possible see and experience all this island and town have to offer. And did i mention the spa...wow! Soaking in the out door rock hot tub over looking the ocean... amazing! To all of the people that took part in our day... Alana with The Hana Wedding Company, Kaua Photography, and Hubert Aarron with the Travassa Hotel, thanks you all for making our day even more perfect than we could have ever dreamed!!! Mahalo, M+E 10/2011

Reviews.Title: “Travaasa Hana.”
Reviews.Author: Terence K
Reviews.Content: This is our third trip to the property, and we stayed 3 nights this time, which never seems enough, even though we had spent a week over in West Maui. The new proprietors seem determined to keep the property unchanged, which we like. We recognized a waiter from ten years ago, and even he hadn't changed much, it must be the water. I tend to be pretty active, and took surfing lessons from a cousin of Andrew, one of the wonderful helpful staff, as well as boogie boarding at Koki and Hamoa beaches. I particularly like the pool and Jacuzzi facing the ocean, the view is world class, and on clear days you can see the big island in the distance. (About 35 miles). This time we took the coastal road that had been closed since the big earthquake, to get to the airport. I absolutely love this side of the island, the geology is fascinating and ever changing, and trying to figure out how it was formed is a lot of fun, and of course it is spectacular, no wonder Charles Lindbergh fell in love with it.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, incredible experience - which you pay for”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingBGs
Reviews.Content: Travaasa Hotel, which until recently was the Hana Hotel or Hotel Hana-Maui or something, is a very unique and incredible place: * Hana itself is a incredibly isolated on Maui - it feels worlds away from Wailea/Ka'anapali. There are like 2 hotels in the town, and few restaurants. If you are looking for a classic Hawaii beach/resort experience, or for convenience, Hana isn't for you. If you are looking to have some mega relaxation, unplug from the world, and enjoy incredible, unspoiled natural beauty, Hana is for you. * The "Travaasa" experience is designed 100% around relaxation, serenity, and natural beauty. The grounds are gorgeous and immaculately maintained, the setting so beautiful, and the activities that the hotel provides are fun and relaxing. The pricing is also designed around relaxation and peace of mind (more below) * Quick hits on what you can do at Travaasa and Hana: - Awesome beach that is a 5 minute drive or hotel shuttle from the hotel. Hamoa beach is rad though - All kinds of fun hotel activities (croquet, bike riding, hiking, ukelele lessons, lei making, etc etc) These are all free/included - Awesome, top notch spa - Beautiful infinity pool - Great restaurant, which if you get the 'sea cottages' will be 100% free/included All this great stuff comes at a pretty stiff price however. The regular rooms are in the 300-400'ish range, but then all meals/spa are extra, and breakfast averages like $25, lunch like $30-40 (including a drink or two), and dinner will be like $100 (with 1 app, 2 drinks - all per person). On the other hand the sea cottages are all inclusive, and for 900-1500 PER NIGHT (!!!) you get 100% of meals included and 1 spa treatment per day. Obviously $1K/night is incredibly expensive. But what you get for that is 100% peace of mind ... you don't have to worry about a single meal, paying for the spa, and they even have a very strict no tipping policy - everything is 100% included and you can worry about just relaxing. Additionally you get to stay in these very cute 'cottages' right by the beach. Other little issues to note about the hotel, which I don't consider a big deal at all, but that you should be aware of before booking are: * It can be a bit buggy. There will be the occasional ant attacks in the room. But these are quickly cleaned up by the staff, and it really isn't a big deal. That comes with the fact that the property is in a very unspoiled, beautiful, natural location * There is no sand beach right by the property. Hamoa beach is very beautiful and fun, but it is a short drive (they have a free shuttle, or you can easily drive in 5 minutes) away. * If you want multiple restaurants or any kind of 'night life' Hana is not for you * Getting to Hana takes 2.5-6 hours depending on if you stop (which you should, the road to hana is gorgeous!) and is a bit difficult - you'll hear the stat '600 turns and 30 1-lane bridges' - so if you are worried about a difficult drive, be forewarned - but the drive is perhaps the most beautiful drive you'll ever take in your life! So that's the skinny - unique place, gorgeous unspoiled natural beauty, immaculately maintained hotel, pure relaxation ... but at a very steep price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, many changes”
Reviews.Author: dimitri7777
Reviews.Content: We had originally stayed here back in 1994 and still have the unopened shampoo and conditioner from that visit adorning our guest bathroom, a vintage Hawaiian scene printed on each one. Compare that with the generic options this trip with just the Travaasa Hana stamp on each item. Times change and this hotel has gone through a bunch of them. But there was no way we'd miss Hana and an extended stay in town seemed like the perfect way to end out visit to Maui. We booked a garden cottage for 3 nights in August. We had some kinks, slow toilet needed snaking, a light switch needed replacing, our friends' screen door was a piece of work. However, each call to the front desk was responded to immediately and each problem resolved promptly. Frankly we experienced fantastic service from the entire staff our whole stay. We got into the Hana mood and spirit within a couple hours of checking in. Quiet, serene and languid. Perfect. We enjoyed the infinity pool and hot tub overlooking the ocean, ate our banana bread and fruits, courtesy of the hotel, ordered pool side frozen drinks and plotted our days in Hana. We did so little. We loved the hotel, the grounds and the offerings, free Ukelele lessons, hula lessons, cold plunges at the spa, 3 hole golf, lawn croquet with the kids, tennis (courts need fixing up a bit). Not crazy about the $10/adult/day resort fee but that was in lieu of tipping. Mini fridge stocked with water and soft drinks; call to replenish and there's a knock at the door with drinks (though soft drinks aren't cold, no big deal). No TV, no internet, no clocks in the cottages help restore and rejuvenate the soul. A great large bathroom with separate shower and a tub with outdoor views. Large unit with two queens and a sofa by the kitchen area. Large patio facing the interior lawn. Hiked to the red sand beach (what a difference, the trail is quite dangerous now, wear good shoes), drove to Hamoa beach though the hotel offers a shuttle service; they have facilities there and can provide you with beach chairs, bought avocados and apple bananas at the farmer's market for breakfast. That's about it. Ladies checked out the spa offerings one afternoon. So, if you want action, don't come to Hana and don't stay here. Visit for the day and head back before it gets dark on the "highway". But if you want to truly get into the spirit of the land spend a couple nights here, turn off the iphone and soak it all in. You'll be so glad you did, even if you encounter a few bumps on the way.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful lodge, but not perfect ... (+ some tips)”
Reviews.Author: talula001
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a wonderful stay at the Travaasa Hana hotel. Let me first make clear that we love to travel in hotels recommended by Conde Nast, Kiwicollection or SLH, and we have travelled extensively over the world in many, many high end lodges & resorts. Hana was high on our list. Now looking back to it, I loved it, but there were some issues. The main advantage of the lodge is it's peaceful location in the sleepy town of Hana. This is the Hawaii everyone should see (not the mega-resorts). I would recommend everyone to stay 3 nights as this is long enough to come to peace and take in the environment (any longer would cause boredom). The lodge is composed of garden suites (located around a well manicured garden) and after crossing a small street you enter the second part of the lodge with the ocean view cottages. It is here that the beautiful infinity pool & hottube can be found. We were first located in a garden suite, but were moved for our 2nd and 3th night to a ocean-view cottage. They are totally different, and I would highly recommend everyone to book an ocean-view cottage : these cottages are nicier decorated, have softer and thus better beds, have large terraces, and some come with private outside hottubes. At night, you can leave your window open and listen to the surf. The hotel and its environment are so peaceful you will forget all stress in a split second. Food at the hotel was pricey but good. Staff was wonderful and always helpful. Nevertheless, there are some issues that need to be addressed (and these are the reasons why I did not rate this hotel as excellent) : (1) we were with 3 friends, so we requested a rollaway bed in a 2 queen sized room. However, the quality of the rollaway beds that were provided were horrible. A very thin matras, so impossible to sleep at all. They dropped the charge of 50 US $ per night for the rollaway which was the right thing to do. (2) the extra price for a 3th person in the room was 140 US $ (excluding breakfast). This is the highest we ever encountered in any luxury hotel so far, and definately the highest we encountered in Hawaii (for comparison : St Regis princeville and Four Seasons Maui ask 100 US for a 3th adult). (3) The hotel is now part of the Prefered Hotel Group, so we booked the room with our I prefer number. When member of the latter program (free), complimentary room upgrade wil be provided at check-in when available. An upgrade was not offered to us, and we were very disappointed that night to find out that less than 50% of the hotel was full. The next day, we were granted an upgrade due to a big insect in our room that freaked out one of my friends. (4) breakfast is good, but ... before arrival, I changed our rate to a breakfast including rate because I was worried that breakfast would be to expensive when ordering a la carte (after reading reviews on tripadvisor). The difference for a room (for 3 adults) with and without breakfast was 96 US $. When breakfast was included, you could choose from a juice, coffee, and one entree. I was rather disappointed to find out that eating a la carte would have been a better deal after all, as our breakfasts never reached 96 US $ a day. I do not understand why the hotel offers a breakfast including pakkage, when eating a la carte is cheaper. I would recommend them to lower either the price of their included breakfast, or make the breakfast a free choice option (choose whatever you want as is done in many high end hotels). (5) the temperature in the hottube should be warmer (was opinion of all guests the days we were there) (6) be prepared for rain, lots of rain, as this is the wet part of Maui. Because of the climate, in room televisions/internet should be a nice touch, although I understand and respect the management's decision to keep the cottages free of electronics. TIPS : - try the Thai luch around the corner of the hotel : DELICIOUS - visit ÅŒheâ€™o Gulch at HaleakalÄ� National Park, as well as make the 2 hour trail to the waterfall there

Reviews.Title: “The real and relaxing way to do Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: surf949
Reviews.Content: The hotel is going through some bumpsintheroad as part of an ownership transition, yet it remains a prime destination to unwind, relax and serves as a luxe base from which to explore one of the increasingly rare unspoiled corners of the Hawaiian Islands. The setting, service, food, specialty tours, and cultural programs are all first rate, and are sure to satisfy anyone looking for the Hawaii that existed and still exists beyond the modern glitz. It rains a lot, but usually not too much. There is no beach right at the resort, but a short shuttle ride brings one to a wonderfully fine-sandy pocket in an otherwise rugged coast; rated as one of the nicest beaches on all of the islands.

Reviews.Title: “The name changed, but it's still great”
Reviews.Author: Sarasdad27
Reviews.Content: Travaasa Hotel Hana or Hotel Hana Maui - no matter what the name, this remains one of the best places we've ever stayed at, anywhere.
