After driving the Road to Hana, this is a great place to stay, be pampered, and use as a jumping off point for touring the surrounding area (The Sacred Pools, Waianapanapa - the black sand beach, etc.) If you've booked time at one of the crowded places in Lahaina or Kaanapali already, add at least 1 day here to find your "balance".

Reviews.Title: “Peace, Relax and just calm down”
Reviews.Author: laurence00
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Hana was wonderful and peacefulâ€¦a very welcome break from the hustle and bustle of Kaanapali and Lahaina. I booked 2 ajoining rooms for me, my wife and our 3 teenagers. Not much for the kids to do(no wifi), but I was very happy. It's almost eerily quiet and tranquilâ€¦took me a day just to enter that peace. The rooms are large, but a bit dated. Some rust spots in the tub and creaky floorsâ€¦seems like the place could use a renovation. No air conditioning in the rooms made it a bit hot at night for me personally. The beds were not very comfortable as I think they were a bit old. Large grass field in front of the rooms helped keep things quite. No beach at the hotel, but stunning views off the cliffs near the cottages. Main pool there was very nice, but no service (while we were there) was a bit of a pain if you wanted a drink or snack. Excellent service all around. You never feel as if there are any other people there, but at dinner we all show up at the only restaurant on the property. Very nice (if somewhat pricey) menuâ€¦not much for kids. We had a very nice group entertaining us Sunday night. About a half hour from the 7 pools, which was beautiful. We did the hike up to a wonderful waterfall first then tried to swim in the pools, which ended up closed for some silly reason. Be careful on the 2 mile hike to the waterfall! It is rocky and unevenâ€¦someone broke an ankle on the way down.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the new name throw you off”
Reviews.Author: klatza
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 night stay at Travaasa and it wasn't until we were delayed at the airport and I went to look at the Hotel Hana Maui site again did I realize the name of the hotel had changed. Que a brief panic that things would be not as I hoped/expected but the minute we arrived I feel in love with the place and my fears dispelled. As some of the other reviewers have mentioned I too was concerned about no air conditioning but once you are there you realize how unnecessary it really is! There are lovely double screen doors that open up to your personal lanai and allow the tradewinds to send a delicious breeze into your cottage as you fall asleep to the rustling of the palm leaves in the trees. My boyfriend and I choose to splurge on upgrading to a sea cottage from a garden suite and I was so pleased with our decision. Sure it's not cheap, but you only live once! Not to mention, they offer so many activities on the property that it really feels worth the money. I highly recommend considering the Sunrise and Spa package for a least one of your nights if both members of your party intend to receive a massage. This package includes one 60 min spa treatment per night per person as well as breakfast and was a real value. Food at the hotel is expensive so if you are a fan of a big breakfast I'd suggest going for the breakfast included package. We wished by the end of our stay that there was more variety to the dinner menu, as that was not the most exciting aspect of our stay. Other than that, I have nothing bad to say about this lovely resort! Go and fall in love with Hana as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Retreat”
Reviews.Author: zerolex
Reviews.Content: For any couple planning to take the scenic drive down the Hana highway, a 3-4 night stay at Travaasa (fka Hotel Hana Maui) is an absolute must. The rooms are huge, perfectly furnished and secluded. You will feel like you are staying on a private Maui plantation. When you do eventually decide to venture out of your room there are plenty of relaxing activities to be enjoyed: world class spa and massage, infinity pool, hidden beaches, hikes through massive bambo forests, waterfalls, horse back riding and more! Though a bit on the expensive side, this hotel is on my "must-do" list for Hawaii. (message me if you want more info)

Reviews.Title: “If you want to relax.. This is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: VickiinVA
Reviews.Content: Words cannot quite describe the serenity and luxury of this Travaasa Hotel. From the moment we arrived, we were greeted by a Hawaiian lady who provided us with fruit juice, a lei and wet towels to cool us off. Even my 10 year olds twins were "wowed". We were upgraded to a cottage near the beach. If we had known this hotel was as nice as it was, we would have arrived earlier so we could have enjoyed it more. I believe I had one of the nicest nights of sleep in my life...the doors were open, the Hawaiian ocean breezes blowing into the room, the sound of the ocean waves. It was as if we had the entire area to ourselves. The next morning we enjoyed the luxury of the heated infinity pool. We waited to check out until the last minute we could. If we could have stayed another night, we would have, but we were on a tight schedule and had to go. The red beach is walking distance from this hotel although we had a hard time getting someone who would tell us how to get there. We had been there before and was told the trail had washed away from erosion. There is a trail from the fence at the left of the hotel where you see the graveyard. Some of the tombstones have washed onto the beach below. The red beach is on the other side of that graveyard. It is hard to describe how to get there so I suggest you ask some locals you see walking over there. I finally found the trail to the bottom beach and then you have to go across the rocks to the other side. It's too treacherous to try to go down from above. Remember, you go at your own risk (probably why no-one at the hotel will tell you how to get there). If I could do it all again, I would allow 2 nights there and arrive at check-in time so you have plenty of time to enjoy the beauty and serenity.

Reviews.Title: “JUST LIKE COMING HOME!”
Reviews.Author: julie-bugg
Reviews.Content: Oh how I love this hotel! I spent alot of time worrying about the new ownership and how it was going to affect my stay this time. My husband and I fell completely in love with the Hotel Hana years ago when we decided to try it for one night. We drove from the Four Seasons in Wailea and didn't take any of our luggage, we left it in the room and planned on a quick one night stay and then would head back to the Four Seasons and complete our trip. We were so happy there we stayed a second night! My husband said there was no way we could stay any longer, he wasn't paying for two hotel rooms for a third night! But that is how much we loved it. This year we wanted to take our daughters who are 18 and 20 to Hana and this hotel so they could experience what they have only heard us talk about. I was concerned things would be different but things were WONDERFUL as they always have been. All the familiar faces of the employees with their warm, kind welcomes, all the same therapists in the spa who recognized us, the same amenities, the same level of service and enjoyment. Each time we stay there it just gets better! Do not stay here if you prefer an environment like the Atlantis Hotel in Nassau, Disneyworld, or the Grand Wailea. Those are lovely places to go, and I enjoy their kind of experience, but I also appreciate the serene, laid back beauty of Hana and the "Travaasa" Hotel. Nothing is quite as magical as sitting on the deck of my sea ranch cottage watching the ocean waves and Alau Island, or hearing those waves as I lay in bed at night with the doors open as the wind blows in from the sea and billows the curtains as I lay in the moonlit bedroom. I am thankful there is a place like this, there are not many.

Reviews.Title: “All stress disappears the minute you arrive”
Reviews.Author: travls
Reviews.Content: First of all, this is a new name for the Hotel Hana Maui, one of the few places left that you can relax like it's 'Old Hawaii.' This hotel sits in a spectacular place overlooking the wild Pacific. We stayed in one of the oceanfront Sea Ranch cottages, where our unimpeded view of the waves crashing ashore was one of the best we've ever had, especially when we could see Kilauea on the Big Island looming over the horizon. We often sat mesmerized by the power and beauty of the waves. Over the years, we've found that sometimes when we paid up for a room with a view, it was worth it and sometimes not. This is definitely worth it. For those that prefer not to pay up, the view from the pool by the Sea Ranch cottages is beautiful as well. The good news for us was the quiet and serenity of the resort. If you prefer the activity and frenzy of the Grand Wailea, then this is not for you, but if you don't, this is perfect. The service was as outstanding as the view was beautiful. Since we didn't have access to a car, a very friendly staffer took us for a guided tour out to Oheo Gulch (or the Seven Sacred Pools) and Kipahula. In the Haleakala National Park, we hiked the incredible Pipiwai trail up to the 400 ft Waimoku Falls. While the Falls were dramatic, hiking through the Bamboo forest was truly magical. Afterwards, our ever helpful guide took us to a local fruit stand for delicious fresh fruit smoothies. We never would have found this great local spot without him. Not only did we get an in-depth view of Hana from a local's eyes, but we thoroughly enjoyed his Aloha spirit and lively sense of humor. In all of our years traveling around the world, we have rarely found such great service. This is a great choice to relax and recharge.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute serenity”
Reviews.Author: b-burg_girl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here at the very end of a wonderful vacation in Hawaii and could not have ended in a more serene and relaxing place. The grounds are beautiful and we were so relaxed that we did not suffer from the lack of TV. After driving in along the road to Hana, it was a lovely touch to be greeted with a refreshing juice and a cool lemon scented cloth. They also collect your bags and take you on a quick tour of the grounds on a golf cart which was helpful because they have a lot to offer here. The infinity pool is beautiful and the view from the pool is splendid. We did not wake up to see the sunrise, but wish we had. They also offer activities and classes (complimentary with the room) in their wellness building and the 7:30 a.m. yoga class facing the ocean was such a relaxing way to begin our very last day in Hawaii. It is a good idea to plan ahead for your meals - the restaurant is exceptional, but pricey. They do give you a basket with fruit and banana bread as well as a fridge with complimentary drinks (water & soda) and there are a couple of small stores within walking distance, but the selections are varied and pricey as well. Also, the hotel rooms have a small fridge, but no microwave or stove (at least not in our unit). We stayed in a Garden Suite. We stayed here primarily because we wanted to be more relaxed on the drive to and from Hana instead of rushing through the drive in one day. However, now that we have been to Hana (specifically Hotel Hana) we would come back just for the experience of the hotel/spa and what they have to offer. The hotel has tennis courts, racquetball court, 3 hole pitch & putt course and they have the clubs and rackets for you to use as well. It is a wonderful place to get away from it all. One thing is that the ownership actually changed from when we made the reservation to when we stayed there, so it is now Travaasa Hotel Hana. Not sure what all will continue to change, but it was wonderful while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “I want to go to there...again.”
Reviews.Author: FLATraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Hana-Maui, ahem, excuse me, Travaasa Hotel Hana for five nights. This is the place to stay to enjoy true Hawaii and to get away from the crowds. This is going down as one of my favorite places, the hotel and especially Hana, Maui. There is no a/c, but as Floridians, we felt comfortable in anything that's not 95 degrees and 100% humidity....there's plenty of fans and the tradewinds help during the day. The resort grounds are beautiful. Walkways meander through plumeria trees and the views of the Pacific Ocean and Hana Bay are beautiful, a really unique location. It's right off the road in Hana, so some rooms, including the one we had, were backed up against the road. You'll hear the occasional loud car, but it didn't bother me. We were in room 43 and it was a bigger room, the bedroom was closed off from the living area...nice to request those rooms. The Sea Cottages looked amazing! But, the hotel recently changed ownership and those expensive cottages are to be made part of the all inclusive part of the hotel, which may be locked off from the other resort property (which means future guests might not be able to use that pool area, not sure about that but that's what staff employees say was being proposed. That would be a shame since we stayed in the regular cottages and the pool by the Sea Cottages was a highlight.) I'm not sure how the changes will affect the hotel. We heard a lot of chatter about the changes. The Hotel Hana-Maui name has been around for years and now the name has changed along with new ownership. We had a local lecture us when walking out of the hotel one day about how terrible we were for staying at a hotel that treats it's staff so poorly. I was concerned and researched online and by talking to others and found that some big changes have been made and the locals and employees may be leary. We had a family of 8 there and we all hoped that the new ownership does not change much beyond just changing the name. The hotel has stuggled in years past and no doubt to keep up with a lagging economy changes are expected, but I hope the true Hawaiian feel that we felt there stays. As for highlights.... Hike to the Red Sand beach right off the property by the Pacific Ocean side, a hidden treat. Breakfast in the only restaurant on property was delicious and came with incredible morning views of the ocean. Our family ate dinner almost everynight on our lanai by ordering room service. The staff was so sweet and helpful, especially Kaya. There are lots of activities that the hotel puts together to do, like lei making, ukulele lessons, bike rides, etc... There is a lot to see and do in Hana. Driving there for just a day is what most do, but to stay in Hana and enjoy it at times before the 'driving tours' come in is truly a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Tmag10
Reviews.Content: The service is unmatched and everyone at the hotel is so nice, calm and relaxed. The property is naturally landscaped with breathtaking views of the ocean and the bay. You can spend the day just hanging at the pool or join in on one of the many activities such as lei making, yoga, bike tour, spa, hikes, meditation, and more. We took a great ride south of Hana to Haleakala national park and hiked up through a bamboo forest to a huge waterfall. The area is remote, quiet and humble. If you're looking for glitz... Don't come here. The bungalows are clean and casual with lots space and a great shower. I love it here.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret on Maui --For relaxation”
Reviews.Author: belomiser
Reviews.Content: If you want pampering and marble baths and amazing service go the the Four seasons or the Ritz but if you want to relax and breathe and have a place where there are few people then go to the Hana Maui. It is old world charm with folks from Hana who serve you -- how cool is that and they take pride in their service -- there are no false smiles but just the lovely Hawaiian English ( takes a couple of seconds to understand some of them) and that is the charm The spa and treatments are amazing. If you want to just chill then spend a couple of days without a tv or a radio or a outside phone line in your room. We did that for a couple of days with kids and it was fun. The place has decent restaurants and is walking distance from hana bay which is a good beach. The hotel has facilities at another beach about a few miles but if you are a surfer then you should go there -- I would not recommend that place for kids to snorkel or hang out in the surf for too long. Tranquil Holiday for a few days with friendly guests, locals who give you Hawaiian hospitality and a place to relax after the 3-4 hour hair pin bends and many stops drive from Paia -- then this is the place There are some restaurants close by -- Cafe Romantica and a thai place along with a hawaiian bbq place. we stayed at the sea ranch cottages but IMHO the garden rooms are bigger for a better price but you dont see the ocean which you can do if you just walk a few yards. They have an all inclusive package which may be good. The bathrooms could do an upgrade but as I said this is old world charm and not the four seasons -- go with the flow Honeymooners - this is the place to go

Reviews.Title: “Different and amazing!”
Reviews.Author: ally113
Reviews.Content: Here is my break down of Hotel Hana Maui: SERVICE The service can not be beat! I have stayed in many nice hotels during my life, but Hana Maui is something else. The staff immediately makes you feel like a part of their family. You are welcomed with juice, necklaces, and a golf cart ride around the property. There is a welcome basket in your room filled with delicious local goods. Every time you encounter a staff member they greet you, and they can answer any question. But most importantly, they were not too pushy or over bearing like some luxury hotels. They gave you your space, but they were easy to find and helpful as well. The rooms and grounds were kept very clean as well. VALUE It's pricey - no getting around that, especially if you eat your meals in the dining room. There are many things included in your room rate, however, such as scheduled events throughout the day including some fitness classes, pool use, snorkeling equipment, complimentary drinks in the refrigerator, the welcome basket, etc. We stayed for two nights, and would have loved an extra day just to "hang out" pool side and enjoy the quiet town of Hana (we used our full day to go to Haleakala National Park to see the rain forest which was well worth it too, however). ROOMS The rooms are large, clean, and comfortable. We stayed in the garden rooms instead of the sea cottages. There is no air conditioning, but keeping the screens on the windows and doors prevents the stuffy feeling. The bathroom was large as well, and the shampoos and lotions provided were some of the best hotel toiletries I have encountered. The rooms really felt like being in old-world Hawaii. They are re-doing much of the hotel in the next year, so I'm very curious to see what will be changing. OTHER The hotel is situated on a lot of land and is very spread out, making it quiet. The main pool by the sea cottages was heated to the perfect temperature, and we were always the only ones in it. The Jacuzzi was nice too and has an ocean view. It was fun to wander around the grounds and take pictures of the great scenery. The only down side was that the hotel was not right next to a beach, just a cliff over looking the water (which was beautiful too, however). The restaurant is also very expensive, and there aren't a whole lot of alternatives in Hana. The food was great though and the service was wonderful, so the price was worth it. Must get the chocolate decadence dessert!

Reviews.Title: “Oh Hana !”
Reviews.Author: TinyBubblesScuba
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with another couple recently headed over to Hana for a 3day/2night trip. WOW ! Hana is amazing as ever, but our stay at the Hotel Hana really topped it off. We were greeted at the Lobby area with fruit juice, refreshing face towel, and a Kukui Nut Lei... And a super friendly staff ! Lots of ALoha and we haven't even checked in yet. Our room was huge, the pool/jacuzzi area was so peaceful and relaxing, as our trip to Hana was going to recharge our batteries for sure. We did dine at the hotels restaurant, and this was the only issue we had. It was not a good dining experience. The service was good, but the food had to be sent back... It was not edible. Bummer ,, because everything else was so good. Very centrally located in Hana and overall just a super great trip !!! Aloha Happy Hana ...

Reviews.Title: “Durty ,smell at Gym is gross , my bedroom bathroom wasn't clean, expensive,....”
Reviews.Author: Debhaynes
Reviews.Content: The place is beautiful but that hotel stinks,nasty,expensive ... DONT WORTH THE PRICE.. THE HOT TUB???? the one in my room SO SMALLLLLL...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in a true paradise”
Reviews.Author: MauiSurfriders
Reviews.Content: I've driven to Hana several times and spent the day hiking and exploring-- it was a whole new experience to be able to stay, relax a soak up the Aloha in this true paradise. We had more time to explore on the drive to Hana and stopped at the lava tube caves. It's a unique excursion that takes you underground through a quarter mile of a lava tube cave. There is a small fee to go in and they give you a hard hat and a flashlight, it's all walking (the cave is huge) and my claustrophobic Mom did not feel claustrophobic. We checked in at the Front Desk and were greeted by a very friendly bellman and also a front desk person; they made it seem like they were waiting just for us. The bellman drove my kids in a golf cart to our room and I followed in my vehicle. A short ride took us to a 2-bedroom beach cottage that was heavenly. I could hear the ocean, smell/taste the warm salty breeze and relax in deluxe, spacious accommodations. We had a king bed and two queen beds, perfect for our group which consistedof my mom, me a teen and a tween, there was a hot tub on the expansive deck but we did not use it. Beds are comfy, bathrooms good and the setting defies description. There is no Internet or Tv's in the guest rooms (only at the lodge) and my tween couldn't believe it. We played cards and before we knew it, we were yawning -- a he made it through the evening without a TV! The next morning we used the free bikes to explore the resort. We did the lei making and watched the coconut husking -- the staff is eager to share their culture and were very helpful. The pools, hammocks, hot tubs were superb. I did not try the spa. Someday, I want to splurge a do the $1500 private dinner, but not this time. We didn't want to leave and my tween said he liked his no-TV vacation. It allowed us to enjoy one of the most beautiful places in the world,

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the Road to Hana... serene and welcoming..”
Reviews.Author: chf0729
Reviews.Content: After 7 hours on the Road to Hana ( yes, we took our time!) it was such a pleasure to arrive at the Hotel Hana Maui.. check in was wonderful, and you were brought to your room in a golf cart after you were shown the entire resort and where things were. The word "serene" could not be used enough.. no TV, no alarm clock..You would think the 17 y/o son would not be happy- he loved it.. free bicycles to use.. small golf outing, pools.. etc.. We relaxed and then headed to a very nice, friendly cocktail party and got to meet the staff and some local residents of Hana.. You can see why they love it there... We had a wonderful dinner- excellent service, excellent food... After a wonderful nights sleep, we ground our coffee and shared a wonderful walnut banana bread that was devine... hot tub and pool were inviting and relaxing.. We really hated to leave... another day, or two, would have been perfect.. The only downside was that we wanted to use the steam rooms, lava whirlpool and the cold plunge pool- the spa was closed for a photo shoot- we weren't told and felt a bit embarrased when we arrived there to use it... we would have liked to experience the entire spa...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel let down by its restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Alan_from_Hampshire
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are regular visitors to Maui and always stay at Napili, at the other end of the island. On each visit we always make one trip to Hana and in recent years have usually stopped for lunch at the Hotel Hana Maui. We like the sense of peace and relaxation that you feel as soon as you walk into the hotel, so a slightly expensive lunch is a small price to pay to soak up the atmosphere, which seems to be so consistent with the feel of Hana itself. This year, after making our a day-trip visit, we decided to come back and actually stay a night at the hotel. It's really way out of our price league but we decided to splash out for one night and we're really glad we did. Our room - a garden view room in the cheapest category - was large, attractive and well equipped, without being excessively luxurious. It had a large lanai with a lovely view out over rolling lawns that sloped down to the fitness center at the bottom. A little way beyond that we could see the ocean. The bathroom was large but, although perfectly maintained, felt just slightly old, probably in need of a refit by now. There was really nothing wrong with it but at these prices I become quite picky! The room had proper coffee making facilities and a fridge - not a mini-bar (hooray!). Better still the fridge contained several cans of soft drinks and bottles of water, which were free to use. I wish more hotels would do this - the value in customer goodwill surely outweighs the modest cost to them. We're not great fans of A/C so won't at all concerned at the lack of it here. However, we were rather warm overnight, mainly because I couldn't find a way to get any movement of air through the room - there didn't seem to be any windows I could open at one end to encourage a breeze through the room. I can imagine in the full heat of summer it could be very uncomfortable. There are no TVs in the rooms (a good thing in my opinion). There's free wireless Internet in parts of the lobby area only - not in the rooms. My wife has a mobility problem for which she uses a wheelchair. Our room was fairly close to the main building and we were able to get to and from it easily with her wheelchair. Other rooms would be more difficult, I think, so it would be worth discussing this when booking. Also, the staff were very willing to take us anywhere we wanted around the grounds in their electric carts; we used this to get to and from the pool, which is some way away. The main buiding, with Reception, restaurant, bar and other common areas were all accessible. We found the staff all friendly, welcoming, responsive and efficient; just right, I would say. Overall then, the hotel is excellent - so much so that we seriously discussed staying for a second night we couldn't afford. We were less happy with the restaurant. We've lunched there many times over the years, and found the food good, the service variable, and the price high but this time of course we also had breakfast and dinner (I say "of course" because there's almost nowhere else in Hana to eat). Breakfast is not included in the room-rate and is VERY poor value for money. We paid $68.64 for two of us for a meal that was neither lavish nor delicious. I can't remember all the details but my wife paid $9.00 for a very small fruit salad, that consisted mostly of watermelon (surely the least interesting of melons) with a couple of strawberries, about three chunks of pineapple, and not much else. It seemed so inadequate that she ordered a portion of pineapple for (I think) $6.00, which consisted of what appeared to be one slice cut into chunks (note: in Safeway, a whole pineapple costs less than $1.00). For $15.00 I ordered french toast. It consisted of four slices of rather thick soggy white bread, with no sign that it had been toasted, and very little evidence of egg or cinnamon, etc that one might expect. Definitely the worst french toast I've ever had. Dinner was also a disappointment, though not as bad. The items we ordered were OK but not nearly as good as half a dozen restaurants we frequent elsewhere on Maui, and it was one of the most expensive meals of our whole two week visit. Please don't be put off - it's a beautiful and wonderful hotel that feels - and really is - a very long way from the crowds and glitzy hotels and condos elsewhere on Maui. We hear the hotel has new owners who are about to change its name. We just hope they don't spoil what's good about it, while improving the areas that need improving. I also hope they don't make it so expensive that we can't repeat our stay in the future sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “A million LITE years away.”
Reviews.Author: kratour
Reviews.Content: Wow! How do you go from one side of the island to the other and feel a million miles away. Go to Hana. I have driven the road to Hana 12 or more times from both directions with family, on a harley, in a jeep but I have never spent the night. So for my wifes Bday we suprised her with a stay at the Hotel Hana.The moment we pulled up to the hotel we were ohana . Our 3 kids 10 11 14 were amazingly impressed at the attenion they gave to us. Check in was easy as you never feel like there is any body else but you any where in the resort. To say the standard rooms are ample is an understatement they are 6 to 7 hundred sq ft. The restarant at the hotel is awsom but pricey. If you want to feel like you and yours are the only ones on the planet go here.

Reviews.Title: “heavenly hana says it all”
Reviews.Author: lindacrick
Reviews.Content: wonderful place to recharge; terrific yoga classes to start the day off; great spa area with outside showers and cold plunge; great hiking all along route to and beyond hotel; great Longhi's food; terrific, quiet relaxing pool area with breath taking views, remote but worth the drive up to Hana

Reviews.Title: “Most peaceful place on Maui.”
Reviews.Author: mikemorone
Reviews.Content: When on Maui we absolutely love the Grand Wailea. This year, we decided we'd stay at the GW once again, but that we'd do something different and spend our last two days on the other side of the island, at the Hotel Hana. What a delight! Hotel Hana could be called "the anti-Grand Wailea". It's so quiet. The staff is superb,--very accommodating and with many planned guest activities if you're so inclined . The restuarant is expensive ($15 french toast; $16 hamburger and fries), but the food is exceptional (yes, even the hamburger was special). If you're looking for tanquility in a most beautiful and relaxing setting, if you want time to reflect on the meaning of life, Hotel Hana will not disappoint. This is Hawaii in its finest and truest form.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: kwitt16
Reviews.Content: Hotel Hana was an amazing stay during our trip to Maui. It's quite pricey but very worth it. The hotel grounds are beautiful and the rooms are more like a small high-end apartment! The infinty pool was fabulous and so is the spa. Would spend an entire month here if it was affordable! Hana itself is fabulous and this hotel is heaven on earth.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation is in the air here.”
Reviews.Author: MichiganTraveler6
Reviews.Content: Twice we have attempted to go to Hana Maui for one night and twice we have spontaneously extended for another day once we got there. It simply exudes peace. The infinity pool is the prettiest I have ever been in. Ever. Our room was lovely, very clean and very comfortable. There is no air conditioning but the fans and breezes were fine for us. Another reviewer mentioned the ballpark nearby. There was a tournament the weekend we were there and we never heard a thing in our room. Food is great and yes it's very expensive but the atmosphere is lovely. The staff is wonderful. I even made a lei and learned a bit of ukelele with one of their staff. And the spa is great too. No idea when we'll be back but we will be back. It's just too special.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable location”
Reviews.Author: JunkyardWisdom
Reviews.Content: Best location in Hawaii. If you want the real Hawaii, not the one with fake luau's and feigned friendliness, this hotel is for you. But be warned -- this is a sleepy town that has very little to do. The hotel itself is an incredible property, but the distant location makes it hard to keep a good staff. Also hard to maintain a great facility. Still, I wouldn't go anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beginning. Horrible Ending.”
Reviews.Author: LastMinuteTraveler51
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at Hotel Hana Maui but due to travel delays I could not check in until after 9p. The front desk staff was very friendly and gave me a tour of the grounds, which were beautiful at night. Because I checked in late I was told by the staff that I could still use the grounds the next day after I checked out. I inquired about booking another night but was told they were full for the night but could have availability the next day and to check back. I also inquired about the spa and scheduling a massage. I called the front desk and was told that there was no times available for the time period on that day but that I could schedule one for the next day. I inquired about use of the grounds following the massage and was told that it was fine. Following the massage I then went to the pool to order lunch and relax. However, instead of a relaxing lunch it became a nightmare due to an over-vigilant and verbally abusive grounds-keeper / security guard. He approached me at poolside and demanded that I leave the grounds immediately. He then insisted that I leave the lunch that had just been delivered at the poolside, and escorted me to the parking lot, recommending that I not return. While I had intended to go by the front desk to inquire about room availability, I instead chose to leave and look for other local lodging. I can honestly say, after my experience with that individual, it's very unlikely I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon unexpected stay for one night - Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: SLP02
Reviews.Content: This is a long overdue review of Hotel Hana. My husband and I were honeymooning on West Maui and took the famous "Hana" drive. What we didn't plan on was it taking so long. We arrived in Hana around 4pm and it was overcast and drizzling out. We had our hotel room with all of our belongings on the west side but really wanted to be able to do the Seven Sacred Pools and waterfall hike. So, we had a choice to make... lucky for us the wonderful staff at Hotel Hana were more than accomodating. They offered us the standard room at half the price for one night and then when they found out it was our honeymoon, they upgraded us to a cottage. It was a beyond incredible experience! We lucked out and had checked in on a Thursday night so we enjoyed the Manager's cocktail hour (Mai Tais and apps), then used the facilities at the spa, and the gorgeous pool even though it was raining. Because we only had *hiking* clothes with us we were limited in our dining options to room service only but how fun that was too! The food was yummy and yes, expensive but expected given its remote location and no competition. The next morning we made our own coffee (complete with a coffee bean grinder!) and enjoyed yummy banana bread and fruit compliments of the hotel on our own porch. We couldn't sleep in because we were so excited! We watched the sunrise and then headed south to hike the waterfall and the Seven Sacred Pools. Again, the attentiveness of the staff impressed us as we were allowed a late check out (I think 2pm). So we were able to come back after our hike and enjoy the beach and boogie boarding before taking showers for our road trip back to the west side of Maui. Whenever we think of Hawaii... we think of our incredible escape away to Hana. My husband says it was the best decision we made and I agree. Thank you to the wonderful staff that made our one night stay unforgettable...

Reviews.Title: “MOST awesome location!!! MOST horrible food choices!!!”
Reviews.Author: brewsterstravels
Reviews.Content: this is THE place to go for your honeymoon (as we did)! beautiful location, come on! the BEST!!!! the only problem i have with the hotel is THE FOOD. that they say they "offer" roomservice BUT they don't. you won't find a roomservice menu anywhere on the vast property. SO you have no other choice but to eat cold food in the room (unless you have the house with a kitchen) or go to the only 2 restaurants in hana (which they own both and charge an arm and a leg). ...and there's no TV's in the rooms and wifi only in one area of the hotel. SO, only go if you splurge for an oceanfront sea ranch cottage (as we did) and want seclusion because there's really not much service to be had here, although they do of course make up the rooms daily. we went to the spa one day for treatments and it was nothing great, the massage therapist was a nice hefty woman but not very talented.

Reviews.Title: “You will love it OR hate it - know what you're getting into”
Reviews.Author: shortnspeedy
Reviews.Content: This is a difficult review, because my wife and I had wildly different experiences at the Hotel Hana while staying here during our honeymoon in December 2010. We each had valid reasons for our impressions, based on our individual tastes. Do you like camping? I do. If you do, you'll probably like the Hotel Hana. The Hotel Hana is a connect-with-nature no-cell-phones-please experience, where the local activities include hiking through rainforests, volcanic beaches, and horseback riding, among other things. The Hotel Hana has no air conditioning, although the temperature always remains between 70-80 degrees. The rooms do not have TVs or wifi. The primary restaurant was surprisingly good (despite some reviews we'd seen claiming otherwise), although ridiculously overpriced. Of course, it's the only "nice" restaurant in all of Hana, so there's no competition (nor is there probably enough of a market to create new competition). Nonetheless, I recall everything I had there -- including fresh fish, steak, and breakfast -- was quite good. The pool is beautiful, overlooking waves crashing into the rocks. The spa is serene, the perfect complement to the peacefulness of Hana. The service at the spa and the hotel was excellent. They seem to have preserved the friendliness of a small business that can escape the larger luxury brands elsewhere in Hawaii. I thought all the foregoing was wonderful, and thus the Hotel Hana seemed wonderful to me. When I found a gecko in our room it was not a crisis; I put it under a glass, took a little photo, released it outside, and went for a swim. Wonderful. My wife's experience was different. She is not a camper. Recall that East Maui, and certainly the Seven Pools area, are known as a rain forest region. That label held true in our experience, as Hana was overcast and extremely humid at all times. Think, for example, of those steamy rain forest exhibits at the zoo. The humidity aggravated my wife horribly, and she was unable to sleep -- as in, ever. And how to escape the humidity? There is no escape. The humidity is everywhere, and there is no air conditioning. You feel as though you are always in water, whether swimming in a pool or knifing through the thick air. If you have allergies or sinus issues that are aggravated by humidity, this could be a problem. After two nights of not sleeping, my wife fell on a hike returning from the Seven Pools / Haleakala National Park trail and basically lost it. She couldn't take it any more, and I started calling around to hotels in West Maui (our next destination) to see if there was any availability. Things that were only minor annoyances at first became interolable for her, such as bugs or the geckos in the hotel room. Think of a movie where the atmosphere slowly builds pressure on the character over time, ultimately escalating to a breaking point. I think that's how my wife would remember the "Hana experience" -- as a challenge. When we checked out, she didn't "leave" Hana -- she escaped. Ultimately we did enjoy our honeymoon (a week at the Wailea Four Seasons helped), but I am 100% certain we will never return to Hana. Yes, it is beautiful. But, at least for my wife, once is enough. We have already escaped.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I've Finally Found True Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Painter88
Reviews.Content: What a shame it would have been if I had traveled to Maui and not gotten the spur of the moment idea to drive the long scenic road to Hana Maui Resort! We were immediately upgraded to a private cottage on a green meadow, I stood on the porch and watched waves crashing on black sand below. I felt I was getting a rare glimpse of the tranquility that only ancient people experienced. Sleep was easy with perfect temperatures and the windows open with the white noise of the the ocean. Very remote, isolated and tranquil. The resort provides its own beef with cows grazing across the road from the main house...they make their own natural soaps and grow many of the vegetables and herbs served in the dining room. I have used many of my photos as ideas for oil paintings since the grounds are truly heaven on earth. Now matter how much it costs, you need to experience Hana Resort at least once in your life.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: mccambjd
Reviews.Content: The focus is on simplicity and relaxation: no A/C, no TV. Great location and spa. Fantastic staff who really seemed willing to go out of their way to make the stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise...!”
Reviews.Author: BristolMags
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came here for part of our honeymoon -- and it was just glorious. If you want the hustle and bustle of Waikiki -- nightlife, restaurants, shopping, people-watching -- this is clearly not the place for you. If you want privacy, happy quietude, peace, the uninterrupted sound of the sea and birdsong, lush gardens, hammocks strung between coconut trees to snooze and sway in, pools to sit by or swim in, a beautiful spa with stunning grounds and views over the sea and mountains -- come to the Hotel Hana-Maui. It is a taste of paradise. The staff are brimming with aloha and attend to your every need. If you want to go hiking, horseback riding, or get into some awesome outdoor adventures, the staff here will set you up and give you the friendliest of send-offs. There's also free yoga class every morning and a yoga lanai for practice. The food is also terrific. As for the rooms, we stayed in our own cottage -- a lot of the "rooms" are in fact beautiful tropical cottages overlooking the sea with a lanai and lush bathtubs to wallow in -- you don't feel like you are in a hotel. You feel like you've rented a cottage -- spacious, high ceiings, comfy big bed, beautifully tiled kitchen with a fridge stocked with water and drink. We arrived to find fresh-baked banana bread and a koa bowl of lush tropical fruit waiting for us. Tasty dried mango and pineapple snacks were also provided. If you are driving to Hana and spend the night at the hotel, it seems that, as long as they aren't booked out, the Hotel is happy to let you "hang out" until you leave the next day, even though check-out time is before noon. The only downside is the cost, which is a bit prohibitive depending on what you can afford. We'd have loved to have stayed much longer and probably would have done except for the cost -- so we struck a happy medium. Would not have missed this Hotel and Hana for the world! Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rough ending to an otherwise great trip”
Reviews.Author: texasyaya
Reviews.Content: This hotel is far from luxurious or first class. It is overpriced and rustic. We paid $825 for a sea cottage room that was a suite arrangement. Bath was large but hot water was inadequate. We showered at the spa. Towels are thin and skimpy. Floors were sticky from the humidity with no A/C, No tv, no internet. We had a hot tub on deck but it never got hot and we never used it as a result. Again, we went to the spa. I am giving three stars because the horses grazing outside the room by the water were stunning. Rooms deserve a 2. Restaurant was ok--2. Spa was adequate--2. Amenities in spa and room were basic. Fridge in room was stocked with water. Delivered a delightful box lunch to us at the beach. Staff is very friendly with lots of locals. They will not accept tips except for food and spa.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly - except for 2 things”
Reviews.Author: dpaumi
Reviews.Content: The hotel : the location is truly stunning. We highly recommend paying the extra $ for a sea ranch cottage overlooking the large grass lawn because the view is awesome. We'd sit on our deck and watch the sunrise in the morning. The grounds are magnificent. People complained about ants but if you keep food scraps cleaned up in your room, it shouldn't be an issue. The service was fantastic - everyone was incredibly nice & helpful and with the no tipping policy we felt that the service was sincere. The room furnishings are fine - not five star quality in a big city, but we had no complaints. The amenities: take advantage of the classes/activities. The pilates, yoga were great. We thoroughly enjoyed our hike to Fagan's cross with Doug - he was so informative & friendly. The sea kayak/snorkling tour with Kevin was awesome. We enjoyed our massages - if you are athletic, ask for Jan. Our only disappointment was that most of the cardio equipment in the fitness center was not in working order. The food: we stayed four nights at the Hotel & the food was our biggest disappointment. Breakfasts weren't bad especially considering they were included in our package. Some were even good including the pancakes & the lox benedict. But dinners were horrendous. The service was great but the focus on our disappointment is most definitely the food. The caprese salad was fantastic - the fresh tomatoes were a highlight. But the main courses were disasters. The food was lukewarm. My husband's fish (mahi, I think) was overcooked and my "rare" ahi was cooked over halfway through. Another night we decided to switch to steaks and these were equally disappointing. The preparation of the food was just not good, especially at these prices. Because of our disappontment in the restaurant's food at dinner, we did eat at the Ranch Restaurant twice. The first night the ribs were fantastic. The second time we ate there, the ribs were almost inedible - the marinade was excellent, but the cut of the ribs were downright disgusting. The pork sandwich was decent. The activities around the hotel : we highly recommend the hike through the bamboo forest, the Shoreline hike at the black sand beach & the sea kayaking/snorkling with Kevin. The banana bread & smoothies at Hana Fresh are great. If you are athletic & adventurous we recommend the hike right off the hotel grounds to the small red sand beach mentioned in "Maui Revealed" (our new favorite guide book). Hamoa Beach is worth it - but the waves can be rough. Overall, our 4 nights here were fantastic and we will be back and recommend this hotel to others. Good food is very important to my husband and me and so we hope that the hotel works on improving this aspect of the experience. This is NOT a restaurant for foodies. But the hotel itself & the service are heavenly.

Reviews.Title: “True Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: lizcurry
Reviews.Content: My husband and I honeymooned in Hawaii and spent 5 nights at the Hotel Hana Maui -- it was the epitome of paradise! The staff is very friendly and accommodating, the food is top notch and the hotel and property is one of a kind! My husband and I loved it so much we left to go to another hotel on Maui where we had a reservation and drove the 3 hr Road to Hana trip back because nothing could top it. There is something special about this resort and part of Maui and I would recommend it to anyone who is planning a trip there or considering honeymoon/vacation destinations. If you don't spend at least three nights there you are doing yourself an injustice!

Reviews.Title: “This place was such a treat! Friendly...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was such a treat! Friendly staff, delicious food, great rooms. We enjoyed relaxing on the deck and loved the huge sliding door. The pools and yoga classes were a delight. Can you tell we liked it?

Reviews.Title: “A perfect relaxation getaway”
Reviews.Author: life7s
Reviews.Content: After a year of planning our wedding, my wife and I were exhausted and needed a place to relax. The Hotel Hana Maui was the first stop on our honeymoon in Maui and Kauai. We loved every minute of it. The room was gorgeous with a hot tub on the patio overlooking the ocean. Most of the meals we ate there were terrific (The Lobster Benedict was ridiculous). There aren't many eating options so try to see if the hotel is offering a meals package when you go. We received free breakfast every night we stayed and 1 free 3 course meal for 2. It was really worth it. They also provide free drinks, coffee and tea in the room. I cannot say enough good things about the staff. This is a non-tipping hotel (except for the food and spa areas). They cater to your every need and do so with a smile. This was a big change from the St Regis in Princeville where they expected a tip for everything and were way less friendly. All in all this place is a real gem. The spa was also fantastic. The tennis courts need to be redone, but that's probably my only complaint.

Reviews.Title: “overall it was lovely!”
Reviews.Author: mushmush
Reviews.Content: we just stayed at the hotel hana, it was really great and relaxing! the staff is super nice, we liked that everyone was from hana, and that it was very local feeling. it was super quiet there with not many guests staying there. except for one day they stuck a very loud drunk couple next to us in the sea ranch cottage that is split in half and we could hear them yelling through the wall/open screen door. i immediately knew this was going to be a bad situation so i had them move us, which they did very quickly. but we didn't like our new cottage as much as the original, it was a bit smaller or the layout wasn't as nice. if only they could have moved the loud couple since we were there first! the location is so pretty, and the pool is so nice, as well as the free spa usage and spa treatments. you can even do free laundry there which we liked. everyone who works there is so helpful and nice. the sea ranch cottages are very roomy and the porches are great to watch the sunsets and the ocean, horses in the pasture..you're really in nature, not in a big resort which is awesome. it is understated but still classy-not over the top or cheesy/gaudy. the free activities are fun, and even the ones that aren't free are cool too, we went horseback riding on the ranch for $60 each. it was so fun! the activities managers are really nice and will tell you all about hana. we wished we did the free yoga. the yoga room looked so nice. again the staff there are great and it definitely feels like a family business. here are the downfalls: -there was a roach in our second cottage on the last night which was pretty small but freaked me out bad since i am from nyc and very aware that 1 roach means many. i don't know if this is really hard for them to control since it is such a natural environment in hawaii in a pretty open cottage, or if they could do more to control this. it's hard to tell -there are ants, but i wasn't as freaked out by them since ants are hard to deal with in nature, and aren't as gross as roaches. they provide raid and are easy to kill. -the bathrooms need renovating in my opinion. the tiles were clean but outdated and were grossing me out a little. i was relieved to be in the st regis princeville bathroom in kauai after we left hana, which was all marble and pretty swanky. -like others said, they do need new furniture in the rooms, some of the rattan was coming apart on the couch, looked a little worn overall. i agree with others that the photos of the rooms on their website do not depict what the rooms look like now. those pics must be old. -there isn't much to eat in hana. especially if you are a foodie. the restaurants in the hotel are good for breakfast if it's included like it was for us (besides our bloody marys!). but for dinner it's not that great, and the hana ranch isn't that great either. but they aren't terrible, they are just average. but in my opinion hawaii in general isn't exactly a foodie state. i think saimin is a gross version of ramen, and i love ramen. spam is just gross, and hawaii loves spam. we ate at the few stands that were open for business like braddah huts-that wasn't great either. but at least it was pretty cheap. the seafood they have at braddah's is fresh. we also tried sweet licks next to the hotel, which was ok for ice cream but the food was cheap but just ok. -it's not cheap for what you get, but it's such a nice property and has great views, if you stay the sea cottages are the way to go. we hope they renovate soon, i read that the post ranch inn in big sur owns it now, so i hope they restore it, we would love to come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Hana, without exaggertion the most beautiful peacefull place on earth”
Reviews.Author: saprina
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hotel Hana on several occasions. It is one of my favorite places to stay. I Love it there!! The people are all very nice and willing to help with whatever you need. The grounds are kept beautifully, as well as the rooms. The views of the ocean from the room are mesmerizing and the sound of the waves crashing against the rocks puts me to sleep every night.

Reviews.Title: “Magical”
Reviews.Author: TurkeyPotPie
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights in Wailea, then traveled the long "road to Hana" for a 2-day stay at the Hotel Hana-Maui. If we'd known what a beautiful, relaxing, magical experience we were in for, we would have planned to spend more time. We didn't have high expectations for Hana - almost everyone we talked to told us we would be bored there. But time just slows down in Hana. We enjoyed the quiet, watched the waves roll in, explored the hotel's beautiful grounds, borrowed bikes and rode to the beach, enjoyed meals in the exceptional restaurant, perused the offerings at the art gallery, and indulged in a spa treatment. The resort also offers a variety of exercise opportunities, classes (lei making, ukelele, etc), and outings. But really, you may not want to do more than relax on the lanai of these beautiful cottages.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat the setting!”
Reviews.Author: TRCNYC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hana Maui during a three island visit to Hawaii and very much enjoyed our stay there. It is not a luxurious property in the classic sense (if you are after four season amenities the property is not for you) and does not have the best service we have experienced (in fact service was somewhat limited for a resort), but the relaxed atmosphere, the stunning location (even for Hawaii), the friendly Hawaian local feel and the wonderful camp/cottage setting creates something very special which you dont experience at your run-of-the-mill corporate 5-star resort. This hotel has two types of accommodations: bungalows and Sea Ranch Cottages (the latter of which are actually duplexes). The Sea Ranch Cottages are located across a road from the rest of the resort in their own pod with a separate pool and the wellness center. We stayed in one of the Sea Ranch Cottage, all of which had gorgeous views. The cottages are well appointed and spacious with large decks. They are not, however, posh (more campy) and (along with the public spaces generally) could really benefit from an update (we understand the resort was recently sold and changes are in the works). The Sea Cottage pool is a nice size, and there is a jacuzzi nearby (both with fantastic views). The wellness center, in which they offer yoga and other classes, has sliding doors which allow it to be turned into an open air pavillion. There is a separate work out facility which also can be opened up to allow you to enjoy the views from your cardio machine. The food was not super fancy but was tasty, and we enjoyed our meals. Also, you can walk to nearby Hana 'town center" as an alternative to the restaurant. The spa was simple but nice enough and had a jacuzzi that again featured amazing views. This resort is not for vacationers who need nightlife/socializaiton, multiple dining choices, up to the minute service and luxurious accommodations. Rather, it offers a kind of barefoot luxury where you can relax with more than an acceptable amount of amenities and enjoy the beauty of nature, which is very much on display. If you are looking for a different experience and dont need uber luxury I highly recommend. Stong points -incredibly beautiful settings -laid back Hawaian feel -spacious cottages with big decks (and did I mention great views) -nice pool -competent service and good (but not extensive) amenities -horses -beautiful landscaping Things to know -no TVs/internet in the room (available in TV room) -there is no service at the pool -the anti-Ritz Carlton -you will need to drive or shuttle to the nearest beach -the property has changed hands and owners are planning changes (so check status)

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: boots1982
Reviews.Content: My husband and I started our honeymoon at Hotel Hana Maui and we never wanted to leave. We stayed in a sea ranch cottage which was charming, intimate, and romantic. The cottage was large and had a private jacuzzi on the deck, facing the ocean. Our room was stocked with a bottle of champagne, welcome basket of fruit and breads, and fridge with sodas, juice, and water, all complimentary. The fridge was re-stocked every day, which was a very nice touch. All of the staff were very friendly and accomodating, and I appreciated how the staff mingled with the guests at events like the fitness and yoga classes, so it felt more like a community than a resort. I loved starting my days with yoga, followed by a delicious breakfast. Between the yoga and emphasis on fitness, quiet rooms, and immaculately kept grounds, you can't help but feel relaxed at this hotel. We ate two of our best dinners here, but after three days we were ready to move on to another town since the dining options are limited in Hana. Overall, we had a great time and feel like we left a few friends behind. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelcailin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night after we drove to Hana- the room was really expensive for one night but the other accommodation I looked into had min. 2/3 night stays so we ended up here- the most expensive place in Hana. It is a bit like stepping back in 70's time, it takes a while to get used to the resort being split over 2 sides of the road , no TV, no clock in the bedroom but after a while that's what's nice about it, it really was very relaxing and very quiet and does have a special atmosphere which we really enjoyed. The hotel communal areas are beautifully decorated with some amazing art. The room we had was nice, it did appear to have been refurbished recently but still retained that 70's vibe which was fun. As the other reviewers have indicated the food in the restauraunt was amazing but really expensive although there is a sister restaurant across the road from the hotel which does good inexpensive food , we ate lunch across the road next day and enjoyed it. All in all an interesting place to stay - unique quiet atmosphere, you feel like you're away from it all. I would probably be more enthusiastic in my review if it had been slightly less expensive but then I guess that's Mauii!

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: texanaussie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here purely by accident, but it is one of the best accidents we've had. We didn't realise what a long drive it would be to Hana from the Sheraton Maui and we stopped to have a snack. The hotel setting was so beautiful that we decided to stay the night even though we had a room back at the Sheraton. What a relief from the hubbub that is Lahaina (not that there's anything wrong with that). Blue8910's review below sums the place up perfectly. The hotel wasn't fully booked and they gave us an upgrade to the sea ranch cottage and it was absolute heaven. The pool was a welcome respite from the big hotel pools with lots of children. Next time we want a relaxing stopover on the long trip from the US to Oz we will stay here for a week.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: didntwinthelotto
Reviews.Content: The best word to sum up our experience here is gracious. From the time we arrived here we were treated like very honored guests. From being greeted at the car by a friendly bellman, to being escorted to the outdoor checkin area where we were presented with kukui nut leis, passion orange guava juice and fresh towels to clean up to being given private lei making lessons...we couldn't have asked for more. We were given an upgrade to a sea ranch cottage, which was by far the more desirable location over the garden cottage. The place was very quiet in terms of guest and staff. My husband had a couple spa treatments as gifts, so while he was pampered, I spent some time in the spa in the steam room/plunge pool and the outdoor pool overlooking the bay. Even as it started to rain while I was in the soaking pool, I hated to leave the tranquility of the water. The room was very old style ranch Hawaii. It was like stepping back in time with no tv or internet. It was very quaint while still being comfortable. I love to stay in a luxury resort hotel when I travel for leisure...but this was just as decadent without being pretentious. Our cottage overlooked the water and abutted the general store. Horses roamed by just on the other side of the fence. We enjoyed the fresh fruit basket, the ample supply of beverages and the generous bath products. The deck chairs were perfect for relaxing with a book, a drink and letting time go by. When I went to see about the complimentary activities going on the next day, I was disappointed to find that our somewhat early departure would preclude me from participating. When I was asked about getting involved in these activities I told the activities attendant my dilema. She happily arranged for me to do the activity I wanted, making leis, even it wasn't scheduled for a convenient time. I was able to make leis, enjoy fresh coconut milk and really make the most of my stay there. It was this attitude of going out of their way that really made this stay so special. We were so disappointed that we couldn't stay another night to really take advantage of all the hotel offered. As other reviewers have noted, this is not the newest, fanciest or most opulent hotel you will ever stay at. But I realized that sometimes those aren't the things that make you feel special or make your stay extra ordinary. Sometimes it's people taking the time to treat you well and slowing down to enjoy the beauty of nature that makes for an unforgetable trip. Don't miss the chance to stay here...it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “heaven”
Reviews.Author: madijack
Reviews.Content: We had a such a wonderful stay. We were a little concern about the purchase of the property. Try to get the best room you can afford. It's worth it. Ate at the bar and the main restaurant. Everything was delicious. Loved the lobster benedict at breakfast. A amazing stay. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Mystical, noble, graceful but not modern”
Reviews.Author: Zeitungsfuzzi
Reviews.Content: Aaaaaaaah. If ever there was a place to soothe your soul on modern day Hawaii - this must be it. The place is not a simple hotel. It's part of the town. It's got so much character and makes you feel so special, it's even worth spending the fortune it takes to stay a night. We were there on a misty, stormy February night. Sitting in the magnificient jacuzzi (not the cheap, plastic one, but real stone) with a view of the ocean in the distance and nobody else in sight was magical. The spa would be second rate in any city with an abundance of them. But out here - after the drive down the Road to Hana - the little imperfections add to the atmosphere. Rooms are so spacious you could safely play a raquet ball match inside. I can only recommend staying in Hana, since you'll be one of the first people to see fabulous Oheo Gulch in the morning. Two downsides: Prices at the restaurants are prohibitive. I believe that a hotel that charges so much money to stay there should downsize it's prices for hotel guests at least a bit. And, to stick to the truth: If this hotel would be located in any other town on Maui, it would need to update its ground and amenities to stay in business against the stiff competition. But that's the beauty of Hana: There is none. That's why staying there is absolutely memorable. Don't miss it - fork out the bucks!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING! Stay in a Sea Ranch Cottage and you will never want to stay anywhere else...”
Reviews.Author: blue8910
Reviews.Content: The location of this property is absolutely STUNNING. For fear of too many people "discovering" it, I hate to recommend it so highly, but I think the word has already gotten out: no place in the world compares. I have never felt such a euphoric sense of "place." Being here is taking a trip back in time to Old Hawai'i, before the days of mass tourism and over-development. THIS is genuine Hawai'i, at its most authentic and naturally beautiful. I strongly recommend staying in a Sea Ranch Cottage to experience the sound of the pounding surf, and views of the gorgeous, unspoiled Hana coastline from your giant lanai deck. Ignore all reviews complaining about no A/C. We were there in August -- the hottest time of year -- and the 2 ceiling fans and ocean breezes were plenty to keep us cool (and we like it quite cool when we sleep). The service here is also superb. The staff -- many of whom are Hawaiian -- are gracious and welcoming. The all seem genuinely concerned about your happiness. The wellness pool is stunning. There are no crowds or screaming children. Gorgeous. The food is delicious. Ka'uiki and the Paniolo Lounge are obviously awesome, but we also very much enjoyed the Hana Ranch Restaurant -- a bit more casual and also very delicious. There are plenty of activities -- and they give you a sheet each day describing all of them. All are free. No nickle & diming here. Hamoa Beach is 5 minutes away by car, and also unspoiled and beautiful. The 9 hole (3 holes w/ 3 alternate tees) pitch 'n putt is fun even for beginners. Short hike up to Fagan's Cross for a great view. We'd recommend this place most strongly for couples and adults. Although kids are allowed here, the general atmosphere is peaceful, serene, and very quiet. Also, there is no nightlife for teens, and there are no waterslides etc. for younger kids. This place is really meant for adults. We will be back (and next time we'll stay 2 weeks instead of 2 nights). In one word: AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: “This place was magical, a true island getaway and rejuvenation.”
Reviews.Author: CAAZgal
Reviews.Content: I have been to Hawaii at least 20 times since my first visit there in 1980. Maui more than any of the other islands and while having driven the road to Hana at least 5 times in past visits, this time my girlfriends and I made it our destination for a long girls weekend. We wanted some relaxation, exercise, outdoor adventure, good food and some quality time together without the standard touristy trappings that some places in Hawaii are so famous for. We stayed at the Hotel Hana Maui and we were not disappointed. Our rooms were amazing, we stayed in the Sea Ranch cottages and each one of ours hadd a stunning ocean view and the sound of surf. Each morning we enjoyed freshly ground coffee on our lanai's (they have beans and grinders in the room for the real coffee pot, I loved it!!) Then we would go to a yoga or pilates class and a different activity each afternoon including horseback riding, surfing lessons, kayaking and spa day. While having visited Hawaii so many times, this time I felt like I was in old Hawaii, with locals who had a passion for the Hawaiin culture and folklore. It was nice not seeing any high rise hotels timeshare salespeople, or cheesy luau's. The hotel had a calming and healthy feel to it and at times I felt like I was on a private estate. For me, staying there was peaceful and relaxing; an authentic Hawaiin experience. I personally, did not even notice there was not a TV in the room until the second day and I did not miss it. The grounds were just enchanting, the whole property is single story and at night with the torches lit, the pool area looks like something out of a movie set. It was very quiet while we were there but the day we left, a wedding party was coming in so there was lots of activity. I read the review about Hubert and was quite surprised as our experience with him was completely different. He was responsive and helpful as were most of the other hotel employees. Hubert and fellow staff made our stay stress free and his enthusiam specifially was refreshing. The food in the dining room and bar was very good and along with the hotel, is under new management. Everyday there was a new special and they can do anything with ahi and I would order it again. The fresh fruit in the morning was so good and you have to try the lobster eggs benedict. We didn't have too many lunchs there but had dinner there almost every night. I enjoyed the bar versus the dining room as it felt more open and casual ,plus a couple of nights they had hula dancers and music. One night the kids and grandkids of the hula dancers came in to dance hula with them, very charming to see ages from 2 on up dancing hula. We also went up to the ranch restaurant, good food, more casual feel, great patio and that night, they had a duo playing contemporary music. Other than that, your choices are limited, just some local places which I admit, we didn't try very many. The BBQ place down the street was really good (I had salmon), but bring your own beer or wine. Hana has some activities in the area that are worth exploring as well. The hotel set up the horse back riding and kayaking but we had a rental car to drive to the park and go on the hike to the waterfalls. The kayaking also included some snorkeling and although we didn't see turtles, it was nice to jump in the water. Horseback riding was a blast ,but we went as a group so we all had fun with each other. The drive to the stables and scenery on the ride was nothing short of outstanding and our guide (Keone) was knowledgable of the area and culture, not to mention the horses! The hotel will take you to Hamoa Beach, where they had chairs and such set up if we wanted to stay ,but we chose to go back and enjoy a day around the pool. The bamboo forest and hike to the waterfall was well worth it, but go early, it gets very crowded. Spa day was our down day and I enjoyed just hanging out on my lanai, relaxing, sipping some wine. My deck had a hot tub as well. So I say definitely go to the Hotel Maui and enjoy the Hana area. Talk to the hotel staff and locals and although we ran into a grump at the fruit stand, all others were so welcoming and throughly enjoyed talking about their part of the island. Admittedly, I did some corny stuff like hula lessons and coconut tasting but in the atmosphere of the resort, it was fun and I learned so much about the plants and environment. The hotel is incredibly warm and unique, again if you are looking for a Waikiki type of Hawaii, this place will not interest you. It was an amazing vacation and we all felt rejuvenated with no regrets, except wishing to stay a few more days.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hana Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ROKChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Hana-Maui and Honua Spa in early August 2010 for three nights. We had an end unit with a large patio area that wrapped around the front and side of our unit and the garden view was lovely! The patio furniture was nice and we enjoyed sitting outdoors. Our room was newly renovated and the bathroom was large. The kitchen area included a small sink and refrigerator, which was convenient for keeping snacks and beverages in the room. The hotel provided free daily beverages, such as bottled water and juice. The grounds of the hotel are well maintained and the staff was very friendly. The pool is on the small side, but faced the ocean and offered a great view of the hotel grounds. No A/C is in the room, but there are several ceiling fans in the unit; there is no television or radio. Living without these was not a problem for us and we enjoyed the quiet time in Hana. Given the environment, keep in mind that insects will most likely be seen in your room, such as mosquitoes and others â€“ we even saw a small gecko in our living room area one day. The restaurant on site is expensive, but the view from the dining area is great. Lunch at the nearby Hana Ranch Restaurant is nice, especially the view of the ocean and horses from the patio area. Two small markets are located across the way from the restaurant and a gas station. This hotel is a great location to stay if you are interested in staying in Hana for a few nights; we woke up early each day to explore the area and we are happy that we spent three days there since we visited many sites and spent quality time at each, rather than rushing through and trying to see it all in a day. This hotel is expensive, but the rooms, grounds, hotel service, and nearby site-seeing are just right for the price if you wish to have a very memorable trip!

Reviews.Title: “Used to be great”
Reviews.Author: siambest
Reviews.Content: My parents & brother recommended this place. I traveled with my girlfriend around November 2009. It was paradise. However, I am writing to let people know that it is no longer the case. My fiance & I decided to get married there in june 2011. Before we left in 2009 we did everything but sign the contract. We waitied a few months to save more money. Called them back june of this year (2010)...The events manager we had been working with (Alana Ross) was wonderful!...but no longer there...she left (first sign). Her replacement, Huber Aaron, got back to me on average about once every two weeks (second sign). I spoke with manager Tom Johnson. He is ineffective at best. After about 6 weeks I called front desk & pleaded with the girl to give me some help & not just transfer me to Hubert Aarons, Tom Johnsons voicemail or anyone else's voicemail.... hotel was bought out...bringing lay-offs, labor disputes, & general disarray. This used to be a beautiful place, but I guess even paradise is not immune to the economic turmoil. I would wait for the reviews to start trending upward before you consider a visit....to be fair...I based my reviews on the time I was there....& it was a great place....so, just be careful =)

Reviews.Title: “Nicely secluded, but glad I wasn't honeymooning here”
Reviews.Author: kwippy
Reviews.Content: I was here strictly on official wedding business for my best friend and greatly enjoyed the scenery on the grounds. However, I didn't realize that the fact that this hotel promotes "unspoiled nature" mean no tvs in the rooms! Granted I did get the local (kamaaina) rate and probably had a basic room, but I was shocked that something that simple was missing from the room. I just relate this stay to a camping trip in cabins, than staying in a luxury resort. I really loved the relaxed, "ohana" type of service where they really treated you like family and new all the details of my stay. The resort rate includes a multitude of activities from yoga, to hikes and afternoon bike rides. I thoroughly enjoyed the morning yoga class, despite the feeling that I got that the instructor was trying to sell us his "Pure Moods" type of music. As we were lying in the savasana pose, he went around and blew a digeridoo in ALL of our ears. Quite amusing. Overall, I would say this hotel gets an "excellent" rating for service, but "average" for rooms, particularly amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, honeymoon surprisingly marred by noisy community center”
Reviews.Author: considerthis24
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had a very nice stay at the Hotel Hana. If we wouldn't have received a special rate on the room (and hadn't been on our honeymoon), I probably would have complained about the noise next door. It was very surprising, but the community center near the hotel was having some kind of Saturday night shindig which didn't end until long after dark and had loud music and shouting. Considering the very personal greeting when we arrived (which we really appreciated), the least they could've done was inform us that there might be noise in the neighborhood that night. Despite that, the hotel, the spa, the pool, the grounds, and the restaurant/cafe were all quite nice although also quite pricey. Assuming the noise is not a regular occurrence, I might tentatively recommend it to a friend, but certainly not for more than $300 per night. However, given the cost and our isolated experience, I cannot recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven is not in the sky it's at the Hana -Maui”
Reviews.Author: BernsFry
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative reviews of the H.M. I felt compelled to write my own. I am a New Yorker with fairly high standards and yes when I am in a city I enjoy the reliability of Four Seasons or a Ritz Carlton.....but in Hana the last thing I wanted was a cookie cutter Corporate hotel. Lets face it, if here in the most beautiful settings on earth your enjoyment is predicated on air conditioning (when you are inches from the ocean) or a big flat screen tv (when every exotic plant is blooming all around you) you don't really belong in Hawaii anyway. The staff, the food, the management, the views etc. were exceptional. My only regret is that I can't visit more often. Kudos to all those have kept the Hana-Maui the special place that it is for these many many years.

Reviews.Title: “Complete let down and not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous001_2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were both really disappointed with this hotel. Although staff were friendly and the overall look of the resort was pleasing, there were important elements that were less than satisfactory, especially for a hotel as pricey as this one. The pros about this hotel are the friendly staff, cart service for guests and luggage upon check-in and check-out, no tipping policy, spa, and beautiful eternity pool overlooking the ocean. Unfortunately, the cons just cannot be forgiven. The first being no A/C in the rooms. That should be a must in a 4.5 star hotel. We did request an oscillating fan but even with that on full blast along with all 3 ceiling fans, we were still sweating at night and couldn't sleep. We even left the screen doors and windows open hoping that some breeze would enter, but it did not. And why is there A/C in some areas on the resort, such as the lobby bathroom, spa, and games room? Second, the cottage we had smelled like bug spray. I should have gotten the hint when I saw the big can of Raid in the closet.
