We were changed to another cottage that smelled better, however, there were ants crawling all over the bar counter, coffee maker, and sink. My husband also killed a cockroach underneath the sink, where the garbage can was. This, in my opinion, is unacceptable for a "luxury" hotel. And before the hotel management can say that "Living in this magnificent natural environment sometimes poses challenges with insects, and we do strive to use appropriate measures at all times to deal with any infestation. Since your visit here in March and your encounter with ants in your room we have taken steps to make sure this is always handled in an environmentally friendly way", as they did to a poor couple who experienced something similar 5 months prior to us, OBVIOUSLY, the problem has not been fixed. Finally, the stains on the pillowcases and beach towels were the icing on the cake. My husband and I will never stay here again and not recommend it to anyone, regardless of how pretty it looks on the exterior. Thank goodness we stayed at the Ritz-Carlton in Maui for the first 6 days of our trip, which I HIGHLY recommend but made our stay at this hotel that much more disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “What a let down. Looked forward to a...”
Reviews.Author: Cotraveler999
Reviews.Content: What a let down. Looked forward to a quiet get away in Hana. I had driven through Hana a few years ago and loved the location. All was great when I arrived at the hotel -- juice and cold towel were welcome after the Hana Hwy drive. I was taken to my room with a promise to have a tour of the complex. That didn't happen. The rooms were nice, but on further investigation things were missing. The primary thing missing was air conditioning!! Yes the ocean breeze was nice, the room got very hot and I couldn't sleep at night. I think not having a television or clock were cool. The service was terrible. The staff were more interested in visiting with each other than helping the guests. Examples -- had to call several times for ice. Everytume I called it was someone else's issue. No one took accountability. No towels at the swimming pool -- numerous of us were requesting but none ever showed up. I can go on, but here is the real point. It is an over priced, upscale motel. Based upon the service and amenities it should have cost half the price. It is sad ... A focus on service could help turn this paradise location into a nice resort.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Frequentravler
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I got married In beautiful Maui, We travel all over the world frequently the only mistake we made was staying at the Hotel Hana Maui... The staff was polite but you would expect that from a hotel that charges around $600 and up a night we were promised a full cottage it was a quarter poky cottage none of the basics air condition?? and to top it off our bed had ants, now I understand this could happen in a hotel which charges $600 and up a Night and on your honey moon so they send the staff to fix the ant problem.. They SPRAYED RAID in our bed and did not offer us another poky cottage and were not willing to negotiate on the price.. Also this hotel does not have a lobby pretty shabby at best very primitive living I would say STAY at the www.HonuaKaiMaui.com we transferred the rest of our stay to this beautiful place and its first class all the way for a FRACTION of the price !

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL! We will be back...”
Reviews.Author: leah13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights. Location is perfect, we got there after a full day of traveling the Road to Hana, stopping for most of the attractions on the road. We were told that the hotel has a new ownership. We stayed at one of the garden view junior suites facing the hotel garden/lawn. The suite had a large bed room, huge bathroom with tub and a separate shower, a dining/family room with sofa, table and chairs, refrigerator, fruit, coffee machine (you grind your own coffee!), beautiful lanai porch. There is a pasture near the hotel (Fagan's Cross) where cattle is spread throughout - very pristine and picturesque. The staff was most friendly, helpful and courteous. Many of the hotel activities were complementary including a 3 mile shuttle service to the adjacent Hamoa Beach, hula dance lessons, lei making etc. On the first night we had dinner at the hotel restaurant - magnificently delicious, a high quality dining experience and contrary to previous reviews - service was PERFECT, prompt and courteous!! On our second night we had dinner at the hotel's bar - great food for much lower prices...again...great service, wonderful atmosphere, live local music. Among other things, we used the hotel's heated outdoor Wellness pool, which faces the ocean...it was raining...and it was beautiful. Great experience! We plan to go back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Derek031
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Hana Hotel. It was great . The staff was very friendly . I locked my keys in the car and they sent a staff member an engineer(Earl) right away to get my car open. What a relief to only miss a few minutes from enjoying my stay. It was a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Magic”
Reviews.Author: julie-bugg
Reviews.Content: I've spent wonderful times at the Hotel Hana Maui and will again be staying at this one of a kind place in August. Unlike the reviewer below (review of June 6, 2010) my husband and I have never slept more comfortably than we do at this hotel. When we are at home sometimes before going to bed we reflect on this and wish we were there. I have stayed at many fine resorts, too many to mention, Four Seasons, Ritz- Carlton, Fairmont, Peninsula, and the beds here and the sounds of the ocean and sometimes the sounds of Hana rains at night are the things I remember when I am forced to come back to the real world. I can't really remember whether or not the meal service was slow, it was friendly and gracious, and with our conversation and our general delight in being in Hana for a few nights, the meal went by much too fast for my liking! At first I was not sure about the lack of air conditioning, but please keep things the way they have always been. I LOVE the bathrooms, I love the furnishings and decor, I love everything about this magical place and the thought of it changing or being gone so that I cannot return is something that would make me very very sad. During the heat of the day I visit Red Sand Beach, Hamoa Beach, spend time at the lovely gorgeous and serene swimming pool on the property, visit an ancient heaui or hike to a waterfall. As far as nightlife, what could be more wonderful than sitting outside looking at the stars that seem so close in this peaceful, beautiful one of a kind paradise. Can't wait to spend four nights in August, counting down the days.........

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: yogimom3
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and secluded with great food, fun activities and unusual local attractions like fruit farm tours. Located far away from the crowds, rooms, service and spa exceeded our expectations. Morning yoga was great and the hotel is so intimate it is easy to pass the time with others or alone. Croquet, tennis and golf on site made for casual pick-up activities with teens who also enjoyed the visit far more than they expected. On-site gallery a mecca for Maui artists eager to share their work and stories. A great find!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: KristinO
Reviews.Content: The drive along the Hana highway is amazing, and a trip to Maui would not be complete without it. So, after a beautiful, but long, drive to Hana, I was really looking forward to splurging for a 2 night stay at Hana-Maui. Upon arrival, I was a little thrown off by the lack of elegance I felt the place had. But, the staff were exceptionally warm and welcoming. Our room was very large, with a nice sitting/bar area and a large lanai. But, the place continued to appear dated and wasn't what I expected from what professes to be AAA 4-diamond resort. Now later, upon further consideration, I began to appreciate the "old Hawaii" charm that this resort has, and it really is very quiet and relaxing. But there were a number of things that I remain disappointed with. First, the bed was aweful, really aweful. I read in the hotel information that guest often comment on how well they sleep in these beds. Not sure what these guests are used to sleeping on, but I'm guessing it approximates a pull-out coach. Also, there is no A/C. This isn't such a big deal during most days and once you get the ceiling fans going and windows open, but upon arrival the room was really stuffy and it took awhile for it to air out and become comfortable. The bathroom was large, but quite dated, and the ceiling fan in that room was stuck on high and squeeked. Also, the towels seemed quite dated/used. Again, not a huge deal, but when you are paying these prices... Finally, there was the restaurant service. The prices they charge, well, I recommend not even looking at them, because you may just lose your appetite. But hey, you are in a remote area of an isolated island, so such is life. And, I wouldn't even bring it up if it weren't for the poor service. Everyone is very friendly and welcoming, but the service was really slow, from recognizing the table, to getting drinks, to getting water/coffee refills, to getting food, to getting plates cleared... you get the picture. Now, I am all for "island time" and just letting things roll, but this is supposed to be a 4-diamond service place, and this was way beyond "island slow". And, the food really isn't all that great. It had some high points, but out of 4 meals, I had to send two back because things weren't cooked or were wrong, and I could have sent a 3rd one back, but didn't feel like waiting for the re-cook. All in all, we had a nice time in Hana, you should defintely visit, but I would not spend the money to stay here again, and would probably just complete the loop and stay on the other side of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny”
Reviews.Author: LATaz
Reviews.Content: This was our splurge! Having driven the road to Hana once before, I knew I did not want to round trip it in one day, so decided to stay here, although it was quite expensive. We were also celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary, so felt like we deserved it! When we arrived after the 5 hour heavenly road trip-the tour company had not sent our information, and we were told we had no room, but not to worry-they would "fix us up." And they certainly did. Although we had booked an ocean view room, we were taken to the cottage closest to the ocean, where we had our own jacuzzi, and a view that took our breath away. They said they would be back with some treats and apologized that they weren't in our room, but they were not expecting us. In a few minutes they returned with a fruit and bread basket along with a bottle of champagne. We were treated like royalty the entire 2 night stay. The infinity pool was lovely-and the MaiTai served by the pool was the best I had the entire trip. We were told that the hotel is having some financial problems and had just been sold. The local people shared that it is imperative for this place to stay open because most of the tiny Hana population works here. We hope the new ownership can save this gorgeous place. It is truly heaven at the end of the heavenly road to Hana.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: RobMonclair
Reviews.Content: I just retruned from Hawaii after spending a few wks there. Of all the hotels we stay in 3 Hawaiian islands, Hotel Hana is our favorite. When I was there, I learn that the hotel is getting a new owner. I hope the hotel is not going to change the hotel too much because I hope to return when I visit Hana again.

Reviews.Title: “The Hana Maui was worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: Islandtime11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved the other side of Maui. Yeah there is no nightlife other than at the hotel really but you will not find the peacefulness anywhere else either. The grounds are immaculate and our hale overlooked a horse rance infront of the ocean. The infinity pool is amazing. I can't wait to go back, I know it is expensive I told my wife not to tell me so I could completely enjoy the calmness. A side note - we had some of the best food ever here and down the street on some guys front yard he was bbqing teriyaki chicken it was amazing. It said the best food in Maui and it was.

Reviews.Title: “PASS THIS HOTEL UP”
Reviews.Author: yomper
Reviews.Content: There is a labor dispute in progress all the experienced staff were laid off and anyone who was breathing were hired to replace them ,having experienced this before I can tell you it is not a pleasant experience to have staff that do not know what to do in an emergency or how to get the a/c or hot water running.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise. My favorite vacation.”
Reviews.Author: nsroofstar
Reviews.Content: I stayed in August 2006, but Trip Advisor doesn't let you go back that far . I went to the Hotel Hana Maui with my family of 6 and my grandmother. I was a college student at the time and entered the place with fear. NO TV in my bedroom/No fancy gadgets? What is a college kid to do? Panic struck me as I settled into my cabin with my grandmother and then quickly faded. This is absolutely so relaxing, beautiful, fun, friendly, clean, top quality. I will be talking about this vacation for the rest of my life. Nice little amenities in the room (delicous hawaiian chocolates, fruit, fresh kona coffee bean with a grinder to brew FRESH COFFEE EVERYDAY, bathrobes, comfortable bedding). The pool overlooks the ocean and it is just so relaxing. The spa is AMAZING. I have been to a large variety of spas and this is absolutely the best spa experience in my life. The reflexology was LIFE Changing. I legitimately could see better when I got out of my massage and felt truly enlightened. I did not want to leave Hana and plan on going back. This was my favorite part of my trip to Hawaii. I could go on and on with more good things to say, but STAY here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our Stay At This Exquisite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Surfer9
Reviews.Content: Well, I must say that I was a little skeptical at first having teens and friends with us. I was afraid there would not be enough to do. We ended up having the most fabulous time at this top notch hotel. We had a huge unit that slept all of us. It had every necessary appliance and pan we would need to prepare our meals. I was also worried that the hotel would be changing owners but the staff did not skip a beat if it is even in the process of changing hands. The front desk was always willing to answer our endless questions. I tried the yoga class and made my friend try it for the first time and is now hooked! We did not use the pool area during the stay and would say that it was always quiet when we walked past. We did try the restaurant and there were 6 of us. We all enjoyed our meal...service was a little slow but honestly it gave us a chance to just slow down and savor every minute and bite. My teens found plenty to do...they never got tired of finding an activity whether it be bike riding or tennis. Our units did have tv's and clocks but it was the larger townhomes. I would come back again and share this experience with other friends. The only negative for us was the weather...a bit colder than we were use to but not the fault of the resort. The winds picked up at certain times so just be prepared when packing. We should have brought more for rainy or windy weather. Not to be missed: the hikes nearby are breathtaking. We went to The Venus Pools a short drive down the road. So much to see on hikes and walks...don't just stay in the resort.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED it”
Reviews.Author: Clark033
Reviews.Content: The best review was from my wife, who always seems to want to go to new places, saying "Let's come back soon." She's the veteran of a lot of the nicest hotels with the top end suites, but regarded Hana as the most beautiful place she's ever been. As a husband, it made the trip worthwhile even if I hadn't been enjoying it so much myself. Overall, Hana is not for those who want easy access to lots of nightlife and dining options, but is wonderful for those who want a beautiful hotel in the middle of a truly wild place. It is surrounded by interesting places, such as waterfalls, beaches, jungle gardens, etc. There are activities available with snorkeling, horseback riding, and the worlds second smallest golf course. The service was excellent. The people were friendly, helpful, and seemed to take real pride in Hana and the community. They also don't nickle and dime you - there's no 'resort fee', and lots of little servce extras made us feel valued and that we weren't making cost choices but simply enjoying our stay. We had an ocean view ranch, and it was worth it. It didn't feel hotely at all, more like our private cottage. The workout facilities are beautiful, although somewhat limited. The second pool has a wonderful view - we were sitting in the hot tub, and saw humpback whales fully breaching in the ocean. A+ wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “A little of Old Hawaii in Maui”
Reviews.Author: Wowtravels
Reviews.Content: We had a relaxing stay at Hotel Hana, a fantastic resort far away from the busy resorts on the other side of Maui. After driving the â€œRoad to Hanaâ€�, you have to make sure that you stay over night at this wonderful resort. The â€œRoad to Hanaâ€� is a once in a life time experience and the photo opportunities are endless. It is tiresome, after driving for nearly four hours each way to the end, but is well worth the drive. When you enter Hotel Hana-Maui, the island's most exclusive hideaway, the gracious staff greets you with a shell lei necklace, freshly pressed Guava juice, a cold pineapple-infused face towel and wisp you away to your room in a golf buggy. The cottage-like â€œSea Ranchâ€� suites are roomy, rustic yet elegant and very comfortable to relax and sleep. The bathroom is huge, with a deep-soaking tub (thou their where some stains) and a rainfall-like shower. The only negative there was, the cocking around the sink was gray-like (maybe it was mould) in the bathroom, they should fix the cocking or change the sink. The outdoor porch had great views of the Ocean. The pace of life here at Hotel Hana was so relaxing. When your here, sleep, go to the heavenly holistic open-air spa (theirs a wonderful steam room and outdoor shower), read a book, swim and eat like royalty at the Kaâ€™iuiki Restaurant or just lay in a hammock. Time seems to stand still here at Hotel Hana. The lobby, spa, lounge and restaurant areas are all beautiful designed. The staff where very welcoming and have a Hawaiian charm. So remember when your here, relax and take your time.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Yet”
Reviews.Author: Wine_Lovers25
Reviews.Content: I love to read reviews and get information about the location, so I knew what to expect, or so I thought. We arrived to an friendly greeting with juice, shell necklace, and cold towel. So great especially after a long drive. The room was perfect with fresh fruit and beverages in the fridge. We had a great night of sleep with the patio doors open, the ocean breeze was enough A/C for us. The yoga room has an amazing view and loved all the doors open to smell the ocean and plumeria. The instructor who all works at the spa was great and gave options for every skill level. They also have a nice hammock for two nearby to relax in afterwards. We spent an hour here each day overlooking the water. Last and most important is the restaurant. We were expecting a average meal because of other reviews. We know food, previous Chicago residents, and we loved it!!!! Also the sever, Jay, was outstanding. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel to slow down and unwind!”
Reviews.Author: sbeecy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary/valentine's day weekend. Hotel was very nice, lack of TV and electronics is a pleasant addition to the beauty of the property. Pool was wonderful and had an amazing view of the ocean! Room was very nice, bathroom was huge and room included small fridge and coffee maker with hawaiian kona coffee. We had breakfast included with our room and the food in the restaurant was very good, service was slow on valentine's day but thats to be expected, service the day before was very quick. We also ordered room service because we heard the Hana Ranch Restaurant wasn't very good. Room service came in a timely manner and burger was very juicy and fresh fries! Overall a very very good hotel, would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “truly outstanding”
Reviews.Author: scubachick_7
Reviews.Content: First visit to Hawaii. After hearing about the journey to Hana, we decided to book 2 rooms for one night in Hana at the Hana hotel. Travelling with my spouse and another couple. We booked both sides of a sea ranch cottage. The hana hotel is amazing - no A/C but we didn't miss it at all. Might be a bit warm in summer, but we had perfect weather. No bugs. room was tastefully decorated and we had no complaints with the accomodations. Champagne, snacks, and other beverages in our room were complimentary. Service was great througout the hotel. Pool was a bit cool, hot tub great. Did a nice walk/hike in the morning and tried out the Morning yoga class. Great yoga experience while being able to gaze out the open doors/windows to see whales off in the distance. Was sorry we only had one night at this great hotel. Breakfast was good and included with our rate ($495 per night). Ate dinner off property at the Hana Ranch restaurant and had a good meal. Feel free to PM me with questions.

Reviews.Title: “Real Hawaiian Paradise”
Reviews.Author: RMluvmaui
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Grounds and Aloha spirit. Outstanding food and service at the hotel "Ka'uiki Dining Room". The whole staff was friendly and welcoming. My server, Laura, was especially knowledgeable and attentive without being intrusive. She was very friendly and explained the menu and it's preparation. Knowledgeable on wines and restaurant's local food providers. Really made the experience enjoyable. The lounge with live music was so comfortable and intimate. Really felt like I was in Hawaii. Very special place whether solo, family or romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Zen”
Reviews.Author: NjZimm
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times over the last 20 years. it's not an easy trip to Hana from NJ but I am drawn back , twice in '08 ;once with my young teenagers for winter recess, again in '09. I am booking another trip when I finish writing this. I generally split my Maui time between Hana and the Hyatt in Kaanapali. Some say it's not about the destination its about the jouney to Hana. WRONG.... it's really about the destination. For those of you who are travelling to Maui and thinking about the "road to Hana", take the ride, but....... please block the time (not hours) allow a couple of days and enjoy - because until you experience this Hotel and Hana you haven't experienced Hawaii I read some of the reviews and quite frankly can not believe that one can complain about anything when it comes to this Hotel or Hana. This is a world class property. We've made friends there and will continue to return.

Reviews.Title: “Sheer Heaven. We will always return. Hotel Hana Maui is the peak of our lives”
Reviews.Author: sunriverjohn
Reviews.Content: In an age where technology discourages face-to-face connectivity and encourages anonymity, it is such a privilege to return to the last place that the spirit of Aloha and the authentic Hawaii truly exists. We have known the staff and community of the Hotel Hana Maui for many years and feel part of their ohana. We have travelled the world, and there is nowhere else that is as beautiful and friendly. Wonderful food. Wonderful people. Wonderful scenery. If Internet service and air conditioning are one's idea of paradise, we would suggest looking elsewhere. It's the magic in the air and being face-to-face among this wonderful community that makes Hotel Hana Maui always with us, even when we are somewhere else in the world.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Hana is Rejuvenating, lots of fun activities too. Heaven on Earth!”
Reviews.Author: MelissaMcCoy
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrived at the front desk you feel welcomed with genuine Hawaiian Aloha! I've been enjoying this alluring resort since 1990 and I consider it one of the most unique resorts in Hawaii and even the South Pacific. My first longer stay (that was 3 nights), was my honeymoon in January 1991. Prior to that we did the usual, when you live on Maui, 1-2 nights at the most. I've enjoyed many 2 night stays at the Hotel between 1991 and 2010. I am a BIG FAN of the Sea Ranch Cottages w/ jacuzzi spa on the deck. The best ones are the 2 bedroom oceanfront suites w/ jacuzzi tub for a family or 2 couples. The bed and pillows are so comfortable, that one morning I could not peel myself out of bed until 8am (I usually get up at 6am or earlier). I would rate the bed at a 10! Room service was fast and delicious. I enjoyed one dinner (fabulous preparation of fresh fish and fresh vegies), and one breakfast (eggs benedict with fish.. my FAVORITE). YUMMY YUMMY YUMMY. As usual the staff in the dining rooms were friendly and attentive and the wine selection made my mouth water! I enjoyed a 2004 Heitz CabSav over a 2 night period. As they say in Hawaii, "Broke the mouth"! On Friday nights, the staff of the Hotel perform Hawaiian song and dance for the guests (a dinner show). The old timer ladies are so much fun to watch. Every night, except Friday, there is Live Hawaiian music in the Paniolo Bar from 6:30-8:30. That would be the only thing I would change. Keep the music playing at least until 9:30! THIS stay, was beyond a shadow of a doubt, the most delightful, relaxing and FUN ever. Somewhat of a Sabbatical (even though I did do some work), I managed to partake of many of the activities that YOU will want to enjoy when you come for more than 2 days (yes, you must come more than 2 nights!). 2 Thai Massages that are the very best. My therapist was Cynthia. I sit a desk all day and really need to be stretched out. This is so relaxing and you are engaged in the process (versus just lying there being massaged). There is some of that too! I also enjoyed a Watsu water treatment, which is floating in water while you are being massages and softly stretched. OMG for both of these treatments! The one hour horseback ride in the pastures in front of the Sea Ranch Cottages is gorgeous and just enough to make your bum a little sore (for someone who does not ride!). I went on a kayak/snorkel tour with Hana Bay Kayaks that was spectacular. The weather WAS stellar the whole 6 days I was there and the water as flat as a pancake! I've know Kevin Coates for years. My final big adventure was Maui Stables 3 hours horseback ride in Kipahulu. Not only is the scenery picture perfect, but the guide we had, Keone Smith, was a wealth of knowledge about Hawaiian history (some I had never heard before and I've lived here for 36 years... just how old Keone is!). Keone was witty, funny, cute, very interesting to listen to.. the perfect guide, the perfect day, the perfect Maui horseback ride! Well, honestly, the very last wonderful adventure was driving my cute little miata back home to Kula with NO CARS in front of me. A beautifious day, convertible top down, the sound of the varied thrush birds in the trees, jungle breezes freshening my face and whispering, "be sure to come back soon, Melissa". As the owner of (--), I stay at many many hotels in Hawaii (all islands), Tahiti and Fiji. This Hotel, this experience, ranks so high on my "experience rikter scale", that I am writing my very first review on TripAdvisor! Hawaii is a wonderful place to visit with Maui being very much "The Magical Island", voted best island on earth by Conde Nast. And Hana, with it's healing, theraputic, rejuvenating energy, melts the stress away, puts a smile on your face and helps you once again discover the essence of YOU! Hotel Hana Maui embraces you, welcomes you, and welcomes you back "home". Aloha.. Melissa

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, unspoiled, unique "Old Hawaii" experience”
Reviews.Author: truffleNapa_CA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel at same time as guests from West Hollywood and had a dramatically different experience. There is no A/C because it is not necessary -open the windows! Hana has never had TV in rooms and most guests are fine with that. We did have internet access in our room because we planned ahead with Verizon WiFi. We have stayed at the hotel many times since 1974 and have always had hot water. We were among other guests at breakfast listening to the loud comments from "West Hollywood" including threats to try to "shut down" the hotel via blogs. On this trip we paid twice as much for a room at the Four seasons and were happy with each. If one is looking for nightlife, Hana is not your place. It is, however, unsurpassed in the beauty of old Hawaii

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: t2soooted
Reviews.Content: No TV, AC, Internet, or hot water came with my $600 a night cottage with an ocean view. Service was terrible and this place is one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in. The bed was terrible and I still have terrible mosquito bites from the room which was incredibly bad. How can you not have Internet in the rooms in this day and age? The restaurant asked us to be quiet, just a fun group of 8 who spent over $1000 on dinner, we can be as loud as we want, spending $600 a night each on 5 rooms, and $1000 meals. No AC in the cottages so prepared to be hot and miserable while you sleep on an old school mattress.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in the less busy part of Maui”
Reviews.Author: dkseattle
Reviews.Content: We made the big drive to Hana and were so happy to arrive at this hotel. I love Hawaii but sometimes it can feel so big and developed and this property just feels quiet and laid back and was exactly what we were looking for. The rooms were clean, and nice, definitely not what I would call luxurious - but thats exactly what we wanted. There is a ton to do around, so no lack of activities. Note though that the beach is a short drive away - so not right off the hotel. The only complaint that I would have is the food - just not that great and there are almost no choices around. You are kind of stuck eating at one of the hotel restaurants and the food was consistently ok (and expensive). We ate lunch at a roadside stand one day and that was one of the best meals we had while there . . . Still, we look forward to coming back to this place. Just magical.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: Portland_visitor
Reviews.Content: I've been back in "reality" for a month now and can't believe I still miss it! The Hotel Hana-Maui is an incredible place. It's so relaxing and peaceful - our trip flew by and I was very sad to leave. We also participated in the chef's dinner and it was a great experience with amazing food. Their spa is amazing. I had a great massage and then relaxed in the outdoor jacuzzi. What a gorgeous location. Next time I'm back in Maui, I'll definitely stop by (even with the long drive!)

Reviews.Title: “lives up to the praise”
Reviews.Author: simian_swan
Reviews.Content: I knew this would be extraordinary when we arrived, a guest that was checking out sadly remarked how jealous he was of us. People miss this place before they leave it. Don't bring a laptop or smart phone to this corner of paradise. This is the ultimate quiet escape. You can't walk to a beach but the pools are beautiful and the beaches are worth the drive. Even the night sky astonished me, you will not see stars shining brighter anywhere. This place is lovingly taken care of. Every moment at the hotel is an absolute pleasure. What would make this place perfect is if the restaurant stepped up the quality a bit. The food is competent but not extraordinary. It's average resort fare and if you stay enough nights, you will get bored. You will also think about the prices they're charging as you eat, and that's not a good feeling. It's probably because they don't have competing restaurants to worry about. But if their food was halfway as good as their sister hotel, the Post Ranch in the Big Sur, this place would be above and beyond any place in Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in the Islands”
Reviews.Author: heraclius
Reviews.Content: In the last forty years I have visited most of the good hotels in Hawai'i, for business and pleasure. For a true vacation, idyllic days in a quiet garden location, with a view of surf and jungle, nothing compares to the Hana-Maui'i. I almost did not write this review because, frankly, I like it quiet, the way it is. No TV, no internet, excellent food and days to spend just listening to the waves. Leave the teenagers at Waikiki. Leave no forwarding address. Just enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: FineDineLovr
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a dream - beautiful, secluded rooms, service beyond all expectations, incredible food, you name it! We loved it. The ONLY thing was the rooster (maybe roosterS) that decided to begin to call out morning around 4am each morning. NOT good.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: davidmi1
Reviews.Content: While Hana is a beautiful spot and the hotel at first glance seems really pretty and in a lovely setting, we were extremely disappointed with what we got for the price we paid. Perhaps we made a mistake in staying for 6 nights which was way to long. The food was pretty ordinary and of limited choice. With the one restaurant in Hana being owned by the hotel this limited things further. Despite a 2002 refurbishment we found the hotel a little run down. Rusty bathroom fittings, below par service (eg in 6 nights no new soap, shampoo delivered), and a long list of other things that one would not expect for the prices this hotel charges.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful not to drink local water & don't stay in the Waikoloa suites”
Reviews.Author: 3smoothsailers
Reviews.Content: We (3 adults & a 5 yr old) stayed 1 week in the Waikoloa suites and were very disappointed. We all suffered major mosquito bites every day, nite & day, no matter how vigilante we were about keeping the windows & doors shut at all times. It took us a couple of days to realize we were eating off soap encrusted dishes since the dishwasher couldn't complete the clean cycle. One of us had serious runs because of this. We called them about the dishwasher problem and we never got a response. So for the rest of the week we washed everything by hand which was a pain because we don't even do this at home! On day of arrival, we had checked if the local water was drinkable and they had said yes. Even though they give you free bottled water we didn't want to contribute to the local environmental issues, so we would drink water from the tap as much as possible...guess what? By the 3rd day, all 3 of us adults had major runs. Once we stopped drinking tap water and didn't use the dishwasher, we were back to normal. Good thing we didn't give our child any local water. The dining rooms chairs were all peeling off & when you wear shorts, all the pieces would stick to your thighs & legs, etc. and made a mess throughout the house. We asked them if they could exchange the chairs & we got no response about this again. When we checked in we found rusty knives which they were able to exchange with clean ones for us. What we don't understand is how could they be charging $1800 a nite for this suite with all these problems? The staff tried their best to help us but it seems to be more of a management issue. It looks like "owner" doesn't want to spend money to fix the major items & just let the property go.

Reviews.Title: “Organic, Local, Paradise Lost - a Luxurious Eco-Resort Experience”
Reviews.Author: Doctor_D303
Reviews.Content: I do not typically write reviews of my vacation accommodations and trips but this one has stayed with me for so long that I am compelled to write about, although I am hesitant to publicize this magical place... Hidden away on the "other side" of Maui, the town of Hana and it's Resort are lost in a magical time and place. The Resort is beautifully manicured, quietly majestic, and subtly surrounded by the town's markets and mystical beaches. The cottages are unbelievable! Huge open rafter ceilings, amazing ocean views through barn door style giant sliding walls onto the decks and jacuzzi. Giant open bathrooms. Yet, everything is designed with an eye for privacy. The food is very special. All grown on the surrounding small scale organic farms by families and cooperatives. Beef is from the ranch on the other side of the mountain. Fresh fish, amazing sushi. The hotel restaurant had the best salad bar that my wife or I had ever experienced. Hana and it's surrounding beaches and National Park are stunning. Waterfalls and idyllic pools abound! The Road to Hana is well worth the drive. The photo opportunities are endless. Weddings, honeymoons, and anniversaries...any time you want to capture the magic of the moment or celebration, this is the place. The Resort's resident wedding and events planner is a pro and showed us countless spectacular spots for ceremonies from intimate to grand. The photographer, who has a studio on site, is a local who knows all the special hidden spots for once in a lifetime photo opportunities. The facilities are all top notch. Spa facilities and general amenities throughout are on a standard comparable to luxury spas and resorts in Los Angeles, for example. But, all is tasteful and subdued. No flash or gaudy displays, it would not harmonize with the natural beauty. The weather is paradise. The warmth and humidity are gently bathed in constant cooling breezes. Cleansing rains punctuate the days. Neither air conditioning nor heating are needed, but if you're habituated to an air conditioned environment and will be disappointed without it, then do not visit Hana. The lack of in-room television and wifi is a true blessing. The rolling sounds of the ocean and breezes are comforting enough. Time with loved ones is made more special. I was hesitant to be disconnected but it was fine, better than fine, really good. I came back with so much focus that I had two months of solid productivity that has paid off so that now I have time to write this and take time off again this week. Finally, the Hana-Maui resort, it's town, and the staff are truly authentic, old world Hawaii. Really the antithesis of Waikiki. The weekend dinner performances are true Hawaiian folk performances, with three generations teaching, performing, learning, and continuing the traditions. Often, time feels as if it has shifted back twenty, fifty, a hundred, or a thousand years. My wife and I have traveled all over the world over the past twenty years and this place is truly special. If you value authentic experiences, supporting local economies and families, stunning natural beauty, and subdued luxury, this is the place. We will definitely be returning to Hana and the Hana-Maui Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: MillionMilerMan
Reviews.Content: 15 years had passed since my last visit to the Hotel Hana-Maui. To my pleasant surprise, not much has changed. The staff is still warm, inviting and helpful. The peace and solitute are still as they were. The Sea Ranch cottages are still a wonderful escape from the world. From the lanais of the sea ranch cottages, you still feel like you have your own private slice of unspoilt paradise. The views from the dining room looking out over Hana Bay are still spectacular. There is still a wonderful serenity to Hana both before the day-trippers arrive and after they leave. The food is tasty, but not spectacular. It''s a bit pricey, but not exhorbitantly so. There's not much to do, but that's why I like it. If you want to walk, hike, relax on Hamoa Beach, read, daydream, pursue your artistic endeavors or simply spend time with a special person, it's great. If you need to be amused, DO NOT go there. The only reasons that I'm not giving the property 5 stars are: 1. The maintenance isn't flawless (the fitness center is sorely in need of an update/remodel, and the lower pool area doesn't appear to have had the landscaping touched in months--there are weeds everywhere around the pool), 2. The service isn't as seamless as it should be or as I remember (e.g., housekeeping and room service don't seem to talk to one another). Case in point: I asked a passing housekeeper for a few items for the room, including shampoo and ice. When we returned several hours later, there was plenty of shampoo, but no ice. Later, I learned that "room service" handles ice, not housekeeping. At a 5 Star hotel, the guest should not be bothered with such "internal disconnects". 3. The menu, while nice, is not updated too frequently. For a longer stay (the kind you really need to truly relax), the menu could get a bit old. Still, the HHM lives up to its reputation. It offers wonderful solace and beauty and a welcoming home at the end of the Highway!

Reviews.Title: “Could be so much better”
Reviews.Author: predicttowin
Reviews.Content: The Hana Maui is the most frustrating hotel that I've ever stayed at. By that I mean it could be so much better than it is. There is the potential for it to be a world class resort but, unfortunately, there are just too many flaws with it right now. By way of background, I stayed here with my wife for one week as part of our honeymoon. I would only recommend this place to honeymooners or other loved up couples as this really is supposed to be a romantic retreat. There were a few guys there with 'friends' who must have felt very uncomfortable. Firstly, the good bits. The location is absolutely fantastic. Isolated on the east side of Maui and hours away from any large towns, the hotel is set in impeccably maintained gardens which back onto the sea shore (not a sandy beach though). (When I say isolated it's only 30-40 miles at the end of the road to Hana, but it takes about 2 hours to drive. Do not think about driving along the road to Hana unless you are a reasonably competent driver!) The hotel facilities are very good - 2 tennis courts and a pitch and putt (free to use and equipment provided), 2 swimming pools (one of which is excellent), a fitness centre, free desktop internet access, laundry facilities and the spa of course. All very nice. We had a very warm welcome when we arrived and were given a free upgrade to an ocean cottage (which would otherwise have been $100 extra per night). The cottage was large with a free minibar (in theory re-filled everyday with water and soft drinks - see below), very comfy bed, sofa and welcome basket of cake and fruit. There was an ample sized bathroom with power shower. Other reviewers seem to have encountered all kinds of nasty bugs - the only problem we had was with mosquitoes (bring insect repellant!). We also noticed a lot of geckos running around but that's it. Sadly we had a long list of gripes with the Hana Maui which tarnished our stay a little: - The number one problem with the hotel is the level of service, which is amongst the worst I have ever encountered. Should the hotel review its recruitment and/or training policies then it would improve dramatically. The waitresses at the main restaurant all seem to be middle aged local women who really really don't want to be there. One of them in particular would shout at you when taking your order. It was almost comical. You really have to see it to believe it. Whether you then got what you ordered would be 50-50 at best. Or they may choose to completely ignore you. One morning my wife actually got up and walked into the kitchen to check if anyone was still serving us. - On a similar theme, housekeeping was equally abysmal. Our mini bar was supposed to be re-filled each day but it was hit and miss whether the maid would bother to do so. Missing out on cans of coke is one thing but when you plan ahead that you're going to have 4 bottles of water in there each day and you end up with none, it can be a bit annoying! We also left a note asking for English Breakfast tea to be added to the tea selection in the room. The maid wrote back that housekeeping didn't have any (which we thought odd given that we had it in the restaurant no problem). We called the concierge and she agreed this was nonsense. The next day about a dozen bags of English Breakfast tea mysteriously appeared in our room. Also, we had a serious problem with getting clean towels. Each day we would be given only 4 towels and despite complaining each day to concierge that we needed more, we only ever got 4. Until one day when we came back and found we had been given no towels at all! Finally, as I've mentioned above, there is an issue with mosquitoes in the area. Despite this, our maid would leave our porch doors (including the netting to prevent bugs coming in) wide open, which is also a bit of a security concern. - The Hana Maui cannot be a world class, or even a 5*, hotel until it provides a greater number of restaurants serving a wider variety of food. There is only one restaurant, which serves dishes that are supposed to be a fusion of cuisines and made from local ingredients. This is fine and the food is generally very nice, but day after day it gets a bit tiresome. The menu is supposed to change daily but it doesn't, or at least it didn't while we were there. At least one other restaurant serving say Japanese, oriental, Italian or French or anything else would be welcome! The only alternatives are the local Hana Ranch restaurant (which is essentially a karaoke bar serving burgers) and the hotel bar (which is essentially a wine bar serving expensive burgers). - The cost of food and drink is outrageous. I couldn't believe my eyes when I saw the final bill at check out. I'm so glad that breakfast was included in my package because it would otherwise have cost us about $60 per day! - Everything closes way too early. The pool bar closes at about 5 and the restaurant stops serving at 9. Even the hotel bar stops taking orders at around 9.30! Totally bizarre. - 90 degree heat everyday, fairly high humidity, expensive hotel - no air conditioning ... anywhere ... Why?? After a morning of typically abysmal service at breakfast followed by the no towels incident we'd had enough and asked to see the manager. To be fair, he came to our cottage straightaway and was very apologetic. He offered us a free meal that evening and a voucher for 2 nights' free should we ever come back. This was the best bit of service we experienced there. Despite the flaws, the Hana Maui can be easily fixed and I'd be tempted to go back in a few years when hopefully they might have sorted themselves out. As I say, it could be a fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon heaven”
Reviews.Author: beth5496
Reviews.Content: After 8 nights at family friendly hotels, our final two nights of our Hawaiian honeymoon were well spent at the Hotel Hana-Maui. THIS is what I imagined our honeymoon to be in Hawaii. We were warmly welcomed and offered fresh fruit juice, a kukui nut lei, and a cold towel. After we were checked in, we were escorted via golf cart to our private sea ranch cottage. The grounds are beautiful, serene, and uniquely Hana. Even the drive on the golf cart was peaceful -- quite a change from the previous 8 nights at family-infested Hyatts. Admittedly, I was a little "nervous" when we walked into our cottage and noticed that there was no TV, no alarm clocks, and no air conditioning, but I was quickly at ease after a dip in our private patio's hot tub. Our room was stocked with complimentary water, soda, and champagne, as well as banana bread, crackers, jam, fruits, and sweets. The bathroom was magnificent. Inviting tub and wonderfully comfortable stand-up shower with a heavenly shower head. Dinner at Hotel Hana was very good the first night. We ate at the hotel's main dining room and were impressed with the service and quality of food throughout the night. We also enjoyed fresh fruit and rum beverages at the adjacent bar before dinner. We spent most of our second day at the Hamoa Beach and then the hotel pool, then back to our cottage for the hot tub and relaxation. Later in the afternoon we played the hotel's 3-hole practice golf course a few times. The hotel is great because they give you balls, tees, and clubs for free. They also gave us snorkel gear for free. No hidden surcharges, which I greatly appreciate in a hotel. Dinner the second night wasn't so great. We ventured off the main hotel grounds to the Hana Ranch restaurant. Very limited menu and painfully slow service. My steak arrived undercooked and the white rice was cold. I woke up the next morning with horrendous stomach ache. I also didn't particularly enjoy the feral cats moaning next to the table throughout dinner. Back at the hotel... we were back in bliss.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property and spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bakesie
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight during our drive to Hana. The property was HUGE (60 acres) and beautifully manicured. We stayed in an ocean front suite (room 412) and it was great. Lots of spacious green grass, beautiful ocean, stunning infinity pool and one of the best views from a jacuzzi in all my travels. We ate on the property (not many options in Hana) because we didn't want to leave and come back. We didn't eat at the "fine dining" restaurant (we felt under dressed) but we did eat in the lounge. There was live entertainment from 6-8:30pm. The food was coming from the fine dining kitchen and it was about 25% less on the price. I had the kalua bbq pork sliders and fries. The fries were seasoned with a seaweed/salt/spice (I specially requested the upgrade on the fries) and they were amazing! My fiancÃ© had a cheeseburger and it was really good (huge). We self parked our cars across the street from the lobby upon check in, only to find out our suite was on the other side of the street behind the lobby. Later that night we moved our car to a closer lot. The hotel has a golf cart provided to take guest anywhere on the property. If you prefer to go into town to eat, the bell staff will take your party to and from the location. Upon check in they automatically give you a "tour" of the property on the way to your room and ice for your room in the golf cart. It's then you realize how huge the property really is. We called for the cart to go to dinner but ended up driving back to the second lot. Be prepared to tip if you use the golf cart service (especially if you are leaving the property). We gave $5 for the "check in tour and ice" and $3 for the ride to dinner. The hotel gives you a "mahalo card" to put money on at the end of your stay for their "group tips". The "group tips" exclude the Concierge and food and beverage. The property provides transportation, chairs, towels and bathroom facilities for guest at Hamoa Beach (voted one of the most beautiful beaches in the world). The hotel also offers free morning yoga classes and a recreation room with games and a TV. If money is not an issue, I highly recommend staying here overnight and enjoying Hana and the property. Pros: Room Pool and Jacuzzi Quiet & extremely private Food on property was great Waking up to horses by the ocean (next to the property) Cons: No air conditioning in ANY of the rooms (but you really don't need it at night) Not very well lit if you are walking back to your suite from the lobby at night No TV or clocks in the suites

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in paradise, maybe?”
Reviews.Author: nickied
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a three night special including breakfast each morning, champagne welcome and a candlelight dinner for quite a bargin. We enjoyed the winding trip from the airport to Hana- pick up a CD detailing the sites along the way at any Paia gas station. Locals make some great Cds... Start early. Our room was in the sea cottages one row back from the ocean, no hot tub. About a 7 minute walk from the main hotel where the restaurant and spa is. We could hear the ocean from the room quite well and had a great view and wonderful sunrises. The bed was a little old and had indentations where people sleep. There is NO AC! It was hot and humid our entire time there and even with all the fans and windows open, it was hot and hard to sleep. The bathroom was large, shower small. They have free coffee and sodas and water all free and replenished as needed. Very nice. But there is nature all around, including an old japanese cemetary at the very left of the area on the walk to red sand beach and a very loud gecko that clicked all night long and kept us awake. Should have complained... The only restaurant has a nice bar with pupu menu. The restaurant itself was wonderful for dinner- great service. great food. We really enjoyed a chef's table dinner with a tastigng menu and paried wines- well worth it if they have it when you are there. The breakfasts were included, which is good since it is very expensive. The SERVICE at BREAKFAST was the very WORST we have had anywhere, EVER. one server we had two of the three mornings was so bad (pulani or something...) that people would wait to stay out of her station. Try to sit in the station of the lady with short hair- she looked like she did an awesome job. The food however was great! We had it delivered one day to our room and was good there too. The pool was nice and heated and clean. The hot tub over heated and could barely use- like 105 or something. The poolside bar was decent. the drinks were ok and refreshing. The spa was quite nice, and the couples massage the best we have ever had anywhere, but I would hesitate to say that the spa was one of the best in the world... the locker room were small and had a cool plunge pool and a dirty steam shower. They have a great private hot tub that was very nice. The beach is about a 10 minute drive from the hotel and they do have a shuttle. I would recommend going during the morning or early afternoon as it gets shady later in the day. One of the most beautiful beaches with tropical plants. They have free towels and boogie boards and snorkels for hotel guests, and a guy that will lay out your chairs, you just need to tip him. You can have a box lunch delivered- NOT very good. Great body surfing and snorkeling. Not very busy when we were there... gets windier as the day goes on. One other restaurant nearby is not very good- Hana Ranch. hamburgers and such, No veggie foods... The best part was the sense of being very out of the main stream- no phone or TV in any room (though one club room has a TV and internet access- wireless). The grounds were beautiful. the foliage is more tropical than any othe island I have seen. Would I stay here again, probably not, but you should experience it at least once. It was a great way to start a honeymoon and the food was delicious. I recommend driving down to the seven sacred pool area early in teh morning and doing the 2 mile hike ot the falls before everyone else does. We also drove around the back way (some unpaved) which wasn't too bad and enjoyed seeing another part of the island- very dry and windy and much faster to get around to the other side.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay At Hotel Hana Maui”
Reviews.Author: Rayhart
Reviews.Content: Has an amazing stay at the Hotel Hana Maui! Everything was great from super friendly staff, to wonderful views, to the great food at the resort restaurant (everything is freshly prepared using local ingredients and include offerings such as Opakapaka fish, Taro Hash for breakfast, fresh breads & deserts bked onsite, and jams made from the local berries). The people in Hana are so friendly and proudly display the "Aloha Spirit" which made us feel so at home while we were there. We actually spent the end of our trip at the Grand Wailea and ended up wishing we had never left.... One great thing about the hotel is that they really focus on not nickel & diming you when you're there, so they provide in room beverages, scuba equipment, access to the fitness spa, etc. at no charge during your stay. I would whole heartedly recommend this place and will only stay in Hana on my future visits to Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning place to stay in one of the most beautiful parts of Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: jc11235
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel! Nothing I had read prepared me for how lovely and peaceful it was. We wanted to stay in Hana so as to be able to drive the Road to Hana at a more leisurely pace, and reviews of the other places to stay in Hana had me concerned about the wildlife which would be sharing our room. We booked 2 rooms, via the Maui Fling package, in a Sea Ranch Cottage and were given the two halves of a cottage. The rooms were huge, comfortable and clean. A large area in which to relax with sofa, wet bar and refridgerator. They left us cakes, fruits and drinks, all very welcome after our long journey. The cottage also had a large deck where we could sit and just watch the sea. The bathroom was very spacious and had a nice shower area. Others have complained about the lack of shower drape/door â€“ but itâ€™s really not necessary given the layout of the bathroom. Yes there are windows, but you can close the drapes/blinds for privacy. The rooms are some way from the main building â€“ you can either walk up, or call reception and they will send a golf cart to collect you. Breakfast was a la carte, service a little slow, but the view was spectacular with all the lush vegetation, so it really didnâ€™t matter!! At dinner the restaurant was very pleasant, better service and the food was excellent. One night we had the buffet and watched the Hula show. The two pools were almost completely deserted, whilst we were there we only saw a handful of others there, so we almost felt we had them to ourselves. I was told the hotel was only half full â€“ many have reported upgrades but we didnâ€™t get one here! The hotel was lovely and peaceful and relaxed, we felt as though we were the only people staying there, though the restaurant was full in the evening, so we were clearly not alone! I had been apprehensive staying there with children given what I had read, but they never complained! They enjoyed exploring Hana and the surrounding areas during the day, and loved the hotel, especially having the pool to themselves late afternoon. Although many guests are probably on honeymoon, I noticed a fair number of families, with all ages. We wished we had booked more time there, both to explore the eastern part of Maui a little more, but also just to relax here â€“ it was so peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven or hell???”
Reviews.Author: belllyjean
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I couldn't decide if I loved it or hated this place. After a stressful drive up the Road to Hana, behind a "Road to Hana Relay." Where every pull out along the road was clogged with people involved in the relay and not being able to stop and enjoy any scenery. We finally arrived at our destination only to realize that's where the relay ended as well. There is a town park directly behind the hotel (with nothing between the two locations to keep people out of the hotel grounds) that the relay was partying in with REALLY loud music and grungy people wondering around. When we asked the hotel about this they replied that yes the group would be having parties around town that night but not to worry that they would be gone in the morning and only a few of them were staying in the hotel. Well, were would be gone in the morning also because that's all we had time for and one is all it usually takes to ruin a nice quite environment. Eventually, we were taken to our cottage, which had been upgraded to an oceanview room and the view was wonderful. The cottage was really nice, if you're into the very open, rustic, one step up from camping kind of room. It was large but I kept feeling like I was at grandmas cabin because it was dust everywhere that had been baked in by the heat since there is no AC. The room is all windows all around including the entire bathroom. They have wooden plantation blinds on them that were so fragile I was afraid to try closing the rest after the bathroom one fell apart. There is nothing seperating the shower from the rest of the bathroom...no curtain or anything (felt like I was back in Italy) as the entire bathroom is all tile. It just made me feel like I had to wear my flip flops in there. The bathtub looked really dirty and was surrounded by window that could be seen from the main walk way. As I mentioned earlier there is a local park very close and anyone could just walk right into the building so it was a little scary at night. The room did stock the fridge with drinks and bottled water that was included at no charge and they left some nice dried fruit and banana bread for us along with a bottle of "bubbly" for our anniversary. The property itself is beautiful with flowers all over the place and the events they had did look good, though we didn't have time for them since we only stayed overnight. If you're going to stay I would at least book 2-3 days. I think any other time of year it would of been very quite and nice but since we had the relay to contend with (something I think the hotel should of mentioned when I booked) the feeling as wasted on us. They also make it sound like they have a private beach for the hotel but it's not private, anyone can go, it's just that the hotel has a little cabana that puts out some chairs for you. When we went it was very crowded with young, loud people getting ready to build bonfires so we left. Service was slow here and it took over 30 minutes for someone to come get us and our luggage when it was time to go (you can not drive to the rooms) and that was after we called a second time to remind them we had a plane to catch later in the day. Food at the restaurnant was the worse ever and soooooo overpriced. Don't go there, there are other places in town to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Exclusive, secluded laid back resort”
Reviews.Author: tidemom
Reviews.Content: Sorry I didn't write about this slice of heavent sooner. Being my first time to Hawaii I researched resorts in Maui extensively & when I found Hotel Hana-Maui, I knew it was the one for us. Very spacious rooms w/ large baths, walk in shower, very large, nice wet bar, view to die for. Beautiful, lush grounds, w/ jacuzzi overlooking Pacific. This is by far the nicest resort we've ever stayed at, but you have to love seclusion. At 50 something, I definitely don't won't to be where the action is.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: SBSuz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited the Hana Maui for several days when I was pregnant with our first son. We wanted to just relax and it was the perfect place to completely get away. We generally like to travel in the off season, so it was very quiet. The grounds are amazing with views at every turn. We enjoyed several of the activities, kayaking, snorkeling, even horseback riding. I would really recommend the horseback riding to any one. It is a great trail, with amazing views. Our guide was great too. You do have to be in the mood for isolation, as there isn't much to Hana in terms of a night life or restaurants. There also isnâ€™t a beach right on the property. They will shuttle you to a beautiful beach down the road. It was a perfect get-away; just what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Such a beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: pao_otr
Reviews.Content: We wanted a relaxing place for our honeymoon and indeed, this is the most relaxing place in maui. The locals are so friendly including the staff, the beach (hamoa beach) is so beautiful. There is no nightlife here only a quiet and serene place, yoga classes in the morning, the food was great. your surrounded by nature with beautiful scenery. We loved the spa and buffet with the hana community performing local dances. You definitely feel the hawaiian spirit here. They even have the best banana cake----definitely a must!. We decided to return this october for a week.

Reviews.Title: “Heavanly Hotel Hana-An Ideal Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Explrjunkie
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I recently spent four days at the Hotel Hana and Honua Spa. While we were at the hotel, we got married and celebrated part of our honeymoon; we could not have picked a more beautiful, intimate, and romantic location to officially begin our lives together. A few things potential guests of this hotel should know: There are NO TV's, radios, or clocks. If you are the type of person that must be surrounded by technology or obsessively check your Blackberry, then THIS IS NOT THE PLACE FOR YOU. Also, you are immeresed in nature, so you will occasionally experience bugs (the hotel provides you with bug spray in the room) and while there are fans and screens in the room, there is no air-conditioning...it's not that hot anyway. Open the windows, wear some bug spray when hiking around the property, and become one with nature.This hotel experience is about quite literally getting away from it all, so arrive with that type of attitude. Needless to say, my husband and I loved it. We stayed in a sea ranch cottage with an ocean view and jacuzzi. During most of our stay, we felt like the only people at the resort, that's how quiet and relaxing it was. Just the sound of the surf, an occasional bird call, and the star-gazing for entertainment. Perfection. Food is quite expensive at the resort, probably because of the remote location, not much competition for business, or a combination of both. Recognizing this fact from other reviews we had read, and knowing that our room would include a sink, fridge, and small kitchen area, my husband and I went to a supermarket near the airport and stocked up on some basics, even buying a small styrofoam cooler to keep perishables cool on the drive to the hotel (the Road to Hana takes a few hours, especially if you stop for side trips, but what an amazing journey and well worth exploring). Breakfast was included with our stay, so we'd eat a hearty breakfast and snack on our grocieries for the rest of the day. I'm a bit of a spa-afficiando and the Honua Spa is one of the best-maintained in the business. Treatments are extremely expensive (probably because of that "only-game-in-town" reason again), but you do have complimentary access to the locker rooms, steam room, plunge pools, and jacuzzi. It was so clean and beautifully decorated and I had the amenties to myself most of the time. A truly relaxing experience. My husband and I generally prefer "boutique" hotels as opposed to chains, meaning that we really appreciate old-world charm, historic architecture, and cultural influence as opposed to the "this could be anywhere" blandness of many chain hotels. At the Hotel Hana, many of the employees are locals and will gladly "talk story" with you, the prints on the linens and wall art in the rooms were comissioned by local artists, food is prepared in that "locavore" spirit, and there are classes offering hula dancing, lei-making, and playing/singing the ukelele (in which the instructor gives you an explanation of the history/cultural significance behind each art). Our wedding coordinator was Alana Ross and she was so warm and helpful throughout the entire wedding process. She arranged for our wedding liscense appointment to occur shortly after landing in Kahalui and she thoughtfully picked a time and location that would be convenient to the airport. She took care of absolutely every detail: flowers, lei for my husband, pressing of clothes, music, photgrapher, makeup, hair...the only thing my husband and I needed to do were make sure we brought our wedding attire! Some of the nice touches she included were to type up a minute-by-minute schedule for our big day, so we would know what was happening. My nails were wrecked from all the sun and surf I had been enjoying in Waikiki before our arrival to Hana, so she booked and DROVE me to a local woman to do my nails. During the service she made me, the nervous bride, feel completely at ease, extra bobby pins, makeup, and water at the ready. She even took photos with our camera so that we would have instant memories before our photographer could process all of his shots. The hotel is on the pricey side and I wouldn't think this is the best environment for kids. But I could not think of a more unique or romantic place to spend time with the person you love. Hana-truly "No Ka Oi"!

Reviews.Title: “Massively Overpiced and Not Worth It”
Reviews.Author: RazvanTheTraveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our 1-year anniversary in Maui. Given the great reviews of Hotel Hana, we planned our tour to include 3 nights in this luxurious but secluded location. However, we were very disappointed with the overall experience: 1. food is bad, and extremely over priced (for example the $50 /person buffet barely included some vegetables /salad , basic chicken + rice , and some shrimp/ scallops that were not fuly done.) 2. we woke up one morning to find a spider right in the middle of the room (the big and hairy kind that made me go "wow, interesting creature", but would totally have made my wife scream had she seen it first ). 3. we went to bed one night to find a bug within the sheets -yes, she did actually scream this time as a result. 4. on our last night we took an evening/ late night swim in the pool (which is probably the only thing I really enjoyed there) and all of a sudden 4 teenage hudlum-looking guys in shorts come running toward us, and eventually make their way to the outdoor jacuzzi, one of them whispering "wassup dog" while passing me and my perplexed reaction. We alerted the front desk and as it turned out, these were local kids, coming to enjoy the awesome Hana (by far the most developed undertaking in the whole of town Hana) hoping no one would see them. Front desk told us they had been chased away, but at that point the damage was done : we were already back in our room, wondering how safe we truly are in our cottage and on this wide perimeter that has no real gates, fences or barriers with the surrounding town. 5. everything is massively over-priced, and almost everybody expects a tip (for example the yoga instructor (my wife said she wasn;t even that good) suggested she be tipped); daily breakfast would have cost us $62.00 had it not been included in our package (and that's for plain eggs , OJ and coffee for two - nothing earth shattering) 6. they have no carpets in the entire cottage (we had the Ocean front ) , the bamboo floor in the room is sticky and does not feel great to walk barefoot on. No A/C ... and the cottage is very noisy when it rains , if you are trying to sleep (no choice there really) with windows open. 7. although the place would be ideal for a romantic get-away, our quiet and enjoyable day at the pool one time got ruined when a family with 3 very noise young kids totally took control of the pool and turned it into their private playground.

Reviews.Title: “What's not to like?”
Reviews.Author: WashingtonChicago
Reviews.Content: Wonderful plush hotel in the middle of nowhere. We drove from the airport and had a wonderful drive. By all means drive it and take your time. The hotel was beautiful and the people were just down home friendly. (not stuffy like a big city hotel) Room was magnificent and the food was the best that we had on Maui. Definitely go.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgetable start to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: lehnny9
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. My wife and I stayed here the first two days of our honeymoon before going to the other side of Maui. By the end of our stay here we really regretted only booking two nights. This hotel is by far the nicest place we both have ever stayed. If we could do it again we would have stayed here for the entire time we were in Maui which was 5 days. We arrived after 10p.m. after over 18 hours of travel our first night and couldn't wait to just go to sleep. We were greeted by a very friendly staff and driven to our beautiful room by golf cart. We were upgraded to a deluxe sea ranch cottage which was awesome. In our room was a hand written note thanking us for choosing the hotel for our honeymoon and letting us know there was a bottle of champagne waiting for us in the fridge. There was bread and fresh fruit as well. The fridge was stocked with complimentary soda, juice and water. I would compare the rooms at this hotel to a bunch of duplex beachhouses. The interior is open with vaulted ceilings and exposed truss beams. Our room had a huge bathroom, comfortable king bed, sitting area and breakfast/kitchen area. When we woke up the next morning we couldn't believe the view. The pictures don't do this place justice at all. The hotel is set on miles and miles of property owned by the Maui beef company. On one side of the hotel is a beautiful, rocky ocean front, on the other side are amazing mountains littered with grazing cattle and not much else. A really unique place. Rarely did we see more than 2 or 3 other couples at any one time during our entire stay and this includes sitting by the pool during the day. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful without being intrusive. We only ate breakfast at the hotel restaurant and it was extremely good albeit expensive. We took the shuttle to the public beach which was nice. In the summer there's just enough surf to make it fun but no so much to make it scary to swim in. As others have said, this place is not for everyone. Being that you are in a one story cottage with no air conditioning, you will be sleeping with the windows open. There are lots of birds so if you're a light sleeper and being woken early by them will bother you then you should consider this before booking. Also, being so close to nature also means dealing with some bugs (theres a can of raid in every closet.) We only saw one or two live bugs in our room over our two day stay although I did see a couple dead ones that I guess the cleaning staff missed. Overall though, the room felt very clean. I highly recommend the horseback ride. Our guide was a local girl who was very down to earth while being informative as well. I won't go on and on, although I could. The only thing I can tell you is if you're planning a trip to Hawaii this is probably exactly what you are looking for. It is a beautiful place and you will feel like you have the entire grounds to yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Awesome”
Reviews.Author: RBJones
Reviews.Content: This place was paradise for those looking to get away from it all and relax. This is an incredible old school Hawaiian hotel. A bit pricey but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Six days may not be enough!”
Reviews.Author: kaseysmom
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the hotel; in 2008 we stayed for 3 nights, this time we doubled it to 6 nights. It is hard to find anything unique to say about this hotel that you canâ€™t read in other reviews. The hotel is indeed very special but not for everyone. If you want nightlife entertainment, dining choices, lots of daily planned activities and air conditioningâ€¦well, this is not the place for you. On the other hand, if you love to hear ocean waves, are easily impressed by magnificent scenery, enjoy just walking about and chatting with people and are looking for a quiet retreat this is the place for you! The hotel is offering amazing deals right now and we stayed in the same ocean front cottage (with hot tub on the lanai!) that we stayed in the previous year for significantly less. Our cottage was huge â€“ lots of space both inside and on the deck. Yes, the cottage could use a little fresh paint but gee, itâ€™s Hawaii and on the ocean front. It is part of the charm. Yes, the cottages can be quite a long walk away from the main building but they have these cool electric powered (read that: quiet) golf carts that will take you wherever you want. For us, the walking justified the desserts! The spa is very nice. Again, it benefits from the solitude of the area. Lomi lomi massage was fabulous! My one complaint about the hotel is with the evening food choices. Breakfasts in the main restaurant were always lovely (great coffee!) with enough choices and home made jams. We either passed on lunch or ate at the Hana Ranch up the street from the hotel â€“ very satisfactory sandwiches and salads. Staying this many nights at the Hotel, you realize pretty quickly that the nightly â€œspecialsâ€� did not change much â€“ if at all. So, we became resourceful with mixing appetizers and entrees to create meals. The food (and the entertainment!) at the Friday night luau was excellent. We visited the two stores in the town (Hasegawa General Store and the Hana Ranch Store) and purchased munchies to fill the stomach gaps, if any. We love the vibe here. Very low key; very friendly. Many employees have worked here for literally decades. You have to love a place where the guests who are obviously frequent visitors exchange hugs with the wait staff with sincere inquiries on how everyoneâ€™s family is doing. Maybe some day that will be usâ€¦.

Reviews.Title: “The most relaxing two days i've had in years..”
Reviews.Author: architecta
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked this hotel for our first 2 nights in Maui so that we could fly in, do the Hana Highway drive on our first full day and then explore Hana before heading back around the island to Lahaina. Not only was it beautiful, but the staff was gracious, our garden cabin was large, clean and well situated on the grounds and the views were incredible. I also indulged in a fantastic spa treatment and enjoyed using their facilities (the cold dip, sauna, etc is free to guests). The only complaint is that the food is only mediocre, and I realize that coming from NYC maybe we're a bit spoiled - but it was okay, breakfast being the best meal served. There really is not any other options in Hana and the view during your meal is spectacular. The hotel also has guest services at Hamoa Beach (chairs, snorkel gear, showers) which is close by. This is the type of accommodations you book if you want to turn off your cell phone for 2 days and wake up every morning to watch the sun rise and drink coffee on the lanai with whomever you are traveling with. The perfect detox from busy NYC. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular!!!! BEST place i've ever stayed!!!”
Reviews.Author: ilovereb
Reviews.Content: This place can only be described as complete perfection. After an exhaustive search, I came here with a group of 12 very different guests for my wedding and all guests described it as incredible, amazing and PERFECT! There is a new chef and the food was amazing. This place is the best of everything... compete privacy and relaxation, with the modern amenities only a phone call away. This is complete luxury compared to the abysmal tourist chain resorts on the West side of Maui. All the staff is outstanding. Do not miss!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “simply my favorite”
Reviews.Author: Mark W
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Hotel Hana Maui for almost twenty years. It's never disappointed and I do recommend at least a ten day stay.
