Although we tried the beautiful lava rock hot tub, the temperature was a bit too hot for our day-old sunburned legs to take. We were invited to partake in a pupu/cocktail reception at the Plantation House; this was fun and we met the hotel's General Manager, who just took the helm two months ago (former Hyatt with 30 years of hotel experience). Sounds like he will do a lot of good for this place, which seems to have suffered from inconsistent service in years past. We enjoyed the tasting dinner at the hotel's main restaurant in the evening. It was very, very expensive ($300). The food was flavorful and the wine pairings were spot on, but I am not sure I would say it was worth what we paid. Given that it was our last night, we thought we'd splurge... but I wouldn't do it again. Next time, we'll likely eat our meals at the less expensive Paniolo Bar. Overall, we enjoyed staying here immensely and plan to return. We simply adored our cottage and with only 1.5 days at the resort, we didn't take advantage of the 3-hole golf, the bikes, the full suite of spa services, the workout room, the hammocks, the horseback excursions, the croquet, or any of the nearby sights (O'heo Gulch, Venus Pool, etc.). Next time, we plan to stay at least 3 full days, so that we can relax as well as have enough time to do all of the things that are available. You will not find a bunch of things to do in Hana - that much is true. However, if you enjoy the outdoors, there are plenty of athletic choices as well as relaxing sightseeing that can be done, which is where we found most of Hana's charm. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon Location”
Reviews.Author: MattNY
Reviews.Content: So, on our second stop on the Hawaii honeymoon, we flew to Maui and drove to Hana (roughly 3 hours on the very scenic Hana Highway). What an amazing place this was. I'm sorry we only stayed there two nights. The staff is incredible. They all come from the town of Hana and most grew up there and continue to live in what most will consider one of the most remote places possible in the US. It's gorgeous and peaceful, if quiet. First, when we checked in, they took us and our luggage by golf cart to our room, with a tour of the grounds. Gorgeous. When we got to our room, and we were upgraded to a deluxe oceanview cottage, there was a bottle of champagne in the fridge with a note welcoming us and thanking us for choosing them for our honeymoon. Classy. By the way, the fridge was stocked with complimentary water/soda/juice and there was snacks (including banana bread and fruit) in the kitchen. What was a first for me, was that the coffee in the room is whole bean, and they provide a grinder. They have tennis courts, two pools (the infinity pool has the bar) and an adequate gym (with the best view ever). None of the rooms have tvs or radios, which is fine, as the sound of the waves crashing (we left the big door open all night) knocked us out each night. The only downside is the bugs. You're smack in the middle of nature, so they're to be expected. While the condition of the grounds is top-notch, the screens in our unit (like other reviews) needed repair and contributed to the problem. We even saw a lizard running around the walls a couple of times. When we called to complain about the bugs and lizard, they told us that the lizard is helpful, he eats the bugs. But they did come on down and spray when we were at dinner the first night. Recommendation - the food in the main restaurant is pretty darn good, but I'd recommend skipping the Ranch for dinner. It's a small menu and not very good. The spa is probably the most expensive spa I've every been to, and Cynthia gave the most amazing Thai massage - so it was worth it. The hotel maintains the Honua Beach nearby - so there are chairs, towels and decent bathrooms there for hotel guest. It's a gorgeous beach with the finest black and white sand. Overall, we loved the place and the staff was top notch. The setting is perfect for a romantic getaway and we're already thinking about how soon we can plan another trip back. It's a truly special place. We were sorry to leave.

Reviews.Title: “There Will Be Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: KeepingEmHonest
Reviews.Content: Here's the deal with the hotel: It's remote. It's quiet. It has beautiful views. The rooms are nice and clean. HOWEVER, you are in the tropics, and there are bugs. Not just ants! Mini-cockroaches and larger cockroaches. If you can deal with this, then you will enjoy yourself. I really liked the place, but could not deal with the bugs. They were mainly in the bathroom and near the frig. Needless to say, I didn't sleep very well. On the positive side: The food at the hotel is great. The lounge area was so much fun. The views are breathtaking. The service was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Not Really Four Star”
Reviews.Author: FrqntTrvlr1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Hana for three nights during our honeymoon. I don't quite understand the other reviews, except to say that there are amazing views and the property is well-manicured. This place is like a fancy summer camp, but not that fancy. The rooms are infested with bugs. They actually give you a can of Raid in the closet. The rooms are sparse and are not air conditioned (our room was hot the first night). Our room had fixtures encrusted with dirt, damaged bathroom tiles, loud pipes, peeling paint on the lanai, and was very dark even with all of the lights on. The wood shutters had a faint mildew smell. The staff is not overly friendly or helpful, for the most part. They did not seem responsive to our concerns. We chose this hotel because it was supposed to be quiet and peaceful, but many of the rooms are right next to the Hana community center, which was filled with screaming children and loud music. It is worth spending at least a night in Hana because the near-by sights are great, but I would recommend checking out another inn or resort. The Hotel Hana Maui is overpriced and over-hyped.

Reviews.Title: “Remote paradise”
Reviews.Author: Rudy1150
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the Hana Hotel after staying 4 nights in the more "tourist-heavy" Kaanapali. I wish we stayed longer in Hana. There is a unique feeling of being in a secret and remote area of the world when you're at this hotel. During the day we only saw a few couples (sometimes by the pool, walking the expansive grounds, at the workout facility, or the spa). During dinner there were basically 2 seatings (6-6:30 and 8-8:30) and there are about 14 couples during the heaviest times. Spa: Expensive, but 1st class. Highly recommend the Lomi-lomi massage. 60 min was $140. Steam room, in-door and out-door showers, plunge pool and whirlpool were well maintained. Dinner: Overall, a good experience. Most, if not all the ingredients are grown on the island and were likely hand-picked. This attention to detail does increase the cost of dinners. The $55 for a 3 course mean (appetizer, entree, and dessert) are not a bad deal for what you get. Room: We stayed in the sea ranch cottage with hot tub with an ocean view. The feather-toped mattress was very comfortable and loved sleeping with the windows open and the ceiling fan on. Room has a fridge and was stocked with water and fruit that was including with the room price. The size of the room and the deck was large. Outings: Recommend driving to the 7 sacred pools at haleakala state park. If your up to it, there is a 4 mile hike (round trip) through a bamboo forest to a 400 foot waterfall. Bring water and a snack in a backpack. Certainly a 4.5 star hotel. Can't wait to be able to return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: SpokaneHikerboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 nights of heaven in a Sea Ranch cottage and what a treat this was. We arrived during a flash flood and literally followed a front end loader for awhile who was removing debris from the road to Hana. Very cool. But we were certainly ready for some peace after the gnarly ride in and boy did we find it here. Our cottage was a short distance from the sea, which crashed throughout the night. What a glorious sound that is to sleep to as we probably added years back to our lives from its soothing effect. It is a bit of a walk to the cottages if the weather is bad (it was) but they have great shuttle service with their golf carts although we got drenched during one downpour. They do have umbrellas available and we enjoyed the quiet walk back after an incredible meal at the restaraunt. We were a little nervous about the food quality having read past reviews. However as seasoned fine diners we were extremely impressed with the food quality and originality with the local ingredients. They have a price fix menu that lets you choose the number of dishes you want and this suited our tastes so we could decide each night how much decadent dining we would indulge in. Their wine list was also top notch for the islands, a special treat for us. The service was great and the spa was well done with a great steam room-plunge pool included at no charge.The staff was helpful directing us on nature hikes and called ahead for us to the 7 pools to make sure the road was open to get there. Our room was gorgeous and quite spacious. We are trying to figure out how to move in permanently. Powerball maybe? We cannot wait to go back. Spendy but completely satisfying.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: nigel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Hana Maui for two nights and I have nothing but great things to say about it. We loved our sea ranch cottage (#301). The views from the deck were as good as it gets. In fact, we loved it so much that we dragged our bed out onto the deck to sleep. We were a little worried about the food service (after reading the reviews), but we have nothing but good things to say since staying there. I will say that breakfast service was a little slow, but we got there at 7:30 am and we were able to get out by 8:30. We decided against eating in the dining room, as the bar had music and was a much more relaxed setting. The pool and jacuzzi were awesome as we basically had them to ourselves. This place is definitely worth a "splurge" and we will be going back for sure. An added treat was that they have a small 3 hole golf course here that we played (it wasn't maintained like a Kapalua), but we walked around with our "cold ones" and had a great time (the views are incredible).

Reviews.Title: “problems in paradise”
Reviews.Author: goinglobal
Reviews.Content: Our Sea Ranch cottage at the edge of the sea was at the property's far end so we appreciated the golf cart transport from the bell desk to the main lodge, esp after dark at mealtime. These are 1950s style cottages, with sliding glass doors and screens bilt before the ones we use now were invented. Our curtains had fist size holes in the linings, which only showed at night with the lights on. Every night I left the door open so the surf , 50 ft away, could lull me to sleep. We draped our welcome leis over the headboard so the scent would fill our dreams and dispel any thoughts of tsunami. We had only a shower, not the soaking tub we spotted on some balconies which might annoy some, since this is a top priced place. Since the staff all comes from 350 person town (3 plus hours too far to commute) when someone calls in sick (0r perhaps when surf is up) theres a big impact on service. Our first morning we waited 45 minutes to be seated for breakfast and spent more than 2 hours to order, be served and eat. And we are both light eaters. The three-hour breakfast commitment cost us 7 pools trip & our opportunity to horseback ride. In order to prevent a repeat we went to the store (there are only 2, and they are pretty basic & pricey) to stock our fridge. Our last night I ordered a grilled cheese sandwich and tomato soup in the bar. It took an hour to get it and when it arrived the sandwich was grilled on only one side. When you think of how they are made, it's hard to believe this was an oversight. The cost was $15. This still is a GREAT place but there's something wrong here. We learned that both the general manager and the food and beverage director have given notice, so that might have something to do with it.. The spa was really first rate even tho at first they had no record of one of our appointments. They fixed everything tho and the spa experience for both of us won out over the Grand Wailea's, which is first rate in an entirely different way

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Hana is no joke!”
Reviews.Author: berty101
Reviews.Content: Sorry for the late review, again! This hotel is incredible! We booked a bay cottage, originally, but upon arrival, they upgraded to a sea ranch cottage, which there are no words to describe it's beauty. If you want to be away from everything, without sacrificing luxury, this is the place. First, we drove the "road to Hana", which is a little difficult if you get car sick at all. We had to stop a few times so that I could get my bearings. Arriving at the hotel, we were greeted with the sweetest tuberose lei. I'll never forget that smell! Escorted to our room on a golf cart and were amazed at the size of the cottage. You won't believe it! Rustic and tropical luxury is the best description I can give. You also won't mind the baby geckos running around your room... they hide in the rafters of the ceiling, so cute (and I'm not a bug person or creepy crawly person and they did not bother me). I also saw NO spiders, so don't worry;-) The bathroom amenities are from the Honua Spa, please enjoy the soaps, as they are outstanding. You have your own private deck with chairs with a huge sliding door that almost encompasses one entire side of the cottage. Leave it open at night (with the screen closed, of course) and enjoy the soft tropical breeze and russle of the palm leaves. It's so quiet and tranquil. The pool is beautiful as well as the hot tub. Picture the hot tub with the view of horses crazing by the Pacific. Beauty beyond belief. Then imagine a beautiful volcano in the background! One thing to mention is that the sun is in and out. Best in the morning and gets cloudy in the afternoon because of the volcano. You won't mind a bit, trust me. It's all part of the package. The Honua Spa is not to be missed. The hour and half massage is amazing in your own private garden room. Afterwards, try the cold plunge, it's crazy! The lava rock hot tub at the spa is unbelievable. So many good things to say, I can't name them all! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Experience”
Reviews.Author: funfamilytime
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (two girls 10 and 13) stayed for 2 nights at the Hotel Hana Maui. We had done the road to Hana years before and knew that it would be a hard trip to do all in one day, especially with kids. Also, there is so much incredible sight seeing in Hana that it's worth taking a few days to explore all the area has to offer. We found that there was so much to do at the Hotel Hana Maui that we still found it hard to do all the sight seeing we wanted! The weather in Hana can be rainy; however, we were fairly fortunate. When we left, though, it was in a phenomenal rain storm - quite the experience to drive through with rivers gushing down the roads! My husband loved it :) We were greeted at the Hotel Hana-Maui with fragrant leis and lovely drinks. I had just been attacked by mosquitos on a short hike and they had anti-itch cream and vinegar within minutes, without me even asking. (They had spotted the welts :) This is indicative of the service at this establishment. Everyone is so happy to help. We asked for use of a volleyball for our girls and the one at the desk was flat. Within minutes, one was delivered to our room. Complimentary drinks were put in the mini-fridge. Good coffee and a grinder in our room. The bellman, (I think his name is Ken) should be commended for his excellent service. We had a Deluxe Sea Ranch cottage, which had a hot tub on the deck. It was such a treat! Our room was lovely. The ocean view from our room was beautiful. There are lovely spa shampoos and bath salts in an incredibly spacious bathroom. The pool was amazing - huge enough to swim laps and yet, since the hotel only has just over 60 rooms, we had it virtually to ourselves. There is no beach directly at the hotel; however, there is a beach within a few minutes where the hotel has lounges, umbrellas and complimentary beach equipment. The girls had a great time riding the waves with their boogie boards. My husband and I both had massages that were exceptional. He had the hot stone massage and I had Thai massage. The Thai massage was the best massage I have ever had in my life. I still feel great 5 days later. I totally recommend their spa facilities. The Honua Spa is highly rated for good reason. Dining is very limited in Hana. We had 2 breakfasts (fabulous) and one dinner at the hotel restaurant. They were good meals but a little quirky. My daughter ordered a chicken burger and got grilled chicken on rice ... but it was good and she ate it! My other daughter had a chicken caesar salad that had no chicken. Small things, really, in relation to an otherwise very positive experience. My husband says it was one of his best meals - lots of unique flavour combinations. We did the lava cavern excursion (interesting) and the hike through the bamboo forest to an awe-inspiring waterfall. We also did the oceanside horseback riding with two lovely young guides (one was Joleen and I wish I could remember the other girl's name). They were excellent with our daughters, particularly since our older daughter had had a bad riding experience in the past and was a little nervous. It was expensive but a once in a lifetime experience. The Hotel Hana Maui is definitely not a place you can visit on a budget; however, for 2 days we felt so spoiled! We're really glad we made Hana part of our Maui holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: hazelnutcake
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Hana was recommended by some friends who have stayed here on at least two occasions. So we made the drive. I think their hotel philosophy must be to treat everyone as if they are on their honeymoon, as one might expect or hope to be treated on vacation. When we arrived, we were given fragrant leis and they had glasses of POG (passionfruit orange grapefruit) that were delicious! We were given a very pleasant tour by the super relaxed bell hop. When asked if he liked working here, he said that he loved it. We arrived to our room (a garden jr. suite bay cottage) which was very roomy. An uncut mango, banana bread, assorted snacks and macadamia nuts were in a small basket on the dining room table. I noticed there were very small ants wandering in the kitchen area... then a small lizard came into our room through the sliding doors, which my boyfriend caught with his hat. This made me somewhat concerned that little visitors might have bothered us all weekend, but it was an isolated incident. Here and there, I noticed little ants in the bathroom, but not so many that it was disturbing. I think maybe they are drawn to the small or taste of the the Hotel Hana's amazing handmade soaps. I noticed something odd in our trash can when we arrived--it was an ad for the Sopranos (from a magazine?) that remained there until we left. I didn't understand why it hadn't been cleared... I liked the hostess who sang pretty Hawaiian songs w/ her ukulele at the front desk. The hotel has a tipping service that they request at the end of your stay, I guess partially so you don't have to worry about carrying cash or having to think about it until its time to go. They also provided shuttle service to a beach which has no parking... and there were towels and water available there. I believe it runs every two hours or so during the day. We ate all of our meals at the hotel, and they were really incredibly good and satisfying. Especially breakfast! These may have been some of memorable breakfasts I've ever had. Smoothies, fresh fruit plates that make my mouth water thinking about them, flavorful breakfast meats... mmm...it was all so lovely, and the breakfasts were included in our hotel rate, so all we had to pay extra was tip. The dinners there were quite tasty as well. We had a few quirky servers: one was a very sweet, polite and fidgety Michael and a slightly less than pleasant person who served us breakfast. We also had the pleasure of seeing their Hawaiian show during dinner, with incredibly charming and talented performers. It's so romantic there. This hotel actually had turn down service which was efficient and a nice treat too. What else? Oh yes, the spa! It was really relaxing and fantastic. You can also use the men & women's locker rooms/steam room/cold plunge (my goodness it is really cold!), and outdoor showers even w/o a spa service. The outdoor showers are a bit odd in that there's a gap between the spa wall... Someone could very much potentially see you naked. I didn't really understand that design flaw. You feel totally rejuvenated after a stay at the Hotel Hana, and even a little bit sad to return back to real life. So much about the Hotel Hana was perfect, I long to go back one of these days, and highly recommend it even in spite of its very minor hiccups.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, had high expectations to live up to.”
Reviews.Author: basileus
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to our stay st the hotel Hana-Maui, and upon arrival was pleased. I should mention this was after a long day of travel and arrived late in the evening. A fresh flower lei and juice was a welcome sight. Our sea cottage was wonderful, very comfortable to rest up for the next day of more relaxation.....what this hotel is all about. The bathroom itself is worth a stay. I mean the bathroom is really a sight. Now however wonderful and relaxing the resort is I did have some gripes. First the food situation, Ka'uiki the main dining room is great, obviously this is Hawai'i, everything is more expensive, but I honestly felt that the food was overly expensive for what you got. That leads to my next issue, I was there for four nights, other than Ka'uiki, the Paniolo Lounge (bar area) and The Hana Ranch (only open for lunch), they are all owned and operated by the Hana-Maui. You're pratically stuck eating the same food for four days. I realize it's no fault to the hotel, but something I should point out. Also, as I had mentioned four nights without any contact to the outside world (tv or radio) was charming at first but got a bit "itchy" after a while....they do provide a community TV and computer in the "clubhouse". Now for some finer details, although never really mentioned in any of the literature I saw, although we stayed in a sea cottage, there is no beach on the property to go to, at least not safely. The hotel provides a shuttle to beautiful Hamoa beach about 10 minutes away. Also, with all the beautiful materials and landscaping at the resort, some things that stood aout of place, was a water stain both by our bed and in the bathroom, don't know how it got there, the "modern" sink was awkward to use since the water controls were located behind and under the extended bowl of the sink that also facilitated some growth of mildew near the backsplash. This hotel is all about relaxation and not being in a rush (the dining experience may feel extended because of this). Despite the minor disturbances this is definitely a resort worth a visit while in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Hana”
Reviews.Author: JanJanTn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I honeymooned for one week in Hana in October 2006. We stayed at Hotel Hana, which is in my opinion the most romantic destination in Maui. I have visited Maui three times, staying in Lahaina and Kapaula previously. I recommend Hana for those who are looking for a romantic destination away from crowds. Rarely did we see other guests...in fact, we saw more employees on their golf carts! The rooms are comfortable, clean, and uniquely Hawaiian. It was wonderful to have no television! The fitness center is incredible...the view can't be beat and the Hana air is inspiring. It is important that you know about the food situation. The food in the dining room and in the bar area is fantastic. However, when staying there for an entire week, it can get pretty predictable. I brought an entire suitcase of food that my husband and I like because my brother (who also honeymooned at Hotel Hana) warned me. If you have an entire week for your travels, I recommend that you stay at Hana for at least four nights and then go to the other side of the island for a couple of nights. The Ritz has a fabulous view, although it get more rain.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 35000ft
Reviews.Content: Hotel Hana- Maui represents a rare resort capable of catering to both large families and couples. Idyllic landscaping, ocean views, outdoor showers, an ice plunge, scented steam rooms, tennis, small golf practice area, excellent breakfast, traditional Hawaiian dinners, three shops and quietude make this property incredibly unique. This is the perfect resort to relieve stress. The most stressful part may be just getting there.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Miss the Hotel Hana Maui!”
Reviews.Author: nwilkins
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved the Hotel Hana Maui! We stayed here for two nights in November and wish we had stayed at least a day longer. We were welcomed with a lei greeting and fresh juice, then taken on a short tour of the property on a golf cart before we were shown to our cottage (a garden view cottage). The cottage was spacious and very comfortable with a large bath. We had a lovely sitting area with sofa and chairs and a lanai. The hotel stocked the fridge with free water, juice and soda each day, and provided us with a welcome basket of delicious banana bread and other snacks. Our rate included breakfast, which was delicious. We also took advantage of the free morning yoga classes - a great way to start the day. We normally like to stay in modern, somewhat high-end accomodations and, though the Hotel Hana doesn't have televisions or other modern amenities, it was one of the best experiences we've had. Since there aren't many restaurants around Hana, we ate dinner each night at the hotel. Eating in the bar is a great way to go, because you can order off the restaurant menu or the cheaper bar menu, and they have live music in the bar at night. Service and food were great. Parking is free. Though the hotel is not on the beach, it still overlooks the ocean and has fantastic views. If you're travelling to Maui, don't miss the experience of relaxing in Hana for a few days!

Reviews.Title: “Great retreat”
Reviews.Author: GCrackr
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Hana-Maui is a beautiful facility. Our stay was for two nights Our room, a bay cottage, was in good condition, clean, a very large. Large bar area w/ sink, dining table with room for four, sitting area with a sofa, two chairs and coffee table, writing desk. King size comfortable bed. (with all this space, I was looking for the second bed!) Large bathroom with large tub (looking out onto an enclosed garden), separate shower (we liked the no-door feature). Large patio with two chairs, a table, and two loungers with another table. All was decorated simply, but very good taste with lots of wood. We had the basket of goodies noted by others, but it was attacked by very small ants by the first morning of our stay (there was a warning in the room information materials about the ant problem they are trying to solve). They replaced the goodies after we advised the front desk. We loved the bean coffee and grinder, and did not miss the air conditioning (the sound of the distant ocean was much more pleasing) Beautiful, perfectly manicured grounds. Both of our breakfasts were very good, but the choices on the menu were a bit limited. Service for breakfast was friendly, but leisurely (a.k.a. Maui speed). We ate one night at the main dining room. Very good (but not outstanding as it should be) and again Maui speed service. Limited selection on the menu, good wine selection. The other night we ate in the loungeâ€”Menu choices were the same as in the main dining room (partially changed selections from the previous night) plus additional items only available in the Lounge. I had a fantastic burger! Service here was again Maui speed but friendly. Service at the front desk, bellhop and valet was prompt and very friendly. Others have said â€œnothing to doâ€�. Depends on what you are looking for. After two days of all the â€œRoad to Hanaâ€� sights, we didnâ€™t see them all, and wished we had booked at least one more night to take advantage of the beach, the spa, the tennis court, and make better use of our patio just reading a book. Five starâ€”not quite. Up the food selection and quality a notch, speed up the service just a bit and the whole experience would have truly been 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Paradise.....”
Reviews.Author: SRFischer
Reviews.Content: I really struggled with which rating to put for my experience at the HHM. Positive things first, and there were so many positives, the absolutely fragrant Lei greeting and American Express upgrade upon check-in to start. The half-cottage we stayed in was nicely appointed, simple but tasetfully done. Traditional Hawaiian feel as many of the other reviews have mentioned. We only stayed one night and headed right to the hot tub/pool area when we arrived later in the day. The pool area is beautiful with awesome views during the day and great star gazing at night in the hot tub. We had a wonderful waiter at dinner, truly excellent service, particularly considering some of the negative reviews about the service.The dinner itself was good not great. We enjoyed finishing our wine at dinner and were the last to leave the dining room, Hana is a pretty quiet place but at night it is especially quiet and shuts down early. Breakfast was the best meal we had (we also had a complimentary lunch due to booking through American Express travel service), although service was definitely slow-more Hana style I guess. Really the only negative, and it's a big negative, is that we had three (that we saw) huge cockroach-like bugs in our room. I saw them scatter in the middle of the night when I got up to go to the bathroom. My husband killed them (thankfully) but it was difficult to get back to bed! Since, the hotel is in a rain forest like environment maybe this is to be expected, however it really disturbed my night's sleep. But for the amount of money for the room, I do not expect to find huge bugs in my hotel rooms. All in all, would we go back-probably, but would talk with the management about trying to ward off any bug issues.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in the world..”
Reviews.Author: lovinHI
Reviews.Content: I had made a reservation at this hotel prior to my arrival. Upon learning of an extreme family medical emergency, I requested a cancellation. These people had the nerve to request a Doctors Note in order to cancel my reservation. I would never ever stay at this place if there service is anywhere near the service I received.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place!”
Reviews.Author: MarylandLabLady
Reviews.Content: This resort had cottages, some of which are single cottages. Ours was a "junior cottage," which was half of a cottage. There is no air conditioning, but there are overhead fans and tons of windows. The doors to the deck are outfitted with a large screen sliding door, so you can get plenty of air, and the ocean is not far from the buildings, so there is a nice breeze. The grounds are large, and it can be a little bit of a hike back and forth to the restaurant (or spa & other amenities), but you can call for a golf cart to take you anywhere. There is not a beach on site, although the ocean is within view. There is a bus to take you a mile and a half or so down to the hotel's beach site with facilities. There, a beach boy will be happy to set up a chair & umbrella for you and provide you with towels, a boogie board, or whatever you might need. Their rooms are beautiful, the bathrooms are luxurious, the staff is wonderful, and your room has coffee beans & a grinder so you can have a nice fresh cup of Kona coffee in the morning, along with the wonderful little basket of goodies on your table. The restaurant is wonderful, and my lunch was quite possibly the best thing I had eaten in the last year and a half. The chef and wait staff took my food allergies seriously and prepared my food accordingly. My meals were fabulous. I can see why AAA has given this hotel four diamonds. I would go back to Hana just to stay here. I would go back just for the food! I did not visit the spa, but it was rated the best spa in the country. It's definitely a place to go for relaxation. You won't find a TV in your room. You also won't find a clock. You will, however, find a quiet retreat in paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhhhhh.........”
Reviews.Author: wizrick
Reviews.Content: Biras Creek,Little Dix Bay, Kona Village, PSV and now Hotel Hana Maui!!!!! Life is Goooooood! My wife,16 year old daughter,and I spent 6 glorious nights in Hana. We were not bored. The quiet was wonderful and the feeling of peace pervasive. The people were friendly , warm and welcoming. Stephen told us about the food booths at the softball games and they were great, as were the people who ran them. The food at the hotel was good,but selection was limited.Whenever we were too lazy to walk to the dining room,we just called and asked for a ride,and they came to get us in a golf cart. We loved that! It was very green,which went very well with the blue of the sea and sky. Just beautiful! Joe was great and we hope Cat and the baby are fine. Hana truly is heavenly!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “If you really want to "un-plug" and get away, this is THE place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Calgon18
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I went to Maui for the first time a few weeks ago. We started our stay at the Fairmont Kea Lani in Wailea and while we loved the Kea Lani (and our partial ocean view suite), it was nothing compared to the beauty and tranquility of Hana and, more specifically, the Hana Hotel. We are very thankful that we ended our trip with two nights at the Hana Hotel -- had we started there and ended with five nights at the Kea Lani, we would have been seriously bummed out -- we would have missed Hana terribly. Luckily, we didn't know what we were missing until we got to Hana. Hana is what we thought Maui would be like -- utterly gorgeous, quiet, friendly, peaceful, etc. It's interesting to note that I was warned about Hana -- by others who have stayed at the Hotel, by a travel agent, etc. -- because the lack of TV's, phones and internet might make you "stir crazy." I heard a chorus of "there's not a lot to do" and "you will be bored." Well, I have no idea what these people are talking about. If you enjoy the outdoors and plan to spend time exploring the road to Hana and neighboring Haleakala National Park, then you will have more to do than you can possibly imagine. Also, please take note: some of the BEST places on the road to Hana are located PAST the hotel -- making a stay there crucial if you are really going to see all that Hana and this famed road have to offer. On top of that, there's a gym, gorgeous spa (get a Lomi Lomi massage -- incredible), even more gorgeous pool and, best of all, SILENCE. We couldn't believe how quiet this place is. It felt at times like it was our own private, 5-star spa. So, if you are seeking an ideal location to unwind and decompress completely, the Hana Hotel is DEFINITELY the place. I cannot recommend it enough and take note -- I am incredibly particular about where I stay and what hotels have to offer. Some might even call me "snobby." And, that said, my one and only regret is that we only stayed there for two nights (again, because we were warned about being "bored" -- nonsense). I'm already planning our next trip there. STAY AT THIS PLACE! It is simply magical.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet, lovely paradise”
Reviews.Author: andrealee
Reviews.Content: This is one of those very special hotels that goes up the extra step from "excellent" to "magical." We stayed here last week, and we were so sad to leave! It is so beautiful and quiet, and the people there are so nice. We stayed in the "junior suite" area which didn't overlook the ocean, but was still very lovely. We especially loved the heated pool and the beautiful lawns and trees. We enjoyed all the meals we ate at the hotel-- normally we ate at the "bar" type restaurant, but for my husband's 40th birthday dinner we ate at the fancy place-- and wow, that was the best meal we have had in quite some time-- years probably. Delicious! I can still remember the flavor of the lemongrass steamed mahi mahi! YUM. Driving there on the road to Hana was a wonderful experience too-- so many great places to visit. Sometimes we felt like we were in Bali. It was really nice to see this side of Maui after many days in the more tourist-populated areas. For stark contrast, we also stayed at the Grand Wailea. A very different place!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Familytraveller31
Reviews.Content: Hoatel Hana Maui is paradise. My family of five stayed there for three nights in August of 2007, in 2 connecting garden view rooms. Wonderful grounds with only 69 rooms. Wonderful spa and facilities (although that's not why we went), and lots to do. The pace is slow and perfect, with no clocks, radios or TVs. Service is impecable, with every amenity provided at no additional cost. Elegant, delicous (and expensive) restaurant, where you eat three times every day. Hotel is the only one in Hana, and no other restaurants, so the experience is something like cruising. I'm not a cruiser, but the whole stay was so fantastic, I didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Total Relaxation in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Justmyexperience
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at the Hotel Hana Maui for four nights. We had an Ocean View Room. We stayed at three difference locations on Maui. Hana and the this Hotel was my absolute favorite - by far. The staff was very attentive. The mini frig was restocked daily with water and pop (no charge). And the view from our patio was priceless. The hotel grounds were beautiful. There was no air conditioning but even if there was, we would not of used it. It cools down at night and there was always a good breeze. The restaurant was a bid pricey. The food was good. We especially enjoyed breakfast every morning. We sat outside with a view of the Bay. I would order either a fruit plate or smoothie with my breakfast because they were fantastic. Dinner - note that the restaurant has a fix price menu which is a better deal than ordering an appetizer, entree, and dessert separately. We also ate at the bar one night. Similar menu but cheaper than the restaurant. Food establishments are extremely limited in Hana. We had the famous Plate Lunch recommended by our Bell. It is basically a back yard lunch business and extremely popular. I had the Mahi Mahi plate. Excellent! Can't beat the price either. After lunch, they served shave ice. Also excellent. The spa facilities were pretty good. I have had the best massages ever here at the spa. Ever.... I had Shiatsu massages and I still can't get over how great they were. Don't miss the spa. The only complaint I had about the spa facility was the lack of shower stalls. There was only one stall inside the women's locker room and one outside by the (women's) steam room. There was also a cold water plunge pool. The hotel had a great tipping system. You have the option to tip everyone when you check out at the front desk. I will come back here to Hana and this Hotel one day. I loved this place. Total relaxation in a beautiful and special place.

Reviews.Title: “loved it (and we don't love much!)”
Reviews.Author: ljlSanFrancisco_Ca
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a quick trip to the Hotel Hana Maui, and we'll return as soon as we've got time. There is almost nothing at all to do at the HHM -- a true getaway. We loved our spacious, casually-elegant sea ranch cottage with its amazing views, comfortable furnishings, expansive lanai, constant sound of crashing waves, and the "complimentary" mini-bar (stocked daily with diet coke, coke and water). The service was casual but attentive. The beach (a quick shuttle ride away, with lounge chair/towel/water service provided, and free use of snorkel gear, boogie-boards, etc.) was picture-perfect (though TripAdvisor won't take my photos!) and excellent for swimming and surfing. The main pool (would love to include a photo . . . ) is also lovely, and even with several families there with small children it was still peaceful. The HHM simply has too few rooms for anything to be crowded or noisy. The food, both at the hotel and its Hana Ranch Restaurant, was overpriced (what isn't in Hawaii?) and just okay -- but who goes to Hana for the food?!? What we actually enjoyed most was the fresh fruit (from Ono farms), BBQ chicken lunch plate, and banana bread we bought from Hana's various roadside stands. We were supposed to go from the HHM to the Four Seasons in Wailea, but we were so spoiled by the HHM that we arranged to check out of the Four Seasons (aka "Scottsdale by the Sea") an hour after we checked in -- I'll review that place separately. As a matter of fact, we liked the HHM more than even the Four Seasons Hualalai. We will return to the HHM again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection ”
Reviews.Author: teeyee
Reviews.Content: Beautiful experience, felt completely rejuvenated afterwards. One of the hilights was a 3 hour guided tour to Kapahu Farm arranged by the hotel. Our guide, Sol, was amazing and gave us a great education in the flora and fauna of the island. It was very inspiring, and we left we a better understanding of current environmental issues. I highly recommend going on this tour.

Reviews.Title: “For those seeking the luxury without the distractions of modern times”
Reviews.Author: atlbrent
Reviews.Content: The best hotel i have ever stayed at. The staff was incredible, the setting remarkable, and the atmosphere completely relaxed. It is truly the only place I have ever been where we have been able to just chill out and enjoy nature. Definitely for those seeking a romantic getaway and slow pace. Stay as long as you can so you can get fully relaxed...3 days or less is way too short. The temps are great here and you sleep each night with the windows cracked open. Not hot and not cold...alot like northern california.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: dtour_7
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Hana Maui after realizing we would need another day to experience all of Hana before returning to our hotel in Wilea. Our stay here ended up being the highlight of our Maui trip. The cabana was perfect, clean and relaxing with a beautiful patio facing their gorgeous gardens and the infinty-edge pool. The surroundings all around the hotel are so lush and gorgeous we spend hours walking around the property and taking photos. The staff took us to our room with a mini tour via golf cart. Even the tour itself ended up being a highlight with several photo opts of the kush landscape, nearby landmark and the coy pond and fountains in front. We decided to even treat ourselves to the spa services which was fabulous with beautiful relaxation and bathing area. Dinner was okay but we sent dessert to our room which ended up being the best part. Our only regret about this hotel was that we only stayed one night. Worth every penny -- this is what vacationing in Hawaii should feel like.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: WilliamRedBud
Reviews.Content: Okay, let's get some things straight: Sure, the restaurant service is sometimes slow. Sure, the prices are high. But this is Hana, old Hawaiian style. If you can't slow down enough to find your own inner indolence, you don't deserve this place. We stayed in an Oceanfront cottage for four nights (having extended - with wonderful Landa's help - our intended two night stay) and my wife and 10 year old son agreed with me that it was the highlight of our trip (thank goodness that we extended since our hotel in Wailea was a disappointment). Everything was great and everyone is so friendly if not entirely concerned. Would you be overly concerned if you lived in Hana?

Reviews.Title: “hanging out in Hana”
Reviews.Author: NancyPomodoro
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week at the hotel, and had a lovely time. Our garden junior suite (I think everything is a suite except the ocean view cottages) was large and comfortable, and the pools, beach, spa, and other amenities were great. The food was very pricey, and we preferred food at the bar (where there was usually great music, too): shrimp, great fries, good salads, etc. There are only three places to eat dinner in Hana: the hotel restaurant, the hotel bar, and a restaurant also owned by the hotel. Although we didn't go for the food, it would nice to have more choices. We went to relax, and that made it a perfect choice. The Hana Highway is certainly slow, but not scary. It is, however, absolutely beautiful. The hotel is a great place for quiet: even when it was full we were often alone or with only a few other people. If you're really tired, this is a great idea--and rent a convertible.

Reviews.Title: “The best of the best!”
Reviews.Author: DCbeachgirl
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is top notch. My husband and I stayed there for 2 nights and we wish we could have stayed longer. Definitely book a cottage with an ocean view and check out the early morning yoga. The entire place is just so peaceful and relaxing. I can't say enought good things about it.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place we have ever stayed!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AJBEILMAN
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Bay Jr. Suite Ocean View and loved it. This is not the top of the line room but still very very nice. The bathroom was huge and the view was lovely. I can't think of anything I didn't like about the resort. We were there for our 25th wedding anniversary and were treated like royalty. The staff was extreamly friendly, very very helpful. We would order a picnic lunch to go and then go to the resorts private beach, or go hiking to the seven sacred pools, lots of fun. I think the only thing I would let people know, is that, this is not the place to stay if you want to go whale watching, or deep sea fishing, or any of the touristy things they have on the other side of the island. This resort is for peace and quiet and enjoying "old Hawaii". What we did, is stayed 5 days here and then 5 days on the on the other side and did the touristy things over on the other side. It is also good to be warned that the Hotel Hana is the about the only place to eat on that side of the island. But you can go to the grocery store and get cold cuts and milk and cereal and keep them in the room refrigerator and have sandwiches and cereal if you do not want to eat at the hotels resturaunt all the time. Other than that, this place is absolutely wonderful!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven in Hana”
Reviews.Author: Seattlebeachlover
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a delightful three day stay at the Hotel Hana Maui which I had been reading about on this website for some time. We spent the first 11 days of our two week trip to Maui on the south shore which is quite different from the lush atmosphere of Hana. It was a good way to see both sides of the island in a relaxed way. Driving out to Hana takes three or more hours depending on how many stops you make and we were quite tired by the time we arrived at the hotel. The return trip back to the airport a few days later seemed easier and more enjoyable. Also, we knew what we were in for - lots of curves and one lane bridges! Unlike most of the reviews I have read, we stayed in a more modest room at the hotel. We had booked a Garden View Jr. Suite but were given a nicer room with a view down to the water and a little golf course right in front of our lanai. It was very private and lovely and, best of all, right next door to the spa where we could walk 30 yards to a lava rock jacuzzi overlooking the ocean and gardens. This is available to all but we hardly ever saw anyone using it. Our room (#11) was elegant and spacious and very clean. A lovely basket of snacks and a loaf of banana bread along with a fridge full of cold drinks was complimentary and very welcoming. I loved making our own delicious coffee in the morning with organic beans (even a grinder) and enjoying the birds and flowers on our lanai. The Sea Ranch Cottages looked lovely - they should be at $600-900/day - a bit rich for my budget. We were more than happy a little further back and closer to the restaurant and other facilities. The infinity pool was spectacular and we enjoyed lounging around and swimming there each day. The grounds were beautifully manicured with many walking paths throughout. The main restaurant was very good, if not slightly overpriced. We did not have an included breakfast but I sure enjoyed my $13 bowl of oatmeal - ate every drop! We had a lovely Valentine's dinner and appreciated the local, organic sources for food. The best meal was the Friday night buffet along with a great show of local talent doing the hula and providing beautiful music. The lounge music and food was very good, too. Great wine list. If you like to walk I recommend a neat 3 mile hike through the ranch over to Hamoa Beach where the hotel has chairs and umbrellas for guests. We did this and then caught a ride back with the shuttle van. All the employees were friendly, professional and helpful - the bellmen looked like they were really having fun driving those golf carts everywhere. I highly recommend this hotel for a splurge - that's what it was for us although I was amazed at the number of folks who looked like they did this all the time.

Reviews.Title: “A Promise Fulfilled”
Reviews.Author: operacat
Reviews.Content: Now that I've read ALL the other reviews, I have to wonder if I was staying at the same hotel as some of the people who wrote the negative ones. What's all this about the bad food? Not our experience. I took my mother, who had a really big birthday on Feb. 11th, and six of her good friends, to celebrate. My mother and I were in the Plantation House and the others in Sea Ranch Cottages. All of us are seasoned travellers, used to 5-star hotels. I say this not to brag but to give a reference from whence our opinions come. Where to begin? The long ride on the Hana Highway: Beyond delightful. Yes, as others have said: Must be done during daylight. If you book the hotel and have not experienced this drive, have the hotel arrange for you to be picked up at the main Maui Airport by Mr. Joshua Blue and his van. He's a lovely man, entertaining and knowledgeable. Having now done this, I will probably fly in from now on, as it's faster. But this must be experienced at least once; especially for those who love verdent rainforested mountianous and gorgeous scenery with a little scariness thrown in. Not as scary as the Amalfi drive, however. The Arrival: My mother and I arrived a day earlier than our friends and the lobby that is not a lobby is calming and gorgeous. Another reveiwer called the front desk staff "smarmy". I am still agog with disbelief. They were so kind and welcoming. The affore mentioned juice and cool towels were brought forth and all was handled with ease and efficiency. Kudos to Michelle and her colleagues. The Plantation House: How lovely! My idea of the perfect island home. If you can stay there, do it. It has two bedrooms, two full bathrooms and one guest bathroom, a large living room, large dining room, entry hall, an enclosed lanai along the length of the house and an open, but covered, lanai outside with teak furniture. Also a professional kitchen and pantry, as the home is usually used for large events and staff parties. There is the oft-discussed A/C and a TV/CD/DVD player in the master. We didn't need the A/C as it was very cool and the TV was only used a little. They were kind enough to bring me a CD player for the livingroom as I travel with my own music. I realize that this was a major request but they were very kind about granting it. I had two dinner parties in the house, done by the hotel staff with music provided by three musicians. Everything was beyond delightful, delicious and de-lovely. I just don't agree with the reports of bad food and bad service. Our entire group of 8 people there for six days, did not experience that. Quite the opposite was the case. Fabulous breakfasts and dinners with friendly service. Service is "relaxed", not slow. As the Plantation house is a bit away from the rest of the hotel, one can walk or be called for by the hotel staff in the golf carts, or best of all, rent a convertible. That's the most fun and most convenient. Now, this is tricky....The Plantation House could be called a bit "shabby". But the use of this word does NOT imply lack of cleanliness or that things don't work. It is superbly clean and it all works, especially the water pressure in the shower. By "shabby", I mean that romantic island wear from weather that one finds in the tropics. It's a plus, really. It's "South Pacific"; It's "Madama Butterfly"; it's Cole Porter; it's Rudyard Kipling; it's Hemingway. Our friends were in Sea Ranch Cottatges and were very pleased with them.....no bugs and no problems with anything else. Even though we had a lot of rain and "buggy" weather. The Activities Desk staff was very kind and helpful. We dealt with Moni and Janelle mostly; who went out of their way to be helpful. They arranged a great tour for us with "Steve Boy", who is related to most of everyone in the area and took us to private places including a pool with a waterfall where there were no other tourists....my island fantasy come true. The water was clean and divinely freezing and refreshing. It was a very personal tour that was meant to last three hours but Steve extended it to five hours. The next night, he came to the Plantation House with his wife and two of his children to make us a great Hawai'ian dinner, which was so tasty. As this trip needed lots of high maintenance for the birthday and attendent celebrations, I have to highly compliment Ailina Patterson in Special Events who helped me plan the dinner at the PGH and the private luau the night before, at their beach facility. I wanted typical luau food, which they provided with a real gourmet flair. There was a lovely band and dancers, leis galore and a genuine old Hawai'i atmosphere. The entire staff, bellmen, housekeeping, spa and restaruant, were all kind and friendly to all of us all the time. And we were a handfull in a way. The manager, Doug Chang, was very kind and considerate. I hope he is there a long time, he's so perfect. The only nagative thing I have to say is not directed at the hotel but the guests who insist on bringing babies and toddlers. This is not a hotel for them. There are two child-free months: May and September. (Too bad my mom was born in February). I don't know why people bring babies anywhere, frinkly, but they do. There is a lot for teenaged people and kids from, say, 8 to 12, as well. The big, and also 5-star, hotels at the other end have tons of things for younger children....take them there. Luckily there was only one baby and one toddler during our week and the parents were considerate of the other guests and the hotel's atmosphere of peace and quiet. For all other ages....Go there! There is a lot to do and in a beautiful atmosphere of old and unspoiled Hawai'ian charm. Operacat, Los Angeles

Reviews.Title: “The only problem is that we only stayed one night !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: juliebug52
Reviews.Content: Spendy yes...but it is amazing here. We loved the check-in. So wonderful after the drive. We stayed in a seahouse cottage. Beautiful! I loved the garden tub, the deck and all the extras. Next time we stay least 3 days. The complimentary yoga class was good too.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous villas and setting- tries too hard for such a relaxed place”
Reviews.Author: Sworn2Fun
Reviews.Content: I LOVE the Hana Maui. The sea cottages are to die for- big, somewhat rustic in their simplicity, with views that can't be beaten. The property is absolutely fantastic overall- just a gorgeous lawn spilling down to the rocky coast- just KNOW that their beach is a trip away, so it is NOT a beach hotel. Spa is great. The only dark spot on my stay was that, although the hotel was quite empty, the manager REFUSED to allow us into the restaurant in a) shorts b) sleeveless tanks (for ladies) or c) any form of bathing suit even with a skirt over it- at LUNCH. Now I am definitely against dragging in to a restaurant in your Speedo or shirtless- but in HANA, you can't wear shorts or put a sarong over your bathing suit? The formaility is a bit much plus at $700 a night I want to be allowed to eat at my hotel.....

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Travel'nQueen
Reviews.Content: I can't believe the negative reviews this hotel receieved. Did these guests stay at the same place I did? My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon and will never forget our amazing stay. Yes, it is expensive but worth every penny. I would rather have three nights here than ten night at a Hyatt on the other side of the island. But as with every choice, you must consider what is important for you. If you are looking for a taste of old Hawaii, then Hotel Hana is perfect for you. The resort pairs a true Hawaiian experience with luxury. If you want Waikiki and its obnoxious, cheap, touristy shopping, fake luaus, and crowded restaurants and beaches, then this is not the place for you. True, there is no AC, TV, or clock in your cottage instead as a guest you are greeted with a gorgeous spacious room, a peaceful resort, and excellent food. All designed to relax its guests rather than inconvience them. If you must communicate with the outside world, there is a media room with all the access that one needs. Everything about the resort is designed to make a guest comfortable and feel as if they are in their own home. Free drinks and snacks in the room refrigerator, maid service while you are at breakfast, in-rooming dining for the price of dining at the restaurant, and a tipping system that allows you to carry no cash for your entire stay. The complaints listed seem to come from those travelers that will always find fault regardless of where they are staying. If you are looking for a resort that is private and will allow you to make your own magical memories with those you love then Hotel Hana is for you.

Reviews.Title: “We Should have Stayed Longer”
Reviews.Author: lucy8181
Reviews.Content: The road to Hana is a review all by itself, I think its too over rated. Waterfalls were dried up, locals rude drivers and others places in Hawaii are more beautiful and less dangerous. Having said that, we decided to stay one night in Hana to avoid driving back the same day. We choose Hotel Hana Maui, as there are not alot of choices in Hana and this propoery appeared to be the best....and it is. Upon check in, Shannon greeted us like royality. Our room was ready and we arrived at noon. The porter gave us a complete tour of the property on our way to our room #507. Sea ranch with a whirlpool on the porch overlooking the ocean...how perfect is that? The cottage is so spacious and clean. Very Hawaiian decor, so dont expect the Four Seasons, but this resort completes the reason why we came to Hawaii. The hotel deliverd Macadamia nut bread(the best) ,fresh tropical fruit and wine. Pleasing touch. We went to the managers reception at the Plantation house and spent quit a bit of time talking to him. The staff at this resort was the best. We travel 4-5 times per year, so have a lot to compare to. We had dinner at Kauiki, the food was just ok. Very expensive. Slow service, but we had nowhere to go. That is really the only problem with this property, not alot of food choices. The art gallery on property is great, we enjoyed browsing and bought a painting. The pool is refresing and has a great location. To those who didnt know about lack of AC and TV, you didnt do your homework., try a Travel Agent. We loved Hotel Hana Maui and wished we had stayed a few more days(but would stop at a grocery store to shop first.) Sunsets and sunrises were beautiful and breathtaking. With our busy lives, it was perfect, nothing to do but relax...swim...relax...take a walk....relax. Perfect place to reconnect with the special someone in your life. We cant wait to retun and our stay will be longer.

Reviews.Title: “No air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: BurnedbyHotelHana
Reviews.Content: $400 to $800 a night without telling you there is NO AIR CONDITIONING. Hotel Hana is a fraud. Nothing on their web site discloses that there is no air conditioning. Frommer's book on Maui also fails to disclose the lack of AC. Located in the tropical humid atmosphere of Maui and no a/c? Fine if you disclose it. The question isn't whether you can live without ac here--some can, and as the reviews here indicate, some can't. However it a fact that most would want to know about before you book. That the Hotel deliberately conceals this fact--you won't find it mentioned anywhere on its web site and some review books, is cause enough to avoid the Hotel Hana for us. I checked Frommer's. Stellar review but no mention of this. Maui Revealed, to its credit, warns people about this. This is a criticism of both the lack of a.c. but mostly the omission of this fact.. Its fraud ---there is no other word for it, in setting guests up for a most unpleasant surprise. It speaks to the character of ownership that they would try to conceal this fact. Going without AC in the tropics may be something some would choose. But I have to believe that a number of guests are unwittingly sucked into booking here only to be surprised. If indeeed, going without AC is not that bad, DISCLOSE it and let consumers make an informed choice. What does it say about the integity of ownership that they omit mention of this fact from all of their promotional materials?

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place for a special Occassion and more...”
Reviews.Author: racoonian
Reviews.Content: Deciding to stay and celebrate a special ocassion at Hotel Hana Maui this past October was one of the best decisions we have made. From the warm welcome to the sweet goobyes, everything turned out perfect. Our room was lovely , the view was spectacular and the service was excellent. After a week stay at hotel Hana we felt that we truly belong ..... the staff worked hard to make us feel at home, they made sure we are satisfied and happy, that we get what we requested and they always did it quick and with a smile. We truly have experienced the warm hospitality and sincerity of the people of Hana. The food was great and Oh!, the Hawaiian chocolate cake was really divine!!! We had a whole cake for the two of us and it sure did not last long. May we add too.... they have great, beautiful artwork at the Hana coast Gallery located at the hotel. I am glad we did not listen to the negative reviews we have read on the web, because if we did we would have missed out on a great experience. When we left, One of the staff (Mapu) who works at the dining room made us a beautiful & special lei. It was a very touching gesture and we knew that for us it was not goodbye, but Aloha, until we meet again! We are definitely going back again sometime soon to see the many friends that we have made in Hana. We will surely recommend Hotel Hana-Maui to our friends. PS: I would recommend to a guest of the Hana Hotel to pay for each of your food, beverage, and excursion charges as you receive them; not to charge it against your room tab. The reason is because upon checking out, they had several charges that were not ours, including a picnic lunch that was part of our jeep excursion that we signed up for at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Tiphni
Reviews.Content: Beware there are NO electronics in the rooms at all, not even an alarm clock. The rooms were very pricey, but the location was beautiful. The spa was amazing (free steam, plung pools, etc...). We did eat dinner at their paino restaurant and not only was it the worst service we have ever gotten in our life but the food was disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: Natalie7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Hana Maui for one night only after having problems with another place we had booked. The one day that we spent there was the highlight of our 16 day stay in Maui. We only wished we had known about it sooner so we could have stayed longer! Everything was perfect. We decided to upgrade at the last minute to a Sea Ranch cottage. The front desk staff went out of their way to find us the nicest cottage available. The concierge personally greeted us with leis and cold, lemon-scented cloths. The porter gave us a tour of the property and explained a brief history of the hotel. Our Sea Ranch cottage was decorated with Hawaiian art and had a beautiful tiled bath, a bar, and a separate area to sit. On the table was a loaf of homemade banana bread and a basket with tropical fruit and snacks. The mini-fridge had an assortment of beverages which were included in the price of the stay. A small welcome note personally addressed to us was next to the snacks. We were lucky enough to arrive on a Thursday and enjoyed the manager's reception with appetizers and drinks at the plantation house above the hotel. All of the staff at the reception were warm and welcoming and this felt like 'the aloha' that people speak about. We were also lucky enough to stay in the month of September when the hotel is adults only. This made our time at the pool even more relaxing. The pools are open all night (at least in September) and we enjoyed a wonderful night swim. The view from the pool near the Sea Ranch cottages is fantastic, especially at sunset. We ate only one meal at the restaurant. It was the best dinner that we had in Maui. The menu had wine pairing suggestions for people less familiar with wine. The staff were completely unprentious, as is the hotel. The setting is lovely and peaceful. It is the perfect place for relaxation. It's not a good place for people who want lots of activity and nightlife - although there is a fair bit to see and do in the surrounding area. We were disappointed with the yoga class. The teacher seemed distracted and uninterested in teaching, This was the only flaw we could find with our stay. When we left we ordered box lunches. There wasn't a vegetarian option on the menu so we asked about it. The chef made us delicious vegetable wraps with homemade salsas. We had to wait a few minutes for our lunches because they were cooking them from scratch! Next time we go to Maui we want to fly directly into Hana and just stay at the the Hotel Hana Maui. The Hotel Hana Maui is worth every cent and we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Suprises”
Reviews.Author: jpczworg
Reviews.Content: Overall our trip to Hana was incredible. Our days were spent basking at the Beach - just a quick shuttle ride away and spending evenings listening to local musicians in the hotel's lounge. Even the food- which seems to get notoriously bad reviews- far exceeded our expectations. Sure it is a bit expensive, and the portions are not Texas sized- but while we were at the hotel we witnessed two fisherman and a farmer pull in past the front entrance delivering the night's meal. Knowing that the chef and hotel support the local economy truly made each of our meals a pleasure. The cuisine was refreshing and inspired with new selections each evening. Like the rest of Hana, the cuisine does not bend to the American standards. We tasted dozens of fish and fruit that we had never heard of back home. Some were incredible and others not too memorable- but we appreciated having the opportunity to experience the local flavors. After a week in Hana we arrived back in Kahului to catch our flight. While returning to humanity was nice, with its fast food restaurants and chain stores, I was able to forgive Hana for all that it lacked- because I realized that Hana does not evolve to what people think they want- it is what it is- not staged or contrived. As we got on the plane we felt as though we had been part of something fragile and unique - witnesses to a rare and honest style of hospitality that is more based on community than corporate standards or elite ideals.

Reviews.Title: “Possible to love or hate”
Reviews.Author: AgentT
Reviews.Content: The Hana is difficult to review - some people clearly love it others have been disappointed. We were not overwhelmed but it does depend what you want. The location on the slopes above the ocean is spectacular but the hotel property is spread out and "merges" into the village in an obtrusive way if you are looking for true solitude - for example, the restaurant and reception are set apart from the rooms amongst the village properties and can be five/ten minutes walk from your room. The Sea Ranch Cottages sit on the slopes above the ocean but are arguably too close together such that not all have unobstructed views of the ocean (worth checking out before you arrive) and are not ultimately luxurious. They are showing signs of wear and the effects of wind and rain on buildings of a basic construction. There is no a/c and no tv. The climate on this end of the island is consistently warm and sunny but Hana is in the rain shadow of the mountains and is therefore also humid and there are occasional heavy showers. The restaurant is OK (remarkable given the distance that some supplies have to come) but is not a patch on Mamma's Fish House (which you will pass on the road to Hana). The surroundings are wonderful (luxuriant reflecting the climate) but for what's on offer at the hotel it seems expensive. Overall, the setting is spectacular, the hotel less so but if you are happy with your own company, not looking to do a great deal but relax and are comfortable with a quirky, commune-style hotel which is not 4S luxury or service you might like Hana.

Reviews.Title: “A piece of heaven in Heavenly Hana!”
Reviews.Author: sommerlovin
Reviews.Content: Oh, put the Hotel Hana-Maui on your list of places to stay in your lifetime. We genuinely loved every minute of our three-night stay there... as did all the other people we spoke with at the pool, restaurants, and around the property. We honeymooned for 14 days on Oahu (4nights) & Maui (10 nights) and the Hotel Hana-Maui was the most incredible honeymoon place we could imagine (we also stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village and Embassy Suite Maui). For any other late twenty-something women out there, imagine Dirty Dancing's set situatated on the Pacific. Got it? Then magnify that by 1000 times better than Dirty Dancing and you have the Hotel Hana-Maui. Ah... sitting by the inifinity pool (open 24 hours, lighted, huge torches on one side, stunning view of the ocean on the other) on the padded lounges with the food shack feet away... it was heaven. We were a bit worried about food options in Hana, so I went overboard at the grocery before we did the highway (on a Wednesday afternoon - we had all the pools/falls to ourselves) - we really didn't need to, but the money we saved bringing a cooler to the pool with our mixers and liquor saved some serious money. It was worth it for us to mix our own during the day so we could splurge on dinner in the evenings. Food options are liminted, but Tutu's at the Hana Bay is a great place to grab a breakfast sandwich and sit by the beach - we loved watching an elderly woman create lei's, the lifeguard set up his post with the local kids goofing off around him -- it was such a different way to start the day than we do in Ohio! The staff (Adam in particular) goes out of their way to make you feel like family. We loved everyone we met - I genuinely cried when we left - I could have someone pick me up in a golf cart and deliver me wherever I wanted anytime of the day for the rest of my life. I told my new husband I wanted to sell everything and stay at the Hotel Hana Maui forever. Other tourists on the property were friendly and ready to make friends - seven couples (including us) met one day poolside and had dinner/cocktails that night --- such a relaxed place to stay. All in all, I would highly recommend a few nights here for any couple. If we had kids I'd go elsewhere - that would be a L-O-N-G weekend with no tv, radio, or kids pools. WE LOVED IT!!! (We also loved the upgrade from garden cottage to sea ranch cottage we got without asking!) GO! NOW!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Understated Beauty ... But Beware Of HIdden Fees & Cockroaches”
Reviews.Author: bluestravellers
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the Hotel Hana Maui is a little strange, as the hotel grounds seem to spill over the small town of Hana in a strangely overbearing way. However, the hotel grounds are quite breathtaking; and, if you are a fan of peaceful understated beauty, the seaside cottages, with their expansive views to the ocean, are quite charming indeed. The cottage interiors are immaculately kept, though we were greeted by 1 dying cockroach upon our arrival. We were sufficiently lectured - when informing the front desk about the cockroach - that we were seaside, with many critters potentially making their way into our cottage (but, are cockroaches really critters of the sea?). This initial oversight coupled with a few other incidents made us conclude that the service was pretty terrible all around (excepting at the restauraunt lounge, where the service was friendly, efficient, and warm). It seemed everywhere else however that there was a fair share of hostility in the air and an unnecessary fuss made (especially at check in and check out). After the drive it takes to get there, you'd think that they'd let their guests relax instead of making them stand around with lengthy explanations and indolent waits at the front desk as well as long-winded in-room tours / speeches. In a place like this, it seemed rather absurd to be so formal. Also, beware of front desk / room service overages, as both are very keen to overcharge your holding card. Check your bill thoroughly. To add, so-called 'complimentary' breakfasts DO include a $10 delivery fee + an 18% service charge. An average breakfast for two runs in the area of $80 - $100. So, be aware that the more they 'offer' you as 'complimentary' (ie. fresh fruit, an additional plate, etc.), the more they can tab onto the 18% service charge. If you can let the hidden fees and bad service slide, the place is really rather beautiful. We'd call it glorified camping at its best (with glorified fees to boot). It's worth it if you have a few days and a car to tour around in. Guide books that outline hidden treasures all along the Hana Highway will make your stay even better.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: charleston110
Reviews.Content: We just spent two nights here in July on our honeymoon. We were in btwn the 4S Manele Bay and the 4S Hualalai. I think we both thought the Hana Maui was our favorite. The 4S has a little better service with their Evian spritzers, and cold towels at the pool, but the Hana Maui was so totally relaxing. We stayed in one of the ranch cottages with a private hottub on the deck overlooking the ocean. I'm not sure which category it was, but it was great! Don't think luxurious 4Seasons - think relaxing upgraded church camp. The room was great, and we never missed the A/C or TV. We slept with the doors and windows open. What a way to sleep with the sounds of the waves pounding the rocky shore below. The pool by the cottages was fantastic. It was sort of an infinity pool, but my favorite part was the fact that it didn't have a concrete patio around it. The deck/patio around the pool was grass. There's a fantastic hottub, and a small waterfall falling into the pool. The gym is just above the pool, and is fantastic. The nautilus equipment is fairly dated and didn't work well (really at all) while I was there, but you're on vacation. The treadmills are in btwn open french doors looking down a hill at the cottages and the ocean behind them. My wife took the Yoga class and said it was ok. I think they have different Yoga instructors on diff days. The next day she saw the Yoga class and said it looked better than her beginner class the day before. We never even went to the hotel beach, so we can't tell you how it is. We used the pool and loved it. We ate burgers at the pool. They seemed fine to us, and not over the top expensive (I've read quite a few reviews complaining about the burgers). They weren't that expensive either ($12 or so) The Ranch restaurant was fine (a bit of local flair while we were there). Its not going to win any fine dining awards, but remember that you're in a small isolated village. The food was great for us. I had hawaiian style ribs, and my wife had a fish dish. Its a little expensive, but there are only 2 restaurants in town. The hotel restaurant was a little fancier. It had a large wine list (mostly $50+ bottles). I could see the service at this restaurant being a little below par if you don't know what to expect. Most of the servers are locals and they're not fancy fru-fru sommeliers from Manhattan. They're mostly from Hana. If you go into this knowing that, you'll be fine. Our server was fantastic, though. The live entertainment in the bar was great too. I only wish we could've spent more time there. This place is for the people that really want to relax. The drive up from the airport (OGG) was awesome. Waterfalls, hikes, etc. (get a guidebook). I would also recommend doing the powered hanggliding with Armen at the Hana Airport. That was fantastic. We also did the kayaking/snorkeling trip through the hotel, but through a local guy. I wouldn't really recommend this. The coral is mostly dead b/c of the waves, and the guide is much more interested in selling you his video service than the snorkeling or kayaking. However, if you have more than 2 or 3 days, it may be worth doing. Of the 3 Hotels we stayed at in Hawaii (4S Manele, and 4S Hualalai) the Hana Maui was our favorite. The 4S are nicer, have better amenities, sheets, frivolous services, but the Hana Maui really was a place to get away from it all. The people were nice, and we met more than a few people who had been coming for over 20yrs. We'll definitely be back, and we'll definitely stay for at least 3-4 night next time!

Reviews.Title: “14 trips to Hawaii and our best experience yet!”
Reviews.Author: OCB
Reviews.Content: We have made 14 trips to Hawaii and have visited most of the islands The Hotel Hana Maui is a now our favorite resort in all the islands. We spent two nights earlier this week in one of the Sea Ranch Cottages. The additional cost for a Sea Ranch Cottage is worth every penny. You will have an unforgettable view of the Pacific and more privacy than you will ever have in a traditional hotel. The hotel restaurant is highly recommended. And, of course, the Hana area is truly paradise.

Reviews.Title: “All in All,,,,Pretty Cool”
Reviews.Author: Texas George
Reviews.Content: Overview; The Hana hotel is at the terminus of the Hana Highway. As you read other reviews some find the trip a nightmare, others it is no big deal.
