We fall into the no big deal catagory. The road is quite scenic in spots and there are several roadside pullouts to stop. This end of the island is toatly different from the rest of the island's terrain. Local flura is a rain forest. Activities are all nature oriented. There is no real town, just a very small grocery, gas 7-11 type and 2 restaurants. Weather was really bad during our trip so no beach time or sunsets. Give way to the speeding locals to let them pass. The Good: If you have never visited a rain forest this is really a great area. You can stop along the road and visit the forest in several areas. Purchase the CD at the Shell station. Info in tourist areas. This gives a great narrative of the trip. The hotel is laid our on a sloping hillside that may be as much as 1/2 mile from the furthest cabana to the main lodge. Keep this in mind if walking is an issue. Nice outdoor pool and gym. Spa appeared first rate. We ate one meal in the lodge. I enjoyed the fare, even though it is pricey, and portions are small. The ranch across the street also serves on Wends and Sat nights. Much better fare for meat eaters. Need reservations. We grabbed some snacks in the local store and ate sandwiches etc. Also do the waterfall hike in the National Park, a few miles from the Hotel. Hotel propery is as advertised on the internet site. The cabanas are pretty private but not completely private. There is a small fridge in the room. Great coffee and free soft drinks. The hotel property is very senic The Bad: As are all properties in Maui they are pricey. There is no a/c, tv or radio in the rooms. (this may be good as well...) Bring books. No Microwave. The Ugly: As they tell you in the airport do not leave your valuables unattended or in sight in your car. Tough to do as most everyone drives an SUV, jeep or conv. We heard of several people being broken into on the road. All the guide books discourage you from going around the island to Waliea. Locals report road is supposed to be soft in spots but can be driven by a two wheel drive. Would not want to try in wet weather or a car. Also remember, there are almost NO 4 wheel drive vehicles on the island, jeeps included. We were also warned about abusive locals in the area state park.

Reviews.Title: “Total relaxation”
Reviews.Author: lyssak
Reviews.Content: If you want a place where you can completely unwind, Hotel Hana-Maui is the place. My husband and I just returned from a 10 day trip to Hawaii. We spent the last three nights at the Hana-Maui. We had a Sea Ranch Cottage with hot tub. I booked this without consulting my husband, who is very picky about hotels and only likes the most luxurious accomodations and finest food. He also is a total workaholic who checks his email 50 times a day. I was a little worried about how he would react to the lack of A/C and no TV or internet in the room. What was amazing is that my husband loved it. He totally relaxed, and even took the yoga class each morning! When we got to our room, my first impression was of areally nice summer cottage. Our room had cathedral ceilings, huge sliding doors onto the deck from the living room and bedroom, cooled by ocean breezes and a ceiling fan. The view to the ocean was spectacular. The deck had two chaise longues, and a dining table with chairs, plus the hot tub (which was sparkling clean). The large bedoom was clean and simply decorated (natural wood floors, plantation shutters on the windows), with a very comfortable king size bed (it felt like there was a featherbed, but didn't check) with many fluffy pillows. The bathroom was large and nicely done with lots of wood and stone. Activities: there is yoga in the morning, a fitness room (newly remodeled), a three hole chip and putt, croquet, two lighted tennis courts, a fitness pool, and another beautiful large pool with waterfall and hot tub. We did a sea kayak/snorkel tour of Hana Bay (the coral reef, sadly, is mostly dead, but the sea kayaking was exhiliarating). The hotel also has a setup on a nearby beach--a shuttle takes you there on the hour. There are chaise longues, towels, boogie boards, etc. all free for hotel guests. We went on a great hike in Haleakala National Park. We splurged on the spa, and had massages each day. The massage therapists we had, Serena and Finn, were excellent and really nice. The spa is beautiful, and you can use the steam rooms, outdoor showers, and lava hot tub even if ou are not getting a treatment. I admit that the food at the hotel is a bit uneven. Most of the things we had were delicious and nicely presented, but at that price everything should be really great. The breakfast buffet should be avoided--few choices and the quiche sits out forever. Order an omelet off the a la carte menu instead--freshly made and delicious. The french fries in the bar, seasoned with seaweed and sesame, are delicious and the "share size" portion is huge. Our dinners were always delicious. The chef is into using organic, locally grown ingredients. The service was fine. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. We asked for diet Coke and water (instead of assorted sodas and juices) in our complementary minibar and got it, no problem. The other guests were a real mix--some families (3 generations), some young honeymooners, straight couples, gay couples, older people...everyone was very mellow and nice but not in your way. All in all, this is a place to go if you want to shut off the noise in your head and just relax in a place with incredible natural beauty.

Reviews.Title: “Not For Us..”
Reviews.Author: sptz79
Reviews.Content: We planned on staying at the Hotel Hana-Maui for the last few nights of our honeymoon, but we cut it short after the first night. It was definitely beautiful, but it was.. shall I say â€¦ unique. Honestly it was just too hot. I definitely understand not spoiling the natural ambiance with the buzz of air conditioning, however the reality of it was not as romantic as one may think. It was way too humid, and we didnâ€™t feel any of the â€˜cool ocean breezeâ€™ that previous reviewers mentioned. In addition sleeping with every window open made us feel a bit unsafe, yes I know its Hana, but still! In addition there were various insects and lizards in the room, which is fine, but not really for us. The place gave off and â€˜upgraded summer campâ€™ kind of feeling. The food wasnâ€™t anything to rave about either. It was high on price, but unfortunately also low on tasteâ€¦ On the up side the staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and the views were definitely beautiful. This place wasnâ€™t for us. However if you really want to immerse yourself in the outdoors, but still retain some of the comforts of a resort you may find the Hotel Hana-Maui to your liking.

Reviews.Title: “awesome views!!”
Reviews.Author: Lost_in_Pittsburgh
Reviews.Content: We visited Hana for a few days and stayed at Hotel Hana on the last day. The view from the Sea Ranch cottage was wonderful!! It was quiet, our own piece of paradise for a day. The beautiful pool with ocean view was amazing. We used the little gym. And enjoyed the view from a hammock. We loved the private hottub on the deck of our cottage!!! Enjoyed the huge bathroom with great bathsalts!! The staff was wonderful. Breakfast and dinner were really nice at the hotel restaurant. They had a lot of great flavor combinations. My one complaint is that dessert was MINISCULE. I caution you that the Ranch Restaurant (or whatever it is called) in the back has terrible food. They charge quite a bit for a plain little hamburger and cook it to a tough, dry, chewy version of hamburger. It makes me wonder if it is the cook or the beef or both. And why can't they get a better cook or better beef at such a nice hotel? McDonalds would have been several steps up from their burger. We had a woderful time overall!! The price is worth it for a one time experience or if you have quite a lot of money to burn. From the practical standpoint: regarding value...you can't quite get value out what they charge for the sea ranch cottages. You'd get much more value renting a real cottage in Hana...they come complete with a deck, BBQ and kitchen as well as beach toys and towels. Hope this is helpful. Happy Travels!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven in Hana”
Reviews.Author: rrichcg
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week in Maui, with two heavenly days spent at the Hana Maui Hotel. If you are looking to decompress in a slice of paradise, this is the place. The staff extends their spirit of Aloha from the time you arrive at the front door. The rooms are spacious. If you can, get one of the ocean view bungalows for a spectacular coastline view. The hotel restaurant is the only game in town. But each meal is made of the freshest ingredients. Warning to you multi-taskers: there is no TV, no-wifi, one small computer that didn't work too well. Hotel Hana Maui is for unplugging completely.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: gumshoe71
Reviews.Content: Felt like a place where some may go to say they roughed it...The rooms were very dingy and in need of repair. The Service was non-existent. Don't waste your money (except in the restaurant, the food is very good).

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful & Fun”
Reviews.Author: ParVijay
Reviews.Content: Had a great time! Tranquil infinity pool and Yoga contrasted well with the body boarding at the nearby beach. Wife enjoyed the no TV rooms. Daily breakfast was an invigorating start to the day. Spa treatments added to the relaxing atmosphere. Horseback riding is a must, especially for first-timers.

Reviews.Title: “You Must go here”
Reviews.Author: AvonTravler
Reviews.Content: Many people visit Maui and either don't go to Hana or just make it a day trip, which is a big mistake! Hana is the true, untarnished, Hawaii and holds amazing sights that simply can't be found elsewhere on the island. If you go to Maui, plan to spend 2-3 days in Hana to really explore the area. Yes, the drive there from the airport is a good 2+ hours along a narrow two-lane road (please drive slow - we saw a crash because some idiot was driving too fast). About Hotel Hana - you obviously have limited lodging choices in Hana, and Hotel Hana is by far the best (and yes, most expensive). Splurge and go for one of the ocean front cottages - yes, they are expensive, but well worth it! Some of the other reviews complained about the staff, but we found everyone very helpful and friendly. Yes, the food is very expensive, but what do you expect when you are out in the middle of a rainforrest? A few "musts" while in Hana: - Horseback riding - Hotel Hana has a stable and they offer a wonderful 1 hour ride along the coast. Cost is very reasonable. - Red sand beach, which is right next to the hotel. The hike there is a bit tricky, but the view from red sand beach is well worth it. - Taco stand on the road to Hana - there is one small taco stand (more like a truck) halfway between the airport and Hana. $5 for the BEST pork taco you'll ever have in your life!

Reviews.Title: “Leave the world behind...........”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Hana Maui hotel in Hana, amazing. We had the ocenview room and it was worth every penny. The staff was great and i like that they made the effort to learn your name and greet you everytime they saw you. Great hotel and amazing views. Ranjeet

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay until check out!”
Reviews.Author: Alohababy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Hana for 2 nights to celebrate my husbands 50th Birthday and him being cancer free for 1 year. Let me start by saying that the Hotel was nice but not for the money we paid. All around Hana is beautiful and for that matter all of Maui is beautiful so the scenery around the hotel was great. The prices didn't match the experience. I ordered chocolate covered strawberries upon arrival. They charged us $31.00 for 6 strawberries that were probably the worst I ever had. Tiny and bitter! We were in Maui so it didn't bother us that much, we let it go. Everything went according to plan for the 2 days, it rained often which we expected, but we saw rainbows and that made us happy. (We were there before the March rains set in). They did have a few mud slides on the road to Hana the day we arrived but it was cleaned up before we were on our way. The drive is terrible at night but absolutely wonderful in the day. Choose day! My biggest complaint happened at check out. The hotel tried to charge us almost $100.00 more a night than our confirmed reservation stated. They tried to tell us that the confirmation was the average for a package deal. Only problem with that is we didn't book a package deal, we booked for 2 nights, thats it. They argued with us for 20 minutes even though we showed them our confirmation statement which showed 2 nights and the price. Eventually they gave in and honored our reservation price. After a pleasant stay it left a bad taste in our mouths. We don't go on vacation to argue about a bill, period! Unfortunately, this was the last thing we expected from this hotel, because of the good reviews. The prices were high for the restaurant, the food was ok but not great. They had a salad that they served with breakfast that was really good but they ran out on day 2, bad planning. I think you probably know by now that we won't return to Hotel Hana ever. I did follow up with a letter to management stating our disappointment with the service and as of today never received a reply.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the long flight and scary drive!”
Reviews.Author: Lifebirder
Reviews.Content: My husband and I saw this property reviewed on the show Travel Spies. He had a business to trip to Maui so we added on a cocuple of days to experience the Hana Maui. We are so glad we did! The spa treatments were amazing, the yoga class was great and the setting spectacular. The food is limited but we did have one amazing lunch at the hotel that included lots of unique local vegetables. The buffet dinner wasn't bad for a buffet and the entertainment was delightful. We stayed in a Sea Cottage and had some trouble with noisy neighbors, but even that couldn't spoil the blissful experience. I loved hanging out in the hammock with my husband gazing up at the swaying palms....Ahhhh...I want to go back. Soon.

Reviews.Title: “Chose room carefully!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to rest our heads in Hana so we could spend a few days adventuring. We chose the Hotel Hana Maui based on the rave reviews. The staff was fantastic - female concierge and bellboys especially. Staff even took me to a local store to get a pizza! We had one rude waitress at the restaurant which I have heard is common. I think the rave reviews are for the sea ranch cottages. We were in the hotel portion (Bay cottage Jr Suite) and were kept up at night with cars and golf carts going past our back door. They need to close this road down or limit traffic at night. There was an annoying rooster that, not once, but ever 5 minutes for 2 hours starting at 5 am woke us up. They need to get rid of the rooster if they want guests to relax. There are 2 pools, one was closed for being "shocked"; the other pool's heater was broken. As well, the hot tub heater was broken so we had no opportunity to use these facilities. Traveling with kids - this was a big disappointment. Room was fantastic. Nice amenities in room - sodas etc, which make arrival very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Rooms and Location”
Reviews.Author: JBG8
Reviews.Content: My husband, our one year old baby and I stayed here in March 2006. We had an ocean view jr. suite which was amazingly beautiful and had a huge bathroom. The room was not "over the top" opulant, but was extremely nice. The view and huge private deck were amazing. There are so many hiking trails, beaches and wonderful waterfalls to see in this area. We stayed 3 days and probably could have spent another 2 without running out of things we wanted to see in the area. I saw a fair number of lack food comments about this hotel. True, that the food selection for lunch/dinner is not extentive, but certainly expensive for what you get! However, there are small refrigerators in the rooms and there is a small market in walking distance of the hotel. For us, we just got used to the $19 hamburgers at the hotel (which are available at both lunch and dinner). Staff hospitality leaves a lot to be desired. The majority of the staff is barely luke warm. There were a couple of exceptions, but don't expect anyone to be happy to help you and expect to ask for things more than once!

Reviews.Title: “A Piece of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were engaged here in September 2004 and came back a year later for our honeymoon! This is the closesst I have ever come to heaven! The location is superb and the staff is exceptional. This is where you can get away from it all! We will always hold Hana as our special place! M & D

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Package Ruled!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Okay, so friends were going to get married there, but though their plans changed, the recommendation to stay here was still sounding "the best." They told us about the "honeymoon package", massages for 2, 4 nights, great price. So we received newlywed service (oops, not really true),champagne & chocolates & got upgraded to Sea Cottage, instead of Garden. What a getaway, so quiet, raindrops sublime, nice accomodations. Don't even want to go to the other side again, this is the first time I felt I really connected w/what Hawaii is about, heard natives speaking pidgin, singing, happy stuff, real aloha?! So close to waterfall hiking trails, best body surf beach that you can shuttle to w/Hana prepared box lunch. Really felt pampered, yet far away from all cares. This is my gold standard now, wanna get back, daydream regularly about Hana!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon Spot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a place to "get away from it all" after our wedding. Hotel Hana Maui was the perfect honeymoon spot. We recommend reading and using the book "Maui Revealed" to experience all of Hana's hidden treasures. Although the restaurant choices were minimal, we enjoyed the options available. We also recommend attending the Manager's Reception at the Plantation House. We had such a great time at Hotel Hana Maui that we named our new dog "Hana!"

Reviews.Title: “Needs major F&B adjustments”
Reviews.Author: lgt565
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip here in a month. Luckily I wasn't paying for it. I was a guest of someone's. Obviously, the surroundings are beautiful. The greeters/bell staff were wonderful, as well as Housekeeping was incredible as well. It will probably be my last trip there and I just wanted to share my experience, since it was consistent both of my visits. The food and beverage outlets and service are the worst I have ever experienced in my life. The servers were extremely rude and wear not knowledgeable of the menu. When I asked for a manager, I was told there wasn't one. I unfortunately kept having the same mean waitress as my Pool server and room service waiter. Everything I ordered off the menu was not what I received. When I asked why, I was told the menus are very outdated!!! Outdated???Icecream was $3.00 on the menu and I was charged $11.00!! For this hotel's rates, I think management should be able to afford to run current descriptions and prices on a copy machine.. I kept getting the feeling that the management sets the scene of its staff attitude with "hey, dont worry about a smile or service, cause you know what? they will be back because they have to!!".. I feel like they know there is nowhere else to go..The room service menus were also "outdated" and I did not receive what I thought I was ordering. In short, I refused to eat another meal, so I left a day early due to an onset of starvation. I was so drained from trying to teach the staff about what their menus really say.Also our $36.00 per entree was ice cold when it arrived. Very very bad food and food servers.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: dm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Hotel Hana to relax and regenerate. We stayed in one of the sea cottages, and it was absolutely beautiful!!! The staff was incredible! Their spa is by far the best one I have ever been to. Try the aqua renewal if they still offer it. The staff uses golf carts to take you where ever you want to go on the resort. This is the best place to stay in Maui if you want to escape from every day life.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible! Stay in the Sea Cottages...”
Reviews.Author: AnarchyJim
Reviews.Content: Absolutely stunning place. First off, stay in the Sea Cottages. The Bay Cottages are not significantly cheaper and the Sea Cottages are without compare. I've never stayed at a place like it. This was my 10th trip to Hawaii and, I'm ashamed to admit, my first to Hana (although this was only my third trip to Maui). I can honestly say that until you've experienced this, you are seriously missing one of the best things Hawaii has to offer. It is one of the most relaxing, beautiful places you're likely to find on any of the islands. After a couple days you feel as if you're just going to melt away into the ocean and the breeze. It's expensive, yes, but it's first class all the way. If you're looking to treat yourself to a wonderful experience this is it. The only downer is the food, or lack thereof. It's mediocre and expensive and there aren't really any options. Stock up on banana bread from the Halfway to Hana burger shack and then buy a bunch of pineapples. The H2H banana bread is particularly good, and most of the banana bread I bought around the hotel wasn't that great. You can easily live on the bread, fresh pineapples, and a few mai tais by the pool (which is also stunning). You may doubt that... but give it a try. Given how relaxed you'll be on the beach or your lanai, you may find you're quite happy with bread and pineapple. Particularly since the other food options aren't really worth the effort of leaving the beach. Although, you can get too much of a good thing. There really isn't anything else to do besides the beach, snorkle, sit on the lanai and read. After four days in Hana it was nice to get back to the other side of the island where there was a bit more to do and see. All in all it was a great experience and I will definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Piece of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so amazing, however the scenery is part of the beauty. We went on our honeymoon to this hotel first and it was breath-taking. The resort was nicely designed and very relaxing. They took the beauty of traditional hawaii, which God made, and created the resort to fit into that, rather than making the resort like a modern day version of high rise hotels. The staff members were relaxed, professional, and helpful, but not in your face. There was a lot of privacy here. We stayed in one of the cabins and you felt like you were by yourself. The rooms had a lot of space, with a huge balcony, and the bathrooms were so amazing. The best part was that there was no air condition in the rooms. You opened all the windows to get the breeze from the ocean and there were plenty of fans. But some nights it did get chilly so we closed the windows. There isn't as much humidity in Hana as there is on the other side of the island. Hana is much prettier, more natural beauty, and greener. There are things to do, more natural based than tourist based, at this hotel. You can ride bikes, walk trails, go to the beach, horse back ride, go see some waterfalls nearby, relax at the pool or in the hot tub, workout, or just sit back and marvel at God's awsome beauty He created. The only complaint I would have is that the food at main restaurant, with dinner plates at $33, was not so good. It wasn't bad but it wasn't worth the $33. I would recommend taking some extra things to eat, like for breakfast of lunch, which you can store in the refrigerator that is in the room, if your tring to not eat out three times a day for a high price. There are only 2 stores in town to get food and they are limited in what they carry. Overall, this hotel was one of the nicest resorts I've ever stayed in...and I've traveled all over the USA, Sri Lanka, England, Taiwan, Puerto Rico, Singapore, Mexico, and Indonesia. I would highly recommend this hotel. And if you've driven the road to Hana before, I would recommend flying into the Hana airport b/c the road to Hana is nice once, but it's so curvy that it's not so exciting doing it twice. However, if you are going to Hawaii to do the super touristy stuff and party, then I'd go to the west side of the island. If you're going to relax and see a piece of paradise, I'd go here hands down. Hope I've helped and remember to keep Christ first in your lives. He created us, loves us, and wants us to see real paradise one day in Heaven with Him.

Reviews.Title: “Nirvana”
Reviews.Author: Chichicastenango
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for revitalization in a serene atmosphere, check-in to Hotel Hana Maui. We stayed six nights and were totally relaxed after only two. Our unit was a bungalow type room (classified as gardenview) with two rooms separated by a door(number 42-and was told this is one of the roomiest). Even though not a sea-room cottage (the premiere rooms) I would choose to stay here again after seeing the cottages and feeling they were not worth the difference in price. Sleeping became a dream-like state due to the feather-bed toppers and the softness of their organic cotton sheets. The spa facilities are for the use of all guests whether or not having treatments. The atmosphere is one of total relaxation and their amenities...like the chamomile tea dipped face-cloths covered with big chunks of ice were the ultimate in refreshment. Add the steamroom, cold dunk and outdoor shower for a real treat. Not easy to get to, either by driving (we did at night in the rain) or by intermittent Pacific Wings flights...but this seems to add to the feeling of remoteness... of really getting away. The hotel's only weak point is their meal offerings. Let me correct myself, the breakfast menu for the hotel was varied and delicious. The lunch and dinner menus left much to be desired with small portions, and high prices...not too unusual in this day and age...but when the menu lacks imagination and most importantly taste...it is literally hard to swallow! I am in hopes the management will realize the importance of having really sensational cuisine in the near future...ESPECIALLY when the alternate choices for dining are virtually limited on most nights. This is our only drawback towards returning to Hana Maui. This was our 2nd visit and we REALLY want to return as my husband has decided this is his favorite place in the world! One last word...the hotel Hana Maui Hawaiian staff are the friendliest and cannot do enough for you!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Select Few”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hana is not for everyone!! And that's just fine with me; that means I can selfishly have more of it to myself. If you need a McDonalds or WalMart within 1/2 hour, Hana is not for you. If you need to "watch the big game", Hana is not for you. If nature needs to be 100% tamed and controlled, Hana is not for you. If you can't pull over to let a local pass you on the road, Hana is not for you. If your driving is so poor that you require guardrails, Hana is not for you. If you like life slightly unpredictable, Hana IS for you. If getting caught in a tropical rain shower is "romantic" rather than "oh my god, look at my hair", Hana is for you. If you can appreciate slowing life down, Hana is for you. If you're adaptable, Hana is for you. If you're a good neighbor, Hana is for you. So if you fall into the first category, please, do all of us (yourself included) a favor and book your vacation in Lahaina, or Kaanapali, or Wailea, or best yet, Waikiki. You won't enjoy Hana, and it'll just make it more crowded for those of us who do.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful getaway”
Reviews.Author: jmalo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 6 nights at Hotel Hana as part of our honeymoon. We loved our cottage, which had an ocean view from both the bedroom and the jacuzzi. As per some of the previous reviews, we loved Hamoa Beach, which was a short drive away from the property but staffed by the resort. The pool (full bar service) in the lower area of the resort was also a nice feature. Our only complaint(very minor) was the lack of options in terms of meals (the resort is pretty much the only option in Hana), which were a bit on the pricy side. We would definitely return again on future visits to Maui

Reviews.Title: “The true island getaway experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days in Hana and then went to the other side of the island for 7 days. I really wish we were not talked out of staying in Hana for a bit longer by our travel agent. She said there was nothing to do and we would get bored. It was fabulous and serene wherever we went. The night we arrived, the electricity was out and it could have been a disasterous review of the place. We were issued flashlights by friendly staff and it was my most memorable evening! At dinner, there were tons of candles and they brought in special singers - and my husband still comments on that man's wonderful voice that made that evening so romantic. The fabulous swimming beach was not on the property but fully staffed, incredibly beautiful and only 2 other families were there - sharp contrast to the other side of the island. We felt like we really had an island to ourselves there. The room was spatious and luxurious. The hot tub on the deck was very private and had a fabulous view of the ocean. I was a bride that weekend and was treated like a queen the entire time- taking my dress to get pressed, getting my hair done with flowers, special wine reception in room, ...more than I could have dreamed.

Reviews.Title: “Truly is Heavenly Hana!”
Reviews.Author: SavethePandas
Reviews.Content: We were also on our honeymoon - and visited the Hana Maui at the end of the trip...and stayed at the Fairmount Kea Lani at the beg. of the trip. I really liked the way we set it up as we could enjoy the larger resort first - and then really appreciate the beautiful Hana Maui before heading home. It was WONDERFUL! Horseback riding, hanging out at Hamoa Beach, the pool, the spa, the pitch and put golf, and the people - were all great. Only down side for us was the food. While good - it wasn't great and the options were rather limited....but a small price to pay when staying at such a lovely place. I too get car sick but as long as you take some sort of precaution - ginger pills or the harder stuff - you should be fine on the drive.

Reviews.Title: “We wish that we were still there!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved Hotel Hana and wished that we spent more of our honeymoon there. After three nights we moved to the west side of the island, and although we enjoyed The Fairmont Kei Lani also, we seemed much more relaxed in Hana. After the long, long, long trip from Tennessee we were very happy to have charted a plane to the Hana airport. Is was a little pricey, but WELL worth it. We did rent a car just to get around and see some of the scenery and even drove the Hana Highway to Makanow. I will agree with the previous reviewer in that if you get car sick easily DO NOT DO IT!!!!! I called it the HELL HIGHWAY instead of the HANA HIGHWAY. Our cottage was superb and the hot tub on our lani was great. The rooms are fantastic and very clean. The soap smells so good that we bought a bunch as we were leaving the hotel(and it can be purchased online too). There are so many things to do that you don't realize that time goes by. We were very sceptible at first, but we want to go back every day. If you are gonig for a honeymoon or romantic trip, check to see which months they do not allow children. This was great for us, although visitors to the restaurants do come in with children, but there were none running the grounds and in the pools etc... If you do need to check email (or a sports score, we had to get the play by play on ESPN for the TN/LSU game that we were missing) there is a Game room with the internet and TV available, so don't panic. The hike to Fagan's Cross is unreal and is spectacular during the 6:00 am sunrise, and its not hard to get up since it is 12 noon on the east coast.

Reviews.Title: “Understated luxury in a lush setting!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just Gorgeous! Spectacular setting. The cottage in which we stayed was just steps from the ocean. The best sleep we've gotten in years because of the constant breeze and insanely comfortable bed. I was so taken with the bedding that I actually stripped the sheets off to check out the mattress!! So clean you could eat off of the floor. Food is expensive but very tasty. Eternity pool and spa were amazing. You truly forget about the rest of the world. Downside? Driving the Hana Highway. It's the only way to get to the hotel from the Kahului airport. 2 hours of nauseating stop and go winding HELL! No exaggeration! We regretted not bringing along barf bags! The highway is touted as one of the most picturesque rides in the US, but you'll appreciate none of it after a long, harrowing plane ride from the mainland. (13 hrs total for us from the east cost! Yikes!) Do yourself a favor; fly into the main airport, but, instead of renting a car, grab a commuter flight to the Hana Airport. just a mile away from the hotel. Hana Maui provides a shuttle to many of the area attractions, so a car isn't essential. We found that staying on the property was the most relaxing part anyway. Also, the rooms/cottages are "tv-less". Not that we planned to be glued to the tube in paradise, but for what they charge, it would have been nice to have the option. Nevertheless, we'd absolutely go back. Bliss.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wintersummer
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel Hana Maui. This is a place that I've read about for years, but also had read that it had been in serious decline recently. That was before the current group of owners purchased the property - they have worked wonders. It's the same group that owns the Post Hotel in Big Sur, Ca. We didn't have the fanciest room, but one of the garden cottages. Rooms are stocked with all kinds of good things to eat and drink, including a complimentary bottle of champagne. Grounds are just so peaceful and relaxing. There's no tv in rooms, but the point is to get out of touch with the rest of the world. There's also no air conditioning and I'll admit, I was nervous about that! It was pretty hot during the day, but magically, as evening turned to night everything cooled down and it was so comfortable. We ate in dining room and we were pleased. Dining room is partially outdoors...only problem was mosquitos. Front desk gave me nice little repellent wipes and that took care of the problem. Service was the best I received anywhere on island. Another reviewer made comment about golf carts going around property. Yes, there are a few, but they are shuttling guests around and providing guests with things they need and want...it's called service. I just wish this little place was closer to where I live....I'd visit frequently!

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of paradise....”
Reviews.Author: DC_CoPi
Reviews.Content: The grounds of the Hotel Hana Maui are gorgeous and the Sea Ranch Cottages are the way to go. We spent 2 nights of our 11 night/10 day honeymooon here, and we were upgraded to a deluxe cottage with a private whirlpool on the deck. The cottages are very pretty, airy, and spacious inside. While we greatly enjoyed our stay, others should know this a "different kind" of luxury. After staying at the Four Seasons we were worried we'd be let down. We weren't but we liked the rustic yet lavish feel to the hotel. Most of the staff was friendly, albeit fairly cutoff from the outside world, but anxious to be helpful. The food situation in Hana is pretty sad... the main dining room had good, very pricey, food, and the hotel bar serves that menu and a cheaper, more casual one as well. I'd recommend skipping the dining room all together, as the bar was more fun and offered more options. We were glad we spent time in Hana as it let us go to some of the Road to Hana sites that are normally very busy at an off time, early in the morning. I'd recommend this hotel, but like I said, know that it is different from your typical high-end hotel, and from it's sister resort, the Post Ranch Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Hana-Maui Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our honeymoon to Hawaii and I had to write some reviews!! The Hotel Hana-Maui in Hana, was by far the BEST part of our 2 1/2 week journey. We stayed at hotels on Oahu and Maui and this was the highlight of our trip! Don't be nervous that there is no A/C, we were before we booked, but you really don't need it! This part of the island is cool and breezy. -And we were there in the middle of July! We stayed in one of the Deluxe Ocean-view cottages with a spa- the room was large and spacious with a sitting area/couch and a nice deck overlooking the lush land and ocean. (just like the pic on the website) This place was relaxing and beautiful! The room had complimentary beverages in the fridge and some great snacks! My favorite was the Banana bread..freshly baked daily- you could smell it by the main building baking in the mornings... There were 2 pools, but the one closest to the cottages was the infinity pool...just gorgeous, also there was a hot tub. Near the pool was a fitness cottage with brand new equipment and it was never too busy there. They offered complimentary yoga every morning. The food here was excellent...never a bad meal! (the only place to eat here is the hotel restaurant main dining room, lounge, poolside or room service. ) I would recommend getting a packed lunch if you are journeying out for the day too. (the turkey club is delicious! and french fries are the best I ever had) Service was impeccable, everyone is so nice and accomodating! I think almost everyone we asked that worked there, actually lived in the town of Hana their whole life. We went horseback riding, the 2hour ride and it was awesome!! We went up mountains and by the beach..so beautiful! We will make it a point to come out to Hana again in the future. This was our favorite part of our honeymoon and the most fun and adventure!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Hana Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: MNtravelman
Reviews.Content: After staying in the Hotel Hana Maui's flagship sister property, The Post Ranch Inn, we were extremely disappointed by the smarmy front desk staff and the uninspired cuisine at the Hana Maui. The staff spends most of its day buzzing around the property on golf carts and noise from neighboring villas can be a problem (loud spa tubs). While the landscape of Hana can do much to distract from the shortcomings of the Hotel, if you're accustomed to the Post Ranch or other five star properties (Four Seasons, etc.), you will be very disappointed by the Hotel Hana Maui. If you've never been to Maui before, the landscape of Maui and Hana may put enough rose color in your glasses to convince yourself that the Hotel Hana Maui is a great place - and it is a great place - it's just the hotel that's not. Try the Fairmont, if you really want a five-star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: recka
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only one night, as we wanted to make the drive to Hana but had an 8-month old son, and driving there and back in a day would have been difficult on all of us. This hotel is gorgeous. The staff were friendly and very helpful. They even found us a babysitter that night at the last minute, and for only $8/hour (it's $14 anywhere else on the island). There is no airconditioning, but the breeze coming off the ocean, along with the fans, makes it unnecessary to have a/c. There are screens on all of the windows and doors. There also is no television, but who needs that? You're in hawaii, you can watch tv anywhere. There are trails all around if you like to hike, and the wellness pool was beautiful. The little tiny town of Hana has a few shops and a grocery to explore. Yes, the food is expensive, but it's hawaii. Everything is expensive, and it's all worth it. Overall, there is not a single thing we would change about our night at this hotel. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Hana-Maui - a trip highlight!”
Reviews.Author: Andrew1234
Reviews.Content: My family of four had a very pleasant, although too-short, overnight stay on July 4. We booked two adjacent junior garden suites through Costco travel. The rooms were lovely and well-furnished. A/C was unnecessary. Service was very welcoming and attentive. The absence of TV was a boon, forcing our two teenage kids to find other things to do. The three-course dinner at the hotel restaurant was the best of our two-week stay in Hawaii. We were sorry not to have stayed an additional day to enjoy the beaches, croquet lawn, and overall slower pace of Hana, which probably comes closer to the "real Hawaii" than the big draws of Lahaine, Kaanapale, or Kailua. By the way, the road to Hana was enjoyable but not nearly as pretty as the road from Hana, i.e. southward around the back of Haleakala. Despite what the road maps tell you, the road was perfectly passable and a fabulous drive. If saving some money is important, recommend that you stock up on lunch and/or breakfast items before leaving Kahalui for Hana. The Costco is at the first traffic light beyond the Kahalui airport!

Reviews.Title: “We want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent five nights at the Hotel Hana Maui celebrating our tenth year wedding anniversary. We wanted to relax, hike, swim, read, explore, and have quality time together. We also wanted to experience a Hawaii that did not include high-rises, golf courses, or tee-shirt shops on every corner. The Hotel Hana Maui delivered on all counts. Our ocean front Sea Ranch Cottage was the most comfortable hotel room we have stayed in anywhere. Didn't need A/C, didn't want TV. The breeze off the ocean was heavenly. The hot-tub on the lanai was private enough. The grounds are perfectly kept. There are plenty of beautiful, sometimes stunning undeveloped places to hike. Hamoa beach is wonderful. Yes, everything is expensive. Yes, it will rain for five or ten minutes several times a day, even in the dry season. Yes, there are geckos. They didn't bother us, we didn't bother them. Yes, the hotel restaurant's attempt at fine dining falls a little short. Still, you should go. Rent a convertable. Drive the Hana Highway. Yes, you will have to be careful. Stay in a Sea Ranch Cottage, as close to the ocean as you can. Have a picnic lunch delivered to you at Hamoa Beach. Hike south from Black Sand Beach along the coastal trail. Skinny dip at Red Sand Beach. Yes, you will have to be careful. Hike up to the magnificent waterfall at the top of Oheo Gulch. Wear sneakers, bring water. Spend a lot of time in the wellness pool, even if itâ€™s raining. Try the Kona Pale Ale. Bring along a lover and some good books. Buy a bottle of wine at Hasegawaâ€™s and drink it under the stars on your lanai. Breath the exquisite air. You should go.

Reviews.Title: “The Highlight of our Trip”
Reviews.Author: ckp70
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 8 nights in Maui. We spent 2 of those nights at the Hotel Hana-Maui, and we wished we could have canceled our reservations at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua to stay longer. The Hotel Hana- Maui and the area was definitely the highlight of our trip. The property is beautiful, extremely relaxing, accommodating, etc. With only 66 rooms (cottages) it's very intimate and you truly feel like you are on vacation. The rooms are big, and the welcome basket of goodies comes in handy during the day. Didn't miss not having a TV or air conditioning, the breeze is perfect and the beds extremely comfortable. The staff couldn't have been nicer, and the group tip at the end of checkout eleminates the awkward tipping throughout the day. Even though your dining choices are limited, the food is excellent, especially breakfast (the homemade granola with fresh fruit is awsome) Overall, a great authentic Hawaiian experience in a luxury resort setting.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive and not special enough for a honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: JamesBeswick
Reviews.Content: We went for four days of honeymoon to Hawaii and were generally disappointed, given that the room rate is $450+ a night. Our complaints centered around a few key problems: - Restaurant choice: there's pretty much nothing in Hana except for the hotel's restaurants and we found the service sporadic, the food very average (often with very small portions) and also extremely expensive (dinner averaging $75+ a head for food with drinks). - There was no 'special treatment' for honeymooners, which we received in both of the other hotels we stayed in. There wasn't much aloha from the hotel staff. - Amenities: no A/C was definitely a problem given the number of biting insects you have to face if you have the windows open to compensate. The spa was overpriced and most of the activities are extras that you have to pay for. The hotel has the only gas station in the area and was charging $3.30 a gallon (a premium of around 60 cents at this time, compared with the rest of the island). Finally, I'd add that the east of the island receives most of the rain (I had this explained to me by the ranger at O'heo Gulch who happily explained how the island generates all its clouds in Hana). Don't expect great weather, and the drive to the West side is at least two hours away. J

Reviews.Title: “There's just no place like this on Earth!”
Reviews.Author: gben88
Reviews.Content: If you've ever stayed at a 5 star resort in Wakikki or Waliea you'll know what I mean when I say this-there is real "Aloha" and the put on kind of "Aloha" along with all the Disney over the top bells and whistles. Rest assured that the true spirit of "Aloha" lives here. From the moment one drives into the stunning porte-cochere you start living a different life. The 2 young men who helped us from our car and directed us to the front desk were full of smiles and good cheer. As we walked in to the lobby, we were greeted by not one, but 3 lovely women who greeted us with leis, hot towels and chilled guava juice. Check-in was the easiest I've ever experienced. We were driven by golf cart to our Ocean View Jr. Suite and before the bellman put our bags away, he walked us to the terrace with a resort map and pointed out landmarks. The suite was well-equipped with 2 large storage closets, bar area with a refrigerator stocked ( at no charge) with sodas and bottled waters. There was a large in-house safe ( large enough for laptops) a desk, comfortable chairs and a huge bathroom area featuring its own private outside garden, along with seperate door entry toilet, large sunken soaking tub, and a shower so nice that we are going to have the same thing replicated at home. All of these areas were spotless and we were greeted with a nice note from Mr. Doug Chang, the General Manager along with a gift basket of breads, fruits and nuts from the area. Most of our meals during our stay were in-room, because believe it or not our terrace had a better view and it was private. I can't believe some of the complaints I've read because each meal was prepared well, and while the menu selection wasn't one you'd find at the Cheesecake Factory, it was all innovative and delicious-taking advantage of fresh catches of fish and the wonderful fruits and vegetables in the area. Room service was very quick ( less than 30 minutes) and very well done. Wine selection was excellent. I would only suggest a wider selection of appetizers and beef entrees. The Wellness area next to the large infinity swimming pool/jacuzzi's were a great place to get in some exercise. The area is well stocked with over-size thichk towels and water. Try out a hammock-they are incredible. The Bar was a fine place to wind down and someone must have listened to the fellow in an earlier review about pre-made Mai Tai's as ours were homemade at the bar and befitting of such a fine hotel and setting. There are no TV's in the rooms, nor air-conditioners. Neither is necessary or desired by this couple. What the Hana air does to your skin and very soul can't be replicated. The rooms are very well ventilated to recieve cool ocean breezes and the noise from a television would ruin the setting. We used the Honua Spa for Lomi Lomi Massage and Spa Therapy. It was superb on all counts. The Club Room near the hotel entry is a handy place to check e-mail if you care to. It has a TV but I don't know why you'd care to use one while at this place. One word on the staff. They were all so kind, cheerful and genuine. One day I was walking the grounds to go to the beach and it started to rain lightly. A hotel maid came running out of one of the bungalows with a large umbrella and a warm smile. They always went out of there way to ask how you were and if everything was suitable. There was a caring there that we have never experienced any where else. Some of the nicest things we liked were as follows: The Staff Free Valet Parking No-tipping Policy ( you can give one amount at the end) The peaceful feeling that settles over the town as the sun sets Good local soaps, shampoos and lotions for use in your suite Some things others may not like: Not a wide food selection off the hotel grounds The startling quiet of the peaceful little town of Hana Lack of Air conditioning-but you acclimate easily Last but not least there were 2 staff members, Patrick at the bell desk and Kealele at the Main Hotel Dining room who deserve awards for their professionalism and kindness towards guests. We have been to the Hotel Hana many times-first time under this new ownership who clearly has it dialed in. Its so good to know that a special place like this one still exists and has the ownership, management and staff to pull it off. Good Show!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to be pampered!”
Reviews.Author: a_robyn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for three days and we wished we could stay for a week! The room was excellent - spring for an oceanview cottage with jacuzzi on the deck if you can. Nothing is comparable to hearing the waves crashing aginst shore while enjoying free champagne in the hot tub! Room service came within a 1/2 hour everytime we called. The menu *is* limited, but we enjoyed every meal we had from their main dining room. It seems they've changed room service since earlier reviews because you can now get breakfast as early as 7:30 AM. There may be a few bugs despite the fact that the hotel includes ultrasonic pest control in every room. We saw two flying roaches and two geckos - once we stopped leaving uncovered juice out, the roaches went away. Geckos eat other bugs (including roaches and mosquitos) so we welcomed them into our room! A path from the resort leads right to the town's only general store. The hotel provides chauffer service in golf carts to other areas of the resort and will drive you in thier van to area beaches. Most of the staff was born in Hana, so they are all excellent sources of information. Another plus - no individual tipping! You put all of your tips into a general fund that the employees split at the end of your stay. If you don't think you can live without a television, there is a club room with a TV and high-speed Internet access (my husband had to watch one game of the NBA finals!) All in all, I would go back in a second...and we have already made reservations.

Reviews.Title: “This really IS paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the second week of May and stayed for 4 nights in a Jr. Garden Cottage. I should clarify by saying a Jr. Garden Cottage is still immense and sumptuous. We had a wondeful stay in this secluded paradise which I highly recommend. This hotel is for those people who want rustic luxury in a beautfiul unspoiled land which we all romanticize Hawaii to be. The town itself offers little, however the hotel staff and their efforts to grant you seclusion and serenity are amazing. Its true the food, while absolutely delicious can get tedious after several days, but falling asleep to the sounds of crickets and awakening at sunrise to the chirping of birds is hard to beat. The hotel activities desk was a great contact for ensuring we went kayaking and assisted us in finding our way around the beautiful unspoiled natural spots on this side of Maui. This is the ultimate escape!

Reviews.Title: “Unspoil & Peaceful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the vacationers that want ABSOLUTE quiteness and to be alone, this is the hotel to be. Being from NYC, I am used to the quick pace of things & constant activity. This is a perfect place to unwind & slow things down. I thought personally the drive on the HANA HWY was beautiful and GORGEOUS (and it was misting/raining)!!! All those BEAUTIFUL waterfalls! Sorry but had to sidetrack b/c of the reviews saying the drive on the HANA HWY was terrible. We had RM 209, one cottage away from the ocean with an unobsrtucted view. This was considered one of the best cottages to get! The view is UNBEATABLE. The room itself was very large & modestly furnished but definitely would have arrange the bed differently(bed faces the bathroom instead of the ocean?) The Bathroom very large and it had a great soaking tub! The grounds are EXPANSIVE and our room was far from the main building (SEA cottages are located near the ocean & the Bay cottage are locate more towards the main building near the road, far from the ocean) You MUST have breakfast, as it was the best compare to the Ritz & Four Seasons (which are the other 2 hotels we stay at during our 10 night stay) It is Beautiful here BUT I must tell you when it rains hard here, the hotel & town does not have much going on. SO in turn you have nothing to do. I recommend eating at the Hotel as the HANA RanCH is pretty bad. The Main Restaurant has simple yet very tasty entrees but up there in their prices. All in all, if you are going to decide to stay in HANA, the hotel HANA MAUI does a GOOD job and you will not be disappointed. I do not recommend bring little ones here as the hotel seems more geared towards adults. THe last point if you love hikes and finding beautiful spots on your own, you cannot beat HANA! Try not to go when it is HANA's rainy season as it will put a damper on your plans

Reviews.Title: “Serene and Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 5 of our 10 vacation days for our 10th anniversary at the secluded Hotel Hana-Maui. We were greeted warmly with a lei and juice and given a tour of the facilities on our way to #206 Sea Cottage. The staff was great and the facilities spotless. The Cottage was amazing! We had never slept with open screens before and the sound of the waves nearby was remarkably soothing and the breeze cool with small showers at least once a day and several per evening. The only drawbacks were the birds that woke us up promptly at 5:30am every day. The cottages were a long way from the restaurant but they were more than happy to pick us up in the rain with a golf cart. We visited the spa for a couple's massage. We also attended the Managers Reception and hotel lounge afterwards for live Hawaiian music and cocktails. The drinks were a little strong but the appetizer's were great. My husband utilized their workout facility while I gazed from a hammock out to the ocean from the torch-lit pool/hot tub area (one of several). We ate breakfast every morning at the restaurant. Lunch we toggled between the Hana Ranch Restaurant and the hotel and got snacks at the local market. No complaints at either! For activities we did the nearby 1 hour horseback ride along the coast (preferred over the 2 hour since the coast is the focal point of both rides), the kayak/snorkel tour in Hana Bay (water was very rough and not very pleasant but our guide was talkative and experienced), spent an hour at Hamoa beach before getting rained out, and another 3 hour horseback ride at Maui Stables with breathtaking views only available by horse (the horses didn't get along very well and the terrain got kind of hairy so I'd only recommend this for people that have ridden horses before-the guides were terrific!). The only real drawback the entire trip was Hana Highway. Not for the feint of heart or stomach! It's a long beautiful drive but lots of twists and turns and one lane bridges so have motion sickness pills and a good deal of patience handy. Hana does have an airport which we will use upon any returns to that area. My only reason for not giving a full 5 stars was the activities people seemed pretty unorganized and we missed a hula buffet Fri. evening because one of the morning staff said there wasn't anything going on that day and didn't have an activities sheet for us. All in all a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “too many kids in a romantic spot”
Reviews.Author: ontheroad
Reviews.Content: This has always been my favorite place. It's advertised as the most romantic place on earth, and it could be, as it used to be. Now, people who don't realize it's an old-fashioned hotel/resort & not a Hyatt are bringing children, and the place is just not the same. It's not necessarily the fault of the guests, since the hotel has somewhat acknowledged the problem by making May & September child-free, and the rest of the time people are free to bring kids. Hana is so quiet & beautiful, with a full local life outside the grounds. Sound really carries, and the peaceful atmosphere of the hotel is now ruined. My last two visits were enough to convince me that I will only go during September. Children were crying, jumping around the tiny gym with no supervision, and running screaming around the dining room to the point that we left our meals. I still rate this 3-4 stars, because the staff is generally wonderful and the lodgings are so good.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from 7 glorious days at the Hotel Hana Maui. We have traveled extensivley and this truly was the best vacation that I have ever had!!!! The ultimate in relaxation, in PERFECT setting..the grounds are beautiful, the rooms were large and airy...the lack of air conditioning was ABSOLUTLEY no problem..I couldn't imagine closing those great doors and windows. The ocean breeze was perfect and the sunrises from our room were beautiful. I must say that we found the staff to be quite attentive, very accomodating to our requests and always smiling. Doug the general manager is doing a great job with this property, really striving to bring it back to its former glory after many years of inattentive ownership. We found the dinners to be delicious, breakfast and lunch were fine...could use a more diverse menu since this is the only game in town. The pool is perfectly maintained, as are all areas of the property. The drive is long, but breathtaking and this is what preserves Hana. We actually only planned 2 nights in Hana and then 7 in Kannapali....but the minute we arrived in the overbuilt, tourist trap of Kaanapali, we called the Hotel Hana Maui and begged to come back. Although they were almost completely booked, they accomodated us beautifully.. and we high tailed it back to Hana for the rest of our vacation. Note that there is an option...you can fly into Hana on Pacific Wings from the main Maui airport $85...we may try that the next time.' The Sea Cottages are the best accomodation..but we did spend one night in a garden suite and it was lovely, very large with a huge lanai...its just hard to pass up that ocean view. I thought that the drive to Hamoa Beach would be a negative but it wasn't at all...a short jaunt in your rental car over pretty countryside to the perfect crescent of Hamoa Beach. The beach attendant, Tom, was great...so well spoken and interesting to talk to about life in Hana. He was eager to set up chairs for us, provide towels and water. It's fun to have a picnic lunch delivered. We really enjoyed our hot stone massages at the beautiful spa...it is a little pricey but we didn't regret it at all...they have done a classic job in the decor of the spa and the outdoor hot tub overlooking the bay is lovely. I would not hestitate to recommend this hotel to anyone who is interested in the true beauty of Hawaii...quite and peaceful days and nights..there is plenty to do...and alot of great scenery and lovely people to enjoy. We WILL return....

Reviews.Title: “September stay - some good & bad points”
Reviews.Author: LF077
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for several nights last September at Hotel Hana Maui and have mixed feelings. 1. First of all this hotel is VERY difficult to get to. The road to Hana is basically 2 hours of cliffside twists, turns and one lane bridges. Our flight arrived at night and the hotel management actually had the nerve to tell us we would have no problem driving there in the dark!!!! They must be crazy, we could have been killed, what a nightmare. Make sure you have plenty of energy and sunlight for driving. 2. When we finally get there, for $400 a night there are roaches in the kitchen area! They actually tried to tell me that roaches are 'tropical' - hah nice try. 3. Terrible food & entertainment but VERY expensive. And pretty much no other options. 4. No air conditioning and it is VERY hot. Ceiling fans barely help. And the good part: 1. Beautiful grounds and resort area, lovely location. 2. Close to the best part of the road to Hana attractions such as the Red Sand Beach (must see) & O'heo Gulch (7 Sacred Pools) which most people miss b/c they are all the way at the end. 3. Staff was pretty friendly and nice - kindly gave me rides to the pool in those little gof carts! Great bartender at pool area. All in all, I'd recommend staying here for a few days but be prepared for some disappointments in exchange for exploring this remote area.

Reviews.Title: “Baby's first trip to Maui”
Reviews.Author: LeesAdventure
Reviews.Content: There is little doubt this is the most unique resort in Maui, and a beautiful place to stay. My husband and I went with our newborn baby and found it a wonderful getaway after an active week in Paia. We loved spending sunset on the grass near the horse pasture as we drank gin and tonics. The running trail on the ranch was fantastic and we loved Red Sand Beach. Our four month old daughter loved the babysitters which were a bargain at $8/hr! While we had heard that the food was terrible, we found breakfast and lunch to be average but dinner to be very good. However, they didn't have much on offer for dinner at the hotel if one where looking for a cheap alternative. The sea cottages are definitely where one wants to stay, the garden cottages would seem like you were in a very different place. This isn't quite yet a 5 star resort: except for doug who worked at the pool, the staff was unpolished, the spa prices were exorbitant, the yoga instructor was terrible, the room service menu was very over priced (to add chicken to a ceasar salad was $11), golf carts were always zooming through the property, the woman who helped us on the activities desk wasn't very helpful, the snorkeling trip they offer is terrible. While I was happy not to have a tv it would have been nice to have a cd player. Overall, service just didn't have the finish of a five star establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Slice of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Rzknow
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our honeymoon. My only complaint is that we didn't stay longer. Our perfect trip included 3 nights in Kapalua Bay Hotel and then 2 nights in Hotel Hana. This place is absolutely amazing and the perfect place for a honeymoon. If you go, spend the extra money and stay in a sea cottage, they are well worth it. It was magical falling asleep with the large doors open and a warm breeze blowing in from the sea. There are no TVs and very limited places to eat, but this hotel is just magical. Make sure you check out Red Sand Beach towards the North side of the property, go early and you'll have the beach to yourself. We really enjoyed Hotel Hana and will remember it forever. Hana is so authentic and real not like Kanapaali or those other touristy areas. Most people go to Hana for the day on the "Road to Hana" only to turn around and leave as soon as they get there. Stay! Enjoy the people and the culture, you feel as if you are not in the United States anymore. Doug the general manager is so friendly and accommodating, he definitely took care of us. It is so nice to see 58 year old women dancing the luau in the bar/restaurant area to find out that it is the same woman who has lived in Hana her whole life and also works in the Laundry during the day. Beautiful people in a truly beautiful place. The sea cottages were decorated so nicely with free drinks and fresh fruit every day. The pool is relaxing and the property is nicely manicured. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting 5-star service and a change of pace from big resorts.

Reviews.Title: “We are addicted!”
Reviews.Author: wamazon
Reviews.Content: We returned this year for our 1 year anniversary after spending our honeymoon at the Hotel Hana. We thought our initial stay was great but decided to spend an additional day - what a difference that makes. You really need to stay in Hana more than a few days to get the complete experience. We love almost everything about the Hana. Last year, our biggest complaint was the food and felt they make drastic improvements this year. The grounds are just beautiful and yoga classes a must do every day. We felt like we had the pool all to ourselves most of the time. We always wondered, "where is everyone?" The cottages are just fantastic and the private jacuzzi a great splurge! The only ding I would give the hotel this time around is the service at the lounge during dinner was very indifferent. We had pretty bad experiences there two nights in a row but didn't let it effect our overall experience there. We will definitely be back...

Reviews.Title: “An experience like no other”
Reviews.Author: mauikristin
Reviews.Content: I went to the Hotel Hana Maui in June 2004 to celebrate my birthday. This is a tip from someone who lives in Hawaii, I think it's the most beautiful part of the island. We checked into a beautiful sea cottage with a hot tub and a goregous view of the ocean and the horses. I can honestly say it was the most beautiful, relaxing vacation I've ever had. You must go with an open mind and heart, the pace in Hana is slow, the service is friendly and helpful but don't be in a rush. The natural beauty is spectacular, the grounds of the hotel breathtaking. Taking walks around the property is romantic and serene. The infinity pool is goregous. Some of the reviews have mentioned that there is no air conditioning. That's true, and the first day it did take some getting used to but sleeping with the sliding glass door open gave us a chance to feel the breeze and to hear the ocean. Might be wise not to schedule a trip during August if you are worried about being too hot. Some other complaints I've read: the restaurant. Breakfasts are yummy, but dinner is merely okay. It's not a food destination. There is a little restaurant just off property that is a nice change, very casual and reasonably priced. If you dont want to walk to the dining room on property, call and have them pick you up in a golf cart, we did that when it rained one night. Overall, staying here is a chance to relax, leave television behind, and experience breath taking beauty. I left here feeling like I had been away for a month, not 3 days. It's that relxaing and beautiful. Go for an experience you will always cherish.

Reviews.Title: “peaceful paadise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from our trip to Maui and wanted to do the road to Hana but not in one day so we booked 1 night in a seaview cottage at the Hotel Hana Maui. What a wonderful peacful paradise it is there. It spoils you to anything else. We wer met with tropical drinks where we checked in and take by golf cart by our very informative and friendly bellman. The cottage was very serence aand beautiful with vaulted ceiling and a HUGE bathroom. The furniture was beautiful and we had a huge deck. Our cottage was right next to the pasture where the hotel kept theri horses and is was so peasful to watch them graze. I walked over to take pictures and a cople of them saw me adn gallaped over thinking I had food to give them. They both nozed me and let me pet them it was so cool. The view to the front was the beautiful ocean. Tehre is quite a bit of room between cottrage so you feel seculded and it is so quiet with no TV or radios. That evening we went over to play in the beautiful infinity pool and hot tub after dark. we had it all to ourselves and it was soooo romantic. Until it started to rain that is. At first it was just a light rain which was cool but it got harder and harder until the bootom fell out. But we were already wet any way to so we laughted all the way back to our cottage with wet towls and robes :-) The next morning we went on the shuttle down to Hamoa beach which is wonderful with soft soft grey sand and there was only one other couple there so it was like a private beach. I wish we could have stayed longer and next time we will. It is a world away from the other side of Maui. Kay

Reviews.Title: “Hana heaven, its true.”
Reviews.Author: Dpmcken
Reviews.Content: This place is absolute heaven. I have been to alot of nice resorts but nothing like this. If you want to relax and forget your troubles, this is the place for you. Every where you look is like a picture. It is unbelievably beatiful with comfort in every minute your there. There is no air condition but the trade winds keep you more than comfortable. We are hot natured people and this was the greatest. Every hour or so during the course of the night it would rain for about 15 minutes. Made for great sleeping. The pool was beautiful and quiet. The hammocks between the palm trees were just the ticket for having a mai tai and reading a book. If your looking for solitude and relaxation, this place is for you. If your looking for nightlife and activities, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: micaron
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel in May. I never usually write these reviews, but after reading the input from some people I had to. This resort is amazing. Let me paint the picture for you. You drive for an hour and 1/2 through the most breathtaking scenery you've ever seen in you life (roadside waterfalls, volcanic formations, jugle flowers...). It was religious. The resort itself has a sprawling layout with the most amazing hot tub and pool on a hilltop that overlooks the water. Resteraunt and rooms were somewhat pricey, but way worth it. We actually had great food in the little bar area and watched a Hawaiin woman sing and explain the meaning of the local songs all night. We met the locals at Hana Bay who were having a regatta. Ate local food there for $4/person. If you can't find heaven in this place, you are crazy.... I am going back. We stayed in a ranch cottage - spring for it. Hottub on the deck - and just get room service and lay on the bed and let the breeze blow in. Forget out the corportate job or troubles and experience nature and calm.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise found”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel....it is so serene and beautiful. I also really like the fact it is interwove n with the town...not some resort "pod". The spa is excellent, just beautiful with flowers every where....the pools are so pretty. We had an ocean view room.....the sunrise is amazing. Yes Hana is quiet...and yes there is no air conditioning. I must admit dinner was disapointing and expensive...but breakfast was very yummy. The shops are quite nice too...and the art gallery has fair prices. I am so glad we stayed in Hana...maybe it's not for everybody...but if you are looking for an unspoiled bit of heaven...you may find it here!

Reviews.Title: “the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: JREISKIN
Reviews.Content: This hotel is idyllic- a little slice of paradise-HOWEVER-the restaurant at the hotel is a total rip off. My $35.00 entree consisted of three tiny slivers of pork, a small rice cake and one tiny mushroom with bacon wrapped around it. The entire meal could have fit nicely on a hamburger bun. In other words, the portions were minute. Upon our complaints, we were informed by our waitress that they used to serve bigger portions but they ended up throwing out alot of food so they stopped. This same waitress then followed up out of the restaurant into the lobby to try to retrieve our comment card! This hotel owns the only other restaurant in Hana-we didn't try it so have no knowledge of how it is. Aside from the restaurant -this place is fabulous! We arrived on a Sunday-on that first night, the restaurant had a buffet that was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I did the third leg of our honeymoon at Hotel Hana in March, '04, after staying at the Hyatt on Kauai and the Kea Lani on Maui. Overall, it was a very nice hotel. The cottages are fantastic. They are extremely large and well appointed. Ours had a hot tub on the very large balcony. The food at the restaurant and room service was good. We were a bit surprised at how isolated we felt, though. It was definitely creepy in that regard. We got a little tired of eating in the same restaurant and there's not much around there. We were also a little disappointed in the scenery. It wasn't bad, but it was no Kauai either. It didn't take our breath away.

Reviews.Title: “Hana”
Reviews.Author: Jfed
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic place - anyone who visits Maui without traveling to Hana by car doesn't know what they're missing. And anyone who turns around the same day to return to the west or central areas of the island are making a big mistake. We had spent 4 days at Ka'anapali Beach (which we loved), but the other side of Maui is equally beautiful. The Oceanfront sea-ranch cottage we stayed was fantastic; even though the hot tub had problems for part of the ime we stayed there, this did not diminish the overall experience of our stay. The staff and management were wonderful, as was the scenery, the food, the room, and the Friday night hula/music show. The mahi-mahi plate luncheon from the ranch store was excellent, and probably the best bargain in Hawaii. The Hana-Maui definitely deserves its 5-star rating.

Reviews.Title: “What a way to start a honeymoon!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Hotel Hana-Maui to start our Maui honeymoon, and we couldn't have been happier. It won't be for every traveller, but for a couple hoping to enjoy sleeping to the sound of the crashing surf; stretching out poolside with frozen drinks, a book, and suntan lotion; and simply spending quiet time together... well, this is your place. We stayed four nights even though we had been told two was plenty of time (and three was supposedly more-than-enough). We're glad we didn't listen to the others, though, because we never felt like we were rushed... and who wants to rush their way to relaxation? A four-hour drive direct from the airport (filled with plenty of stops and sites along the way); then a couple of days to sit at the pool, get massages, and relax at the beach; and finally a couple of days to explore the hiking trails and Ohe'o Gulch at our own pace.Lunch was brought to our poolside lounge chairs, frozen drinks were delivered after a smile towards the pool attendant, and dinner was served with champagne in our sea-ranch cottage every night. I've read reviews that indicated sub-quality service, but it's just a matter of expectations -- we certainly didn't mind when the pool-attendant took a break for lunch too, particularly since he came over to ask us if there was anything we needed before he did. While some people apparently don't like that type of behavior, we thought it was a very human touch that made the glitzy places without it seem dehumanizing. (Yes, we are actually from NYC and are able to say that.)We bought breakfast food at the local store and had breakfasts on our deck while watching the sun rise (we were still on NYC-time, so we got to sleep in and still see the sun rise). The lunches were standard fare, and we're grateful that the staff suggested we take a box lunch for our drive back to Wailea -- one less thing to worry about. We particularly loved the in-room dinners, with the lights turned low and the sliding doors opened overlooking the sea!If you're looking for a slick, glitzy, chain-hotel style of vacation in Maui, stay at the Four Seasons. But if you're looking for seclusion, peace of mind, and a one-of-a-kind low-key getaway, you're not going to find a better place than an ocean-front cottage (with spa) at the Hotel Hana-Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Secluded Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was so lovely, I would go back in an instant. There is not a lot to do so kids will be bored, but if you want peace and quiet and a communion with nature, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable Wedding”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We eloped to Hana for Valentine's Day and the hotel's staff, grounds and room were truly "heavenly". Upon arrival we were greeted very warmly with a fresh flower lei, tropical juice and a cold towel. We were shuttled to our room in a Sea Ranch Cottage with spa and it was unbelievable! Huge bathroom, the most luxurious bed, cozy living area, large deck with spa and the most gorgeous ocean view. After our ceremony, upon returning to our cottage, there were rose petals laid out on our bed and around the spa, it was the most romantic thing I've ever seen. Our entire stay, the staff called us by name any time we were walking the grounds and congratulated us on our marriage. We were only there for 2 days, but the staff made us feel so welcomed that we are hoping to make this our wedding anniversary spot for many years to come. They could not have done any better to make our wedding day special.

Reviews.Title: “serenity central”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this is one of the most special places we've been. it's also not for everyone. what hotel hana does best is help you relax. it's utterly tranquil; the setting is gorgeous (and seemed to grow moreso each day, unlike other settings that wear on you quickly);
